1. lobster mashed potatoes - this was the best mashed potatoes I've had in my life. They really don't skimp on the lobster meat either you would find huge chunks, and it was like digging for treasure! The meat was also cooked just right, and it was really fresh. If you go to this restaurant, this side dish is a must get if you like lobster. 

2. Sauteed Asparagus - pretty standard just got this dish to get some veggies. 

3. Petite Filet Mignon - usually I like more flavorful cuts like ribeyes, and I don't really like filet mignons because they are lean. However this steak was so tender and cooked just right. I enjoyed it a lot. It was just the right portion, 8 oz, since I wasn't too hungry.

3. Sea Scallops - I had a small bite, the scallop was cooked just right, medium rare, and the meat was so sweet!!

Definitely recommend to come here on a special occasion, or if you won from gambling!

What is there not to love about Mastro's? Perfectly cooked and delicately tender steak is a given, as it should be for any high calibre steakhouse.  The accompanying dishes, wine pairings and cocktails were really what dining at Mastros to a higher level of excellence. 

The buttery lobster mashed potato was divinity on a plate.  Smooth, rich and very generously apportioned with large portions of lobster.  The shrimp cocktail was adorned with plump and juicy prawns (what we call them in Oz) and the accompanying horseradish really packs a strong punch. 

The only time I eat bread and butter is while dining at restaurants.  I certainly wasn't disappointed by the carefully arranged basket of bread and the purest of butter goodness at Mastros.

A rum based cocktail marked the start of our eating festivities and a good South Australian Shiraz ensured the gleeful fine dining momentum continued throughout.

Maestros is amazing! We added one more person at the last minute and the host were accommodating. We had a party at 7 and the night flew. Our server was great. Everything came out 5 stars. They must have forgot my boy friends steak but they were overly apologic and the manager brought it out himself. Portions are huge so plan accordingly. The check wasn't bad. 106$ each with tip and a lot of bottles. I got the 6oz Fliet and couldn't finish it.

Worst dining experience of my life. Came with the family for my son's 21st birthday. Reservation was at 10:00. Main course didn't come out until 2 1/2 hours later. Service was horrible. Food was barely mediocre. I wouldn't recommend this abomination of a restaurant to anyone. I am usually pretty easygoing. I can't even remember the last time I even complained about a meal. Our reservation was at 10:00pm.  We sat in the bar and had drinks until our table was ready at 10:30. We sat down and our server took our drink order while we looked over the menus. The drinks came in short order and then the fun began. We ordered several appetizers, salads and our main courses. The appetizers included tuna so our server told us that he would bring those first since they came out quickly and he wanted them to be fresh for us. They did come out first. About a half hour later. An hour into our meal we were still waiting for our salads. Our server was off working the cash register. I couldn't get his attention so I got up and went over and asked when our salads would arrive. He looked at me like I had two heads and said he didn't know we wanted them out so quickly after our appetizers. Mind you we were now over an hour into our meal and had long since eaten the appetizers which were so so. They finally showed up a half hour later. I got up again and asked to speak to the general manager. The server told me it was all his fault but I insisted on speaking to the person in charge. Eventually someone came up who introduced himself as the assistant manager. He apologized profusely, told us that section of the dining room was running slow and what could he do to help. I said please send out our meals. He looked at me quizically and asked if I really wanted my food to come out right away since we still seemed to be into our salads. I said yes just bring the food. He said right away. A half hour later our meals had not yet arrived. I found our server and told him that most of us had lost out appetites since we were so upset with the service. We wanted to cancel our food. All except the birthday boy who still wanted his steak dinner. It finally came out. He had ordered it medium. It was charred nicely on the outside but when he cut into it, it was so raw I swear I saw the slab of meat start to squirm. We had to send it back. It came back and was cooked to the right temperature. My son took a bite and said it was OK. Some tried a bite and agreed it was very mediocre. He finished and we left. The impression we left with was that they thought we made far too much of our service. In fact we had assumed that the reason the assistant manager came over was that the general manager was not working that night. Not true. She was the woman with the walkie talkie hovering about in the background we later found out. She never once came over and and seemed to have no interest in trying to help us out. Please people, if you have any compassion, boycott Mastros. HORRIBLE!!!

Dining in the tree house is such a beautiful experience.
The atmosphere has truly gone above and beyond the usual restaurants on the strip.

The food is a delicate experience in which you must savor every moment. From appetizers such as thier incredible sea food tower, to desserts like the buttercake, or everything in between like thier incredible sides that compliment every entree. Mastro's is a must try.

From romantic dinners to corporate outings there is a seat for everyone at Mastro's Ocean Club.

It's always a spectacular experience when we come here. Our waiter was superb and had many excellent suggestions. We ordered the seafood platter which is my favorite dish to get and of course all of our entrees were just as good! I don't know what to say but that every follower is well spent whenever we visit. We came to celebrate our engagement with my soon to be in laws and had a blast! This is always our come to spot for all our special occasions!

Hands down one of the best restaurants on the strip! The steaks come out on a 400 degree sizzling plate and the sides are to die for! I'm a regular here and come every week. The staff is amazing, the management is outstanding and my favorite bartender is Randy!!! Although a little pricey it is worth every single dollar! I don't know what i would do without this amazing restaurant. Keep up the amazing work!.

We were in Scottsdale for the weekend and wanted to have a great steak!  This place was recommended by some friends.  We shared some appetizers, oysters, tuna tartar and the beef carpaccio.  They were great, I would recommend the tuna as it was amazing!  Followed by a ribeye grilled to a perfect medium!!  The steak came out sizzling on a 400 degree plate!  We also shared some side, mushrooms, scalloped potato and some asparagus.  The sides were alright but I'd have to say that this steak was probably one of the best I've ever had!!  Highly recommend this restaurant!!
Enjoyed another scrumptious meal. My absolute favorite is the Chilean Sea Bass. It's always so flaky, tender and the best in town.  We had excellent Service from Michael.

Business dinner while in Vegas. The appetizer tower to start was just over the top good. My God. Dinner was good and desert was some sort of soaked pound cake. Wow. 

Just glad I wasn't paying...

With all the 5 star reviews, I was expecting to get wowed by this place.

The restaurant is pretty cool looking, and the waitstaff was excellent though the hostesses were not very hospitable.

There were 4 of us dining here and we thought the food was not very good.  Bland!!!

I had the bone-in ribeye which is the only steak I order and the flavor was just bland. Another person ordered the Chilean sea bass and we both agreed that it simply lacked flavor.  The lobster mashed potatoes did not taste good to all 4 of us.

The only thing I enjoyed there was the pretzel bread and their warm butter cake.

First off the seafood tower was amazing but everything after that was hands down one of the worst experiences I have ever had. We ordered a wagyu steak that was over $100 and it was served well done although we asked for MEDIUM RARE. The manager treated us like peasants when we brought this to his attention, walked away before we found a resolution, and ignored us for over 15 minutes following the encounter. They then brought us an ice cold steak to try to resolve the situation. I unfortunately had a client dinner here next week with my CEOs but I will have to cancel because I cannot take a business risk.

Best Mastro's experience ever! Peter was our server and he was phenomenal. He went over the menu with us, as well as wine and cocktails. He helped with pairing the best wines with our entrees. I was so impressed! To top it off, the managers Aaron and Daniel came to make sure everything was perfect. Our entrees were spot on perfect! I will come here every time I come to Vegas. Best steak I've ever had!!! Best service I've ever had! Love it!

Reservation was at 9:30 but didn't get seated until 10 and was given some excuse that someone bought the whole wood area and it affected the rest of the reservations.  

They treated us as we were small potatoes compared to the large group.

Will not go to any Mastor's again.

Food was good though.

Need to blow off that easy money you just took from the casinos and treat yourself to a neat dinner in a unique spot which calls out for attention the moment you walk into Aria?

Enter Mastro's, the ever popular chain of steaks that knows just how to let you indulge and live it large on a nice meal.  And as for pricing, it's actually pretty fair as you get a ton of great service, and most importantly, great food.  

The steak would be the only thing I get to be a snob about.  For instance, the meat was a little tough and although they've caramelized it, I can't but imagine thinking of how similar it tastes to Ruth's Cris.  But luckily, the other sides gave it supreme justice.

I got the bone in rib eye, at medium rare, so it should have been tender, but somehow wasn't.  The flavor was just buttery and I just wish there was more.  
Just to make things interesting, I turf'd it up with combination of jumbo shrimp scampi.  The amazing garlic sweltering sauce which had a parmesean bread crisp  reside next to made all the difference in the meal as the big shrimps were engulfed with flavor from the buttery garlic sauce.  

For sides, we shared the following:
-Roasted Brussel Sprouts - pretty basic, but satisfying
-Cream of Spinach - so damn heavy and big its a good thing we only limited ourselves to 2 sides only on top of our surfs.

Overall, I enjoyed my meal, but would I come back?  Probably not, or to any of the other locations for that matter at the time being.

Fantastic meal last weekend... only exceeded by the service.  Our server, Lloyd, was put to the test with a table full of highly inebriated and hungry folks, and he passed with flying colors (or maybe it was the fireworks going on outside the restaurant).  Our food was stunning, even though I was served the smallest kumumoto oysters I've ever seen.  Three of us had fish and the other three had steaks.  Everyone was highly pleased with their meal, but again, Lloyd stole the show with amazing service, a great sense of humor, and attention to detail.  The six of us managed to get out of there for $600 before the tip, which I think is not too shabby given the $40-$50+ per entree cost.  The Dungeness crab appetizer was one of my highlights and my blackened Florida grouper was absolutely perfectly cooked to medium.  I highly recommend this place for a special meal or for any celebration.

I like this one better than the one in Newport. *gasp*

The one in Newport is kind of dark / crowded and while this one is technically in a mall, I like the setting better. 

The menu is identical I think. Very good. I like the scallops. I like the lemon drop. Great food. Great service. This restaurant is beautiful. I like the CityCenter overall and Mastro's is a great part of it.

I've reviewed other locations, so I'll keep it simple.

Bone in Filet

Mastro mash

Start with seafood tower of Claws, legs,tail and shrimp

Malbec to wash down with

Hit the strip

This is one of the best restaurants on the strip.  The wait staff is outstanding, the food is terrific and overall they give the impression that they care about everything.  There were five of us having dinner and everyone thought the restaurant was outstanding and most of all memorable.

I give 5 stars for Elizabeth, the berry blast cocktail, the lobster mashed potatoes, the calamari sauce, and the creamed spinach.

I give 3.5 stars for the seared tuna (sliced thinner than any place I've ever seen), the bone in ribeye (one grain of salt away from being too salty) and the rack of lamb (charred too much on the outside).

Overall it was a good meal but I wouldn't order the lamb again. I only ate one chop and took the rest to go. The seared tuna was a huge let down too. Also, we didn't receive a complimentary desert for our anniversary despite receiving well wishes from several members of staff. It's no big deal but reading the other reviews it seems that it's generally given to everyone else celebrating. Next time we will skip the appetizers and enjoy cocktails/steak/sides.

Yeah yeah, this place is great (ribeye, lobster mashed potatoes, truffle crab gnocchi, butter cake). 

Comparing CRAFTSTEAK??

Service: Waaaaaaay better at Mastro's. Craftsteak reminds me of being on a Caribbean cruise, and that's NOT a good thing.

Food: Larger portions and better execution at Mastro's. Craftsteak seemed oversalted on its steaks and lacking on everything else.

Ambiance: *see Service comments :)
Another great dinner there last night.  Filet great as usual.  My wife had the Tuna which was delicious.  Maybe our favorite place in town.

Been coming here since they opened. Unfortunately, only once a year. 
Friday 8/26/16 I went for all the great reasons  one goes here for......
I ordered the the great ahi tuna tostada-y appetizer.  About two bites in I noticed a long black hair. Ugh...
The response and actions by the staff and manager was remarkable.  We all have miserable things happen at work and this is probably their biggest nightmare. 
Congrats O club personnel, you and your restaurant still rank as one of the best!

Looking forward to next year ...

Mastro's Ocean Club is a gem that you cannot miss next time you're on the Strip.  Located in the newly designed City Center, just look for the beautifully designed "tree house", which hangs high above the ultra chic boutiques in Crystals that only the richest of the rich can actually shop in.  Be sure to request a table inside the tree house...it's where all the cool kids sit. 

Mastro's is not cheap, but then again, nothing in Vegas is.  In any case, it's worth every penny because the food is outstanding.  I started off with a very rich and tasty New England Clam Chowder.  For my entree, I went with the porcini mushroom crusted sea bass with fried spinach.  It was light but delicious!! Perfect for lunch.  For the side dish, what else but the lobster mashed potatoes! I'm not talking about lobster flavored mashed potatoes.  No, no, not at Mastro's.  I'm talking about over a pound of lobster mixed in the mashed potatoes.  It was soooo good and was big enough that all four of us could enjoy it with plenty to spare.  Although we were happily stuffed, our waiter brought out their signature butter cake with fresh whipped cream on the side for dessert; with his compliments (a very nice touch, which only further highlighted the tremendous service that we had during our entire meal). I highly recommend getting this dessert no matter how full you are. We all loved it.

I should note that the cocktails were also great.  Make sure you get one of their signature martinis, which comes with dry ice on the bottom of the glass that makes the drink bubble and emit smoke.  Pretty cool. 

Although I was able to get a table for four for lunch on a Saturday with ease through OpenTable, that won't last long because the restaurant only opened up 2 weeks ago and the buzz is still building.  Soon, Mastro's will one of the hottest tables in Vegas so get in while you can.

Okay the food here is AMAZING! For starters I recommend the crab cake or the ahi tuna. The bone in filet mignon is to die for and the butter cake is the only dessert you should ever order. 

Now, that being said I have given this place two tries and if you're going to eat here you better have plenty of time and no plans for the rest of the night. The first time was with my husband for my birthday and it took about an hour to get our appetizers and the restaurant was far from occupied. Not only did it take an hour but then the appetizers were burnt and had to be made again. We ended up being so late that we had to get our food to go. The second time we didn't make any plans but the service was very mediocre. The bussers kept bumping into my chair, the server disappeared for a while, the food took a long time (as expected) and when it came time for dessert they brought us out a cake for our anniversary and left before I could order a butter cake for dessert. I would have gladly paid for it but the next time we saw the waiter he dropped the check and left again. 

The food really is amazing. There isn't much ambiance and maybe my expectations are always too high for the service.

We were celebrating my wife's's bday, service was outstanding, we were in a bit of a rush to catch a show, and they were very accommodating. The scallops were out of this world and the ribeye was worth every penny. Only regret is not having more time to enjoy the moment.

Yelpers enticed us here--and we are glad we came. 
We started with the Dungeness Crab Cocktail. It was great, too tantalizing to wait and take a photo; we only could do so once we took a break. Delicious morsels of crab stacked in a bowl over dry-ice. The red cocktail sauce has some horseradish-but if you like it hot, ask for some on the side. 
We planned to order one of the healthy vegetable side dishes but our waiter Jonathan ("Johnny") gave such a wonderful description of the lobster mashed potatoes that we couldn't resist. 
Unless you're big eaters, the way to go is to split a steak. At the next table over it looked as though their steak was cut in half before cooking. But Jonathan suggested that he cut our bone-in Kansas City Strip into slices after cooking, served on a plate "in the middle."  This was perfect.  Highly recommended. We couldn't even finish our halves of this delicious, well-cooked "medium" steak. 
The mashed potatoes were just as described. Great. A big splurge, but this dish added to our memorable meal. 
Too bad no "desert pocket" left for the longed for Butter cake.  Next time. 
If you're looking for a place for one of those meals you savor not only at the time but also in your memory for a long time, excellent food served by a pro, Mastro's is your place and Jonathan, who's been here since they opened, is the waiter you want.

I have now had two amazing meals here and can't wait to return.  The steaks, lobster mashed potatoes, and that brown butter cake are the must orders for me.  Sitting in the tree house is quite nice and I love hearing the live music from the bar.  The service is excellent as well.  I love being greeted by the friendly woman at the front.  (It's a pet peeve of mine when nice places put bitchy girls at the front who act like they are bothered that you showed up - ugh.)  The front people are so friendly, even on super busy nights.  All around - this is a really top notch place.

I was able to go to Mastro's for the first time ever and I'm glad my first experience was the tree house seating at the Las Vegas location with my best friend and spouse. We made reservations for our Best- Friendaversary :-) and we all were looking forward to going. Our expectations were all exceeded. I've never tasted flavors like those served at Mastro's. 

So, we ordered the smoked salmon appetizer for starters, blackened chilien seabass, a 12oz medium bone in filet, herb roasted chicken, garlic mash, creamed spinach and the Gorgonzola mac n cheese. OMG! Everything was delicious. We all ate off of each other's plates so we sort of had the whole surf and turf combo going since we all order different main dishes. 

Of course we couldn't without saving some room for the delicious warm butter cake which is like no other cake I've ever had. Served with best wishes to me and my best friend by Lionel. He was great and I won't forget him. He made my first dining experience at Mastro's very well worth it and I hope every time I go the environment and culture is the same.

BtW the Lemon Drops we amazing!!!

What's that expression that a lot of us foolhardy guys toss about as soon as we get to Vegas? "Go big, or go home"? It basically gives us a free pass to indulge in things that are extravagant, luxurious and potentially dangerous. And Mastro's fits well within this criteria: the place holds meals fit for royalty, the decor is immaculate, and it can be hazardous to your wallet's health if you are not prepared. But for those of us still reading, and certainly for those of us who have had the honor, Mastro's is a must-dine destination if you're in town.

Located pretty centrally in the City Center shopping district, it's almost impossible to miss Mastro's: the opulent, wood-like "fishbowl" perched precariously at an elevation is definitely eye-catching, and I'm pretty sure I inadvertently photobombed countless tourists as they stopped to take pictures of this structure, which is actually a dining room. Before you can get to your table, you stop by a tiny hostess desk flanked by two gals who wasted no time getting us seated once we checked in with our reservation. You'll more than likely walk past an offshoot to another, more private dining room, a pretty spectacular bar and then make your way into the main dining room that is expertly laid out: whoever did the layout here did so in such a way that seating is maximized but not once does it feel crowded. And this is even more impressive when you consider the polished staff is zipping about without hesitation or collision.

And let's talk about the staff, right quick: simply put, these are professionals who know their craft inside and out. Our waiter, Lionel, was the epitome of providing an exceptional customer service experience. We were -THAT- table that upfront told him we had a show to catch later that evening, and without missing a beat, he assured us he would keep us on schedule and would not let the meal be compromised. His service, along with the refills and bussing provided by other staff members, made for the best, most efficient dining experience I have seen yet in years of visiting Vegas. Add in a visit from a manager who just stopped by to chat and make sure everything was cool, and you have a place with a team that cannot be topped.

But all the friendliness and attention to detail means nothing if the food is bogus, and Mastro's has this base covered, too. Oh, do they ever. My folks started with a bowl of clam chowder and a caesar salad, while I went with the lobster bisque. All three were perfect pre-show snacks for the main courses, and just typing this sentence out is making me drool with fond remembrance. Ahem. 

Mom went with a red snapper that was cooked to perfection and my surf-and-turf combo of a filet and lobster tail (which Lionel was gracious enough to de-shell table side like a boss) ranks among the best I've had at any place around the world. But the most surprising part was when Dad sheepishly admitted he had somehow never had sea bass before... and now that bar is set unfathomably high as his Chilean sea bass here was his favorite meal of this trip. A side of creamed corn and scalloped potatoes rounded out dinner, and wiped out my stomach. Somehow, my folks found room for Mastro's signature dessert, a butter cake that made me question how a chef can bake happiness, joy and euphoria into one pastry. It's that good (even though I had two bites and almost went into a coma with the straight gin I was drinking).

I cannot say enough positive things about Mastro's. From the staff to the overall "look" of the place, and most assuredly the culinary satisfaction each plate offers, it's a place that rewards all those who stop by for a drink or a bite to eat. Take those winnings from the casino and invest them here: I promise it's a much better deal than your favorite variation of Blackjack.

I LOVED my experience at Mastro's! Exceptional service from the hostess, server, and sommelier.

Every single thing we had tasted delicious. I had Sea Bass, it was perfect. Our table had steak, appetizers, and an array of sides. Highly recommend letting the Sommelier pair a wine with your order. Also, you MUST have the butter cake dessert! 

I will be back for sure.

As a 'local' in this town, it is one of our favorites, with the reason being that the portion sizes are so large that you will have left overs for at least one meal!  The prices do support this, but once you divide it by 2 or 3 I feel it is worth it.

The wait staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.  They are excellent at giving you the actual methods of preparation, ingredients, etc. on any item vs. places where they basically repeat what is written on the menu (yes, I can read).

The lobster bisque is sublime.  The creamed spinach is wonderful.  The fish and seafood I have had each time was perfectly cooked and very tasty.  And above all else...be sure to save room for the warm butter cake!

I feel bad for the tourists that usually leave so much on the table.  Me....I'm walking out with my doggy bag!
One of the best steakhouses in Vegas if not the best! Had the wagyu Australian rib eye med rare. Great steak. Always great service also. Definitely check out mastros at aria if you have not. A++

The restaurant is located in a mall which doesn't usually scream fine dinning. However the food and service are excellent. I would suggest the seafood tower! You pick from a large selection of fresh seafood. Comes out smoking with dry ice.

Came here a couple weeks ago with my girlfriend and had absolutely the best seafood I have had in a long time.  We started off with a couple cosmos which are my favorite at the Ocean Club because they seem to be never ending and they use dry ice to keep it exceptionally cold!  For our entree we chose the seafood tower (see pic) which was amazing and a ton of food!  After that we could not eat anything more except desert and our waitress Shauna told us the Butter Cake could not be beat and she was right.  I would definitely recommend  Mastro's Ocean Club for a fine dining experience... the service is spectacular, the food is spectacular and the restaurant is very cool.

Live music, good food, really well made drinks! Pretty fun crowd in the bar area on the weekends.  No reservation required. Service is top notch, very attentive.  Would go back and try more from the menu, just had the lobster bisque and the butter cake.  Order the butter cake, it's delicious!!

The food?  mostly great. The service? just ok. The setting? really loud, hard to hear others at our table. 

We had six at our table, most of whom ordered the sea bass. One of the six felt it was oddly slim cut and dried out. I got mine blackened and it was delicious. Calamari was nicely done. Salads were fine. Wine list is decent.

Main complaint: wide open space, really loud and not good for conversation. Our waiter had so many tables he could only allow us a very limited amount of attention. What do you expect for a minimum of $100/ person?

There hasn't been one experience where I haven't loved ocean club. For any occasion that comes my way, my first instinct is to go to ocean club. The wonderful service , interior and food makes this a five star gourmet restaurant. I recommend who is willing to pay for their buck to come here because you will never leave not satisfied. If i had the option to come here every night I would hands down do so. Birthdays, anniversary's or graduations, this place makes it the best place to celebrate with class.

Here is how I would break down my review 

Service - 5 (great service and even removed the charge for my steak)
Appetizers - 5 (ahi tuna, stone crab legs, and shrimp all rocked)
Steak - 3 (1st was medium well, 2nd was rare...medium rare is not that hard!)
Sides - 4 (mac and cheese, steamed spinach,  and brussel sprouts)
Desert - 5 (butter cake is where it's at)
Atmosphere - 3 (I like the funky "tree house", but sitting in the middle or a mall adds a little bit of a "food court" feel)
It's a bit overrated, service is great but food is mediocre,  I may give it another chance but tonight I was disappointed.
Delicious restaurant overall. Had crab cakes as appetizer, 16 oz ny strip which was absolutely delicious, and as mentioned the butter cake dessert is a must. Overall great restaurant.
Great service, good food. Place stays busy so set reservations and enjoy.

So let me first start off by saying I don't eat seafood. At all. Allergies make life fun. 

With that in mind, I'd actually be giving this place a 4/5, but I can't say that as everyone came out very happy, including myself. The only drawback I had was the steak, an 18oz NY Strip on the bone that was nothing particularly special, but definitely adequate. When I say adequate, I mean a steak I'd expect to get at a mom and pop 'steakhouse' in the midwest, not one of the nicer places in Las Vegas. 

Mastro's has one of the coolest locations in Las Vegas. The exterior bar in the Crystal Shops is flanked by retailers like Audmers Piguet, Tom Ford and Richard Mille....I mean, its hard to walk into the restaurant when so many cool shops are right next to it....but hey, that's neither here nor there. It actually has nothing to do with the review, I just love watches. Actually, the interior design probably plays into other people's reviews, so...uh...idk, 5/5? Would interior decorate appreciate again?

The staff was amazingly attentive, down to Earth and incredibly good at their jobs. I was incredibly impressed with the knowledge of the somm, and our waiter was very, very good at his job. 

Everyone got appetizers, the foie gras was incredibly good...and I foolishly shared with another at the table. Given the portion was like 2 bites in total, I got one. Still damn good. 

Dinner came; steak was decent, potato was...well, a potato...hard to do anything with a simple starch that would be categorized as amazing, but it was an overall good meal. Everyone at the table raved about their seafood though, like...they loved the place. 

If you're still reading this, ha. But yeah, I personally think 4/5 due to 'meh' steak, but overall I'd definitely come back for the great staff, great location and great wine list.

First off, the service was outstanding. As per my request, they were able to save us a table inside the tree house near the edge, so we had a nice view of the architecture around us. Our server Sam managed to be attentive and informative without being too intrusive and asking us how the food was every few seconds, which I thoroughly appreciated. 

Usually I don't talk about the bread basket, but this one was pretty good. The bread was warm and soft, but waay too much for two people. On to the main courses: the rack of lamb was tender, juicy, and perfectly medium rare..kind of wish there was a bit more seasoning though. The bone-in ribeye was just as tender and more to my liking, although the outside seemed pretty charred...

After we were done with the mains, we barely had any room left for dessert, but I kept reading reviews for the warm butter cake, so we ordered it to share. The cake came with a HUGE helping of whipped cream on the side and a big scoop of ice cream on top...naturally, we couldn't finish it and asked to have it wrapped up. The cake was moist and the layer of crunch outside from the caramelized sugar was great, but overall, it was too sweet. =(  

We definitely made a good choice coming here. The food and service was all really good. Will definitely try to come back again next time we're in town.

What a wonderful place for a date! If you're a bourbon fan, they have Blanton's, yum.. The service was pretty good, the portions are huge, and the steak was delicious. The lobster mash was okay, but I could live without it. The gnocchi was tasty. The macaroni and cheese was forgettable. Next time, I think I will do without the sides.

We stopped by at Mastro's for our Valentines Day Dinner last night.  When we arrived we were sat inside their Treehouse.....a fairly unique dining experience.  The Treehouse is their main dining area which is shaped like a Treehouse that overlooks the center of the Crystals' Mall.

For starters, we ordered their stone crabs abd lobser bisque.....both were very average.   The bisque was watery....not very thick and rich.

For our entrees, we had the sea bass and rack of lamb....both very flavorful and super tasty.  For sides, we had their creamed corn and lobster truffled gnocci....both were extremely, extremely rich (too much cream and truffled cheese).....but very flavorful.

For desert, we had their famous butter pound cake with ice cream and chocolate starwberrries......the cake was very average......I can get more flavorful pound cake at Safeway...the chocolate strawberries were good, but nothing spectacular.

The service was average at best.   Overall, the food was good, not great. One extra star for the cool treehouse dining experience.

I've been to nearly every top steakhouse in town, and you can't get a better steak anywhere. It's not just a great seafood place, it's a world - class steakhouse too. Food, service, atmosphere is all top, top notch. Worth every penny.

Service was wonderful. I accidentally made a reservation with the Malibu location and they were able to seat us immediately anyways. Staff was incredibly friendly and we were greeted several times for water, bread, menus, etc. 

The menu is extensive and delicious. It was difficult deciding on a drink with so many amazing choices. Although I wanted to try the in house infused vodka's - the red wine recommended by our server paired nicely with our filets. 

We each ordered a filet and shared the lobster mashed potatoes. This was an incredibly amount of food. We weren't able to finish the lobster mash. We ordered medium filets with the black truffle butter. They were delicious albeit over cooked, which was a bit of a disappointment for a $52 steak. The lobster in the lobster mashed potatoes although plentiful was also over cooked and a bit chewy. Not a soft melt in your mouth lobster which was also a bummer. 

For dessert (which we did save room for since no appetizers were ordered) we couldn't decide between the flourless pudding cake (GF) served molten lava style or the creme brûlée (GF) - so when in Vegas - get both! And then we needed to be rolled out. They were amazing. The flourless cake was incredibly rich and neither of us were able to finish it. The creme brûlée had vanilla bean and was light and perfect. 

Our server George was great. He suggested a wonderful wine and was very knowledgeable on the menu and the ingredients the kitchen uses - which is helpful for me being gluten free. 

Our water was never near empty and servers weren't hovering over us obnoxiously and came and went with ease, barely interrupting our dinner conversation. 

The ambience of the restaurant is really cool as is the architecture. It does feel a little weird eating at such a classy establishment in a mall. 

The steak with the truffle butter was probably one of the top 5 I've ever had. Had it not been overcooked - likely could have been top 3. The meal overall was the most expensive we've ever had and it was good - but not the best we've ever eaten. For the price we paid, I would have expected close to perfection on every front.  

I'm struggling with either a 3 star or 4 star. This place has the potential to be 5 stars if the steaks are cooked properly and the lobster isn't overcooked.

This is my new favorite restaurant and I've been to most of the nicer spots in Vegas.  Great atmosphere (in Crystals shopping) and the food is simply amazing.  I had the sea bass and my husband had a filet -- both were beyond exceptional.  But the piece de resistance was their dessert.  We had their signature butter cake and it was literally the best thing I have ever tasted!  They are always busy so make sure to make a reservation!

So disappointed in this Mastro's. My fiancé and I love Mastro's in Beverly Hills, we love the food but most importantly the service is great! We decided to celebrate my birthday in Vegas and what better way than to have dinner at Mastro's in Vegas. We had in mind it was going to be just as great if not better than Beverly Hills, but that was not the case at all. Upon arriving the table we were seated at was so close to the next table it was so uncomfortable I had to apologize to the couple sitting next to us in advance before getting through to my seat, and we were pushed right up against a wall where all the waiters and waitresses are constantly coming in and out of.

Our waiter was nice but he spoke so fast and also had a very heavy accent that we just could not understand what he was saying or explaining to us. My fiance' ordered steak and it had to be taken back twice because it was just too noticeably under cooked. After we ate we were looking forward to having their famous butter cake that we always have upon celebrating a special occasion and we ended up just paying our bill and leaving. We were really disappointed and most likely will not be returning back to this Mastro's.

Actually 4.5, but not a choice here.

So good! They know steak. The ahi tuna plate was delicious as well. Mac and cheese was sinful. I also had the Ceasar salad, mushrooms, garlic mashed potatoes and butter cake for dessert. Everything was great, but the steak, ahi and mac and cheese were phenomenal. 

The place is cool. We sat in the tree dome looking section. It's also nice to have Tiffany's and Louis V. right next door.

Our table was up against another seating booth which I didn't like. I don't like strangers so close to me, especially when I'm eating. Don't want to listen to them and I'm sure they don't want to listen to me. Service was decent, but they were busy.

Had one last opportunity in Vegas to try out a highly rated restaurant and left very disappointed that it was wasted here.  The warm spinach salad was drenched in sauce and the ahi tuna tostada appetizer didn't taste very fresh.  The entrees do not come with anything else...no side pasta, potatoes, or salad.  So, if you order a bland grilled dried swordfish, that's it, that is all you get for $40 on a large plate.  Presentation in the food was not there for a so-called high-end restaurant.  The blackened scallop was so salty that it was difficult to eat it.  We celebrated our birthdays there and got a very dried complimentary chocolate cake.  We did order their signature butter cake also, and that was decent.  But, for $16, we have definitely tasted much better for less.  Overall, the ambience is nice.  Service was nothing to rave about, and food was very average.  Cost didn't match the overall underwhelmed experience.  If you are willing to spend, go somewhere else.

I love good seafood and great martini's and this place will not disappoint. You will need a bit of extra dough though as it's priced as  high as the quality of the food, but with every penny for a special occasion.

Service, food, ambiance just what it should be. Pricey ? Yes , and worth every penny from the cocktails, bread, Shrimp appetizer, to fabulous dinner choices. 
Friendly bar patrons and bartenders for just a cocktail. Love Ocean Club! Thank you! Never disappointed.

Service was great hence the 2 stars but I don't understand what the hype was all about. Our steak was part dry part medium rare in some area, our Seabass was super salty. We also ordered cream of spinach they made it extra creamy but that's my fault, it's expected.

Love this restaurant! We had a wonderful experience there. Top-notch service and great food. Came here last week with my sister and my bf. We made reservation for 7:30 but we were about 15 mins late. The staff were really nice and didn't make us wait for our seats. We were seated almost immediately. Right when we were seated, the server asked us if we cared for any drinks and offered us a warm towel to wipe our hands with. He also explained EVERYTHING on the menu which I thought was awesome. 

My sister and I ordered two cocktails ($18/each for the cocktails) and we shared the salmon as a main course. For appetizer we had the escargot and oysters on the half shell. My bf ordered the filet mignon ($50+) but it was really tender and cooked to perfection. We also had the lobster mashed potatoes which I thought was great. The bill came out to be over $250 but I think it was well worth it for the great food, atmosphere and service.

I would suggest requesting for a seat inside the birdnest because every table is separated with a glass so it's very unique.

Been here now three times.  Also been to the one in Newport Beach CA.  You absolutely cannot go wrong dining here.  Service, Appetizers, Drinks, and FOOD is simply amazing.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  It's going to cost you, but it's TOTALLY worth it.  Save your nickels and make this a fun event for you and people you care about.

Don't believe the hype. Started off with the lobster bisque soup of which the lobster was chewy. My friend had the heirloom and barrata salad and it was fairly decent. We shared the ribeye which was a bit dry but bloody if that can even happen. As a side we had the lobster mashed potatoes that had pieces of the lobster shell mixed in which brutalized my gums. We also had the sautéed asparagus that never made it to our table but we can only imagine what that would have tasted like. 

As far as service our waiter was good and the team that assisted him was good as well. I was disappointed that I had to box my own food for the price I paid but hey it is what it is.

We all had high expectations for this place and I must admit the expectations were met! Normally I am not a fan of "steakhouses" so I was pleased that my parents wanted to go to a seafood/steak place for their 35th wedding anniversary. I've been to City Hall in old town for steaks before and have always been pleased, so I think I knew what to expect from Ocean Club.

We arrived and were seated right away (with reservation on a Sunday night). They have a very large bar area (well known in the area as cougar hunting grounds) which looked nice and fully stocked. I think the bar area is actually larger than the dining room. The cocktails on the menu were expensive, far more expensive that the average for the area (approx $20 each), and they weren't that fantastic. But the wine and beer selection was fairly good.

Now, on to the food - We started with oysters which were SO fresh. I am always hesitant eating any seafood in Arizona (or anywhere landlocked) but you could really taste the ocean. Our server informed us that they fly in their seafood daily so ensure freshness. Not good for my global footprint, but I will accept the freshness none the less. Both the boyfriend and I got steak and lobster tail. I got mine with the small filet (6oz) and it was lovely and cooked perfectly. My boyfriend had the New York cut and seemed to really enjoy it. My father got the Mahi Mahi and also enjoyed it alot, I was surprised at the large portion of the Mahi. They offered to cook it a variety of ways, he chose to have it grilled with lemon. We also had the lobster mashed potatoes and asparagus on the side. The lobster mashed potatoes had huge pieces of lobster in it, but was under seasoned. In fact, everyone put salt on their steak/fish/sides throughout the evening and we aren't big salt eaters. I suppose I would rather my food under salted vs over salted but you'd think when you pay so much money they would get the balance right for you.

All in all, the service was great, the food was good, and we had an enjoyable celebration. This place is very expensive but I'd say it's worth it for a special occasion.

We have been going to this Mastros location for the last 4 years and never had any complaints, it has always been our favorite steakhouse. Now, we went for my boyfriends birthday last night with 8 of our friends and we did not experience the same taste that we were used to. Our server, i wish i remembered his name, was very nice. The dreamberry cocktail was outstanding. Most of us ordered steak of course which usually comes out pipping hot but this time it was luke warm at most. Although we did not voice our complaint none of us were happy with our steaks. The sides were good, creamed spinach and macaroni and cheese. I'm saddened to say I dont think we will be coming back any time soon. I believe we will continue with Stripsteak at the Mandalay Bay which is Excellent.

Diet is on vacation when we come here, the ambience is divine and being in kierland is a bonus.
I have had steak, lamb, fish and seafood here and it has always been sooo good! Unfortunately the Brussels are so inconsistent here tho. Sometime super charred and over buttery or else not enough char and no flavor lol 
Oh well can't win them all.....the drinks are amazing and the wine list GREAT
We are chocoholics so we usually order the massive chocolate cake slice but we have had the butter cake and the key lime pie and it's divine!!
The service is perfect always!

The usual great live entertainment in a brightly lit mall setting. Bone in ribeye is perfectly seasoned. Appetizers and sides are great for sharing among 2 to 3 people. I recommend the Mambo Salad, sugar snap peas, and the lobster mash! Eating in a mall just doesn't feel as nice although we did see Tyson Chandler from the Mavs. Dessert is also a huge portion...enough to feed 3-4!

The service is beyond friendly, but for $150 for the Waygu, I would of appreciated it not being salted to all hell. Couldn't appreciate the meat itself because I was busy downing water and could only taste salt. Cmon.

What can I say about this place ! Its amazingggg love love everything the appetizers are super good and the butter cake is heaven the service is excellent ThankYou this restaurant is my husbands and I favorite :)

I love this place. I went here with my mother in 2010 for my 21st birthday dinner. We had chilled dungeness crab, king crab, and shrimp. The waitstaff was incredibly attentive and made my birthday all that much more special. I cannot wait to bring my husband here for his birthday week in Las Vegas!

I liked the enironment , the vibe, the waitress is so welcoming, and nice. The food is abit overrated I had a ribeye at that time, their cocktails are great. The guys that brings bread and fill your water did hit my chair several times without apologizing. Other than that it's a great place

Don't usually go out to the club .......  
but when I do, I go to the ocean  club !!!
One of my favorite restaurants in the world  . This place has been super from day 1. Over 10 years and still the best !!!

First for the foodies.  I've never been disappointed with a meal at Ocean Club.  The food is easily 4 stars.  It is always prepared how you ask, and have never felt out of line letting a server know if something is wrong.  The service is always great, plenty of attention, bussers keep the table clean, and if any member of the staff sees that you need something, they are happy to oblige.  I have had several cuts of steak, sea bass, and most of the appetizers.  I can't think of a single thing I've ordered and not been pleased.  Although drinks are expensive, it's worth ordering a martini because they give you the shaker with almost a full refill for your glass.  As far as nice meals go, Ocean Club hits the mark on every level.

The only reason I give this specific Mastro's 3 stars is strictly personal preference of atmosphere.  This place is BUSY!!!  Possibly too busy to really enjoy a fine meal.  It's definitely a social "place to be seen".  Evening gowns, expensive suits and colorful characters are not uncommon.  There is a special energy to this restaurant.  But that's where it crosses the fine line of dining and a social club.  I've sat in the bar dining area at a high top and felt like a sardine.  The table is not big enough for a bottle of wine and your food.  There are so many employees that you can't really have a long conversation without being interrupted.  And there is so much traffic, you feel like someone is going to crash into you at any moment.  Again, it's only personal preference that if I'm going to drop 2 or 3 hundred on a meal, I want some space to enjoy it.  For a special occasion to connect with company, try Mastro's steak house on Pinnacle or City Hall in Scottsdale.  Exact same food, more relaxed atmosphere and room to appreciate your company and a great meal.

My Girlfriend had told me about this place and although it had great reviews for a steakhouse. I thought it was just okay. The service was great which was a plus, but I thought the food was just okay. Maybe we're just used to the more traditional and old-fashioned steakhouses. There didn't seem to be much of a dress code and the steak (Ribeye) was too fatty for our taste. We didn't want anything lean, but this was too fatty. The best side to me was the creamed corn and the clam chowder soup was the highlight of my dinner. I will say it was my first time having clam chowder. The ambiance was not exciting at all. (Not for an *upscale* steakhouse. I don't think I'll come back unless I'm going to try the seafood or the butter cake.
Excellent restaurant. Truly classy dining experience and the butter cake lived up to the hype. Perfect restaurant to spend my husbands 40th birthday.
Mastro's ocean club is one of Scottsdale's premier dining experiences.  The food is always top quality and the cocktails are always very well made.

Nothing less than the best! Each and every time we have dined @ Mastros we have been treated impeccably! Sam is by far my favorite waitress! She took care of us with attention to detail compared to none. The steaks are perfect and the warm butter cake is a must have on each visit! Fit for a queen!
Great food and service. It was exactly what I expected. We enjoy the Beverly Hills location and wanted to enjoy the same in Vegas. The food was great and service was flawless!

The manager on duty, Rudy, should work at McDonald's vs. Mastro's. He is unprofessional. Not only was he rude to our party of 6 ladies who arrived in a vintage Rolls-Royce stretch limo to have a quick cocktail for our friend's 40th bday but he was also rude to the staff that works for him. I don't think Mastro's wants this guy associated with their brand. Investigation, reprimanding and/or training is warranted!
Beautiful Restaurant and impeccable service.  Request to eat in the treehouse and enjoy.

Was there while in Las Vegas for business. My hosts were contractors on the project and we maybe got a little extra pampering. There were 7 of us. 

Food is incredible. We didn't order appetizers, but a couple of us did have salads. The entrees around the table were steaks, swordfish, and seared tuna. We shared the stellar mashed potatoes, along with creamed corn and broccoli. For desert, they just left us the desert tray. We couldn't finish it! 

Service is second to none. Everything you would expect.

Simply immaculate. From the location, treehouse structure, service, and the food. We came here for an early Valentine's dinner. My husband and I shared the Wagyu tomahawk, I had a lobster and we ordered a couple sides. Everything was superb!! I can't wait to come back to try other options.

Absolutely perfect in every way.  We spotted this place when we were first checking out the Phoenix area before we lived here.  Since it's a bit pricey we said to ourselves, this is where we will come after we move here and have something special to celebrate.  And that we did last night. I was a little concerned after reading some reviews about the busy-ness and it was a Friday night after all.  So I half expected we may be disappointed.  But, between being sat within a few minutes of our arrival, being greeted by the staff, taking our initial drink order, etc ... everyone and everything arrived in a timely and very professional and presentable manner.  In the lounge area, there IS a band playing and for us, we would prefer a bit more quiet as it was difficult at times to hear each other or our waiter.  But, the food and the service more than made up for any slight hearing impairment.  Expect to pay.  Drinks are $20.  My 2lb Lobster was $70 ... etc... but my God ... the food was AMAZING!  Filling and delicious.  The service was absolutely impeccable.  They will bend over backward to make sure you are happy.  I would definitely come back here often if budget permitted.  It's really some of the best food I've ever had.  The Shrimp and Crab Cocktail ... Best ever.  We also ordered two sides:  The Roasted Brussels Sprouts and the Sweet Mashed Potatoes.  Better than Thanksgiving.  My husband had steak ... he said it was awesome. I enjoyed the Lemon Berry Martini ... Yum.  And then ended the night with Chocolate covered strawberries.    This place definitely left a lasting impression and we will be back!

Ocean Club, along with all the other restaurants in the Mastro's group, is as good as it gets.  While pricey, the service, decor, food and selection are all top notch.  I have eaten at all of the Mastro's restaurants several times and you just can't go wrong with any of their food.  However, I seem to always go towards the filet along with any of their delicious side dishes.  This time I tried the crab gnocchi and it was great.

What a great meal!  Excellent food served by a highly professional yet pleasant staff in a beautiful environment. We ate in the bar area which is bit more casual than the dining room but it visually appealing and very comfortable. I strongly recommend the KC Strip, Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese and Roasted Brussels Sprouts (they're definitely not your mother's brussel sprouts...no offense to my mother or any of the other mothers out there).

Mastros you motherf*cker!! You have ruined me!! #MeToo, my tastebuds were assaulted by what is known as a marblelous (see what i did there) Japanese A5 Wagyu steak :'( I had never had a steak this wonderful in my life. When people say a steak melts like butter in your mouth, they must be talking about Wagyu steak. I know for damn sure there is no other steak out there that can compare. When i saw the price, I was like "this steak better have gold flakes on it or something.." it was $150 for 8 oz but I thought what the heck its Vegas and I'd been winning at the tables yeah baby! So after ordering a lemon drop , a delicious concoction thats sweet and sour and gets you all warmed up, I went for it. Needless to say, everytime I eat steak from now on, they will be compared to this amazing steak, and they will always fall short in expectations :(. The boyfriend got his usual ribeye, still on the quest for the best ribeye. Nevertheless, he thoroughly enjoyed his meal. We ordered the gorgonzola mac and cheese and lobster mashed potatoes. Both sides were delish, the service was attentive and not pretentious at all. Our server George was very knowledgeable about the menu and even suggested we try an appetizer thats not on the menu, thick cut maplewood bacon. Oh my god, ot was sooo damn good!

They added a special touch at the end of the meal, bringing out a big piece of chocolate cake with a heaping serving of fresh whipped cream, having mentioned my bf was celebrating his bday. Oh my lanta, just what we needed to cap off an amazing dinner.

Took my parents to this place a while ago, and have been meaning to write this well deserved review, so now it's about time.  Get the sea bass- it will melt in your mouth (seriously), the spicy Cesar salad delish and the butter cake a total must to end an amazing meal!

You get what you pay for and you definitely pay a lot here.  The food is very good and the service is fantastic.  I would put them a notch above places like Morton's with a much more relaxed atmosphere.  If you can do it it's worth the splurge every once in a while.  You won't walk away disappointed as long as you've accepted the fact that you will be spending ~$100 pp.

My first time dining at this particular Mastro's and they did not disappoint. It was restaurant week but our group went and ordered our own stuff anyways. Yeah, this's place is that good hahha


Food Tried: 
Pretzel Bread - like a soft, warm, perfectly salted pretzel. 
Lobster Mash - delish
Mushrooms - I love these tasty mushrooms
Spinach - not a big fan of spinach but Mastro's does it right 
12 oz bone in filet - cooked just right. Med rare and awesome

Service: Great. Attentive and courteous. My friend couldn't finish his 22oz rib eye and asked to take the rest to go. They accidentally tossed it but went out of their way to make up for it. Our group was dressed casually and I can imagine some lesser establishments not giving us this type of great service based just on this alone.

I spend the majority of the month in Vegas. There are some good spots to dine at, but none compare to Mastro's. It's beautiful decor, great staff, timeless menu, and perfect good keep me coming back. The sea food tower not only has a wonderful presentation, but it is some of the freshest seafood I have found in the west. The steaks are superb and will not disappoint. The bar is beautiful and the drinks are outstanding. I would definitely start with a fresh sea food tower and end with the butter cake.
Awesome place , good restaurant for family or business gathering meals , good atmosphere. Crew is helpful, staff is ready . Food is delicious

We finally tried Mastro's for valentines 2018.  We've been eyeing those lobster mashed potatoes for a long while but with a 35 dollar price point we just never ate there.  So finally we went.  The lobster mashed are worth it!  Easy reorder next trip.  Fish was excellent. Those were the standouts.  We would return for the fish and the mashed.  Some of the other items we tried were ok but not a reorder for us.  Service was great, room and atmosphere was great for Valentines.

This place is worthy of its high rankings.  There is a good selection of steaks and seafood.  It is located in this very interesting wooden alcove offering good people watching opportunities from some tables.  I thought our server was more than a bit officious, but the service from his busser and him was very good.  

My wife's Chilean sea bass with lemon caper butter was excellent.  She says it was one of the best servings of sea bass she has ever had.  The lobster mashed potatoes were excellent (at $35), as was the mac and cheese.  I was disappointed in my rib eye.  I order them a lot and the texture and taste of my serving was not to my liking.  Our friend's scallops were also excellent.

I would have given a ranking of excellent were it not for our server's demeanor and my steak.

Ordered the NY strip 16 oz. I asked for it to be cooked medium rare, but it was slightly more rare than I had expected. Nonetheless, it was still an amazing piece of big juicy steak. I would like to say that I went a little overboard with the whole pound of steak. The 12 oz would've sufficed.

We had a side of lobster mashed potatoes. Mashed potatoes were really creamy and the lobster blended well with the gravy. Overall, I felt it was a decent side. Don't know why people keep raving about it.

We had sautéed mushrooms for our second side. These were very juicy and well flavored. Mushrooms and steak make an amazing combination.

I will definitely be returning next time to try their seafood.

Loved the dungeness crab cocktail. Tomahawk steak, not so much. It was just ok. I've had better. waiter was just rushing everything. So we were not that impressed. We will def try again. Maybe it was an off night.

Took my love here for an early birthday celebration. Our waiter, Johnny, was the best, so funny and attentive. 
We started out with the lobster bisque and it was heaven! I had the petit filet with scallops, my bf had the Kobe steak with sautéed shrimps, we had the lobster mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts for sides. 
The filet, steak and shrimps was delicious! My scallops was a little salty and slightly overlooked but still yum! The brussel sprouts was also salty and could use some shaved almonds and cranberries but overall good. 
Would definitely come back despite the whole meal cost me an arm, a leg and probably my first born.

This is probably my favorite steakhouse in the country.  Steaks are the main attraction,  especially anything with a bone in.  Apps are delicious and sides are served family style.  Don't skip dessert

Mastros over delivers every time! There are plenty of solid restaurants in Vegas, but no one provides the level of service Mastros does. The hamachi appetizer was amazing! Colossal size stone crab claws were lights out! Steaks are always cooked spot on and seasoned perfectly! Worth every penny you spend.

We are visiting Scottsdale from Dallas, Texas.   So I come from a city and state with some Of the best steak and seafood restaurants in the country.  We visited the Ocean Club on Saturday 2/24 and it was top-notch.  Ask for a man named Duke to be your server.  He was knowledgeable about each menu item and provided just the right amount of attention (not hovering, allowing my husband and me to enjoy uninterrupted conversation, but enough attention to where we always had everything we needed at all times).  I had a most amazing halibut, and my husband have a flavorful ribeye.  Phenomenal Brussels sprouts and creamy, cheesy scalloped potatoes.  Don't miss the signature butter cake with plentiful ice cream. If you're in Scottsdale, you must visit the Ocean Club.

This is as good as it gets. Three of us went to Mastro's after deciding on seafood and reading the reviews on Yelp. Everything was top notch, including the attentive service, the gorgeous presentation of the food, and the portions. Some of my favorites included the crab cocktail (with an abundance of crab meat), served over a bowl with dry ice, lobster bisque (creamy and with actual meat), and the black truffle crab gnocchi. I had that night's special, which was a fantastic John Dory with a chardonnay lemon sauce. 

Some of the other "little touches" to make the experience better? The server actually served side dishes on our plates for us, and we received a follow up phone call a couple of days later to ensure our satisfaction. Very classy!

Expect a hit to your wallet: Three of us walked out of there at $600, though we did splurge on Grey Goose martinis (shaken table side), wine and lobster. I can assure you it's well worth it!

Delicious food, friendly and attentive staff, and an all around good atmosphere. The seafood was excellent, the filet was cooked properly, and the wine selection is good. The dining area is visually striking and the booth seating is quite comfortable. Prices are a bit on the high end, but not outrageous by any means.
Awesome what can I say!! Great food, fantastic service great atmosphere. Sit in the bar it is so worth the wait!! Ask for James the best server in the joint! James will not let you down!!

Met some friends here for dinner. Had already had the pleasure of dinning here several times before but this time got the seafood tower and was really impressed with the fresh, sweet and ice cold sea treasures adorning this tower.   I was so full that I couldn't fathom ordering an entree.  But there is always room for dessert.  Great service as you would expect.  Bar is quite the bore with the "do you see me?  I'm one of the cool people, I have arrived"  bullshit attitude.  Who you kidding?   Watch me leaving.

I took my best friend out for drinks and dessert for her birthday- after the appetizer which was actually good, we had a salad and decided to stop there.  We added a few drinks and wanted dessert.   Without asking us, our waitress brought a nicely decorated slice of chocolate cake?   We wanted to share the warm butter cake and would have gladly paid for it.   And while  it was nice of her to bring the chocolate cake,when I mentioned the warm butter cake, she made it a point to tell us she bought it for us??? Now we had to eat it or feel guilty.  She actually told us we could order the butter cake too but we aren't very big girls, coupled with the guilt trip we just went ahead and picked at the cake she brought.   Why would you tell your patrons you bought them something if for no other reason than to pad the tip?  I guess so they can't order what they really wanted?  I m still sort of bothered.

Dear Maestros,
Usually your staff is impeccable.  The service is spot on and the dessert is up to me to choose.  If you want to offer a complimentary dessert- leave the guilt trip, pad my tip- speech out of the friendly waitstaff banter.
The time spent with my girlfriend  was worth it, the food was fine but it's how you leave that people most remember and the end of our get together for drinks wasn't at all memorable in the way I had hoped.
Thanks for trying.

This is our 2nd time dining at Mastro's Ocean Club.  Lanford was our waiter for the evening.  He was extremely personable and very knowledgeable about the menu.  We dined on Oysters Rockefeller,  Sea Bass, Scallops, Lobster/black truffle gnocchi and the Brussel sprouts.  Everything was wonderful.  We spoke to 3 of the on duty managers in passing: Nicholas, Brandon and Dan(?).  We have nothing but praise for this restaurant and all who work there.  We will be back!

Been going to Ocean Club since it opened and have never been disappointed. My wife and I had the house salad which we split and it's always outstanding. Well worth the $17. 
We also split the Chilean Sea Bass on searing plates. $49. Never needed a knife. For a side we had the creamy spinach. 
It was my wife's birthday and we were comped a wonderful chocolate raspberry cake. 
Can't say enough about out service. We had a leisurely 3 hour dinner and were never rushed.

Went back to Ocean Club for my wife's birthday again last night. Service and food outstanding. Told the waiter we didn't want to rush and had a 2 hour dinner which was fabulous. 
Most restaurants loose quality over the years... not Ocean Club! A very special evening.

This review is purely for a stop at the bar, not a dining experience.  

On a hot summer night, my husband and I were walking down the strip, taking advantage of a few kid-free hours.  We were looking for something new and different to try when we walked past the Aria.  Just inside the attached shopping center and right off the strip, is Mastro's.  My husband has been wanting to try it out, but to be honest we weren't sure this was the right day because we were wearing shorts and sandals. 

We walked up and asked about the dress code.  Surprisingly they said, "No problem!" and pointed us inside and to the left when we asked about the bar.  

We walked in straight to the bar, which is a little small, with some tables just behind it.  Dining tables extend into a interesting architectural feature that has you eating suspended over the shopping center.

With a full bar, there are several cocktails and other beverages available, including a few signature ones.  They are pricey (like  $20 a drink), so make sure that you know that going in.  I like sweet stuff so I had a dream berry martini with a sugar rim. It was yummy.

The bartenders were very helpful and fun to chat with.

The cool thing about this place is it is definitely a celebrity hangout.  We were there during NBA summer league, so my husband saw Laker legend Magic Johnson and got a hug and a handshake out of him.  The staff likes to keep it low-key so we did not push for pics.

Stop by this cool spot and have a drink!  I'm hoping to come back for a meal some day.  You never know who you might run into!

Dinner with group of 30 during a conference. Calamari & asparagus for warm up - hey I look forward to some tasty, sautéed/grilled asparagus! Oh, it was breaded & FRIED. No thanks. How bout taking two small sips of a $30 glass of scotch on the rocks, go to men's room & return to have your scotch...gone! How bout looking forward to some nice "Pacific Swordfish" then it comes & its way overcooked? 3 Stars as the wait staff worked hard. As for the food? Go to a Subway instead

I had made reservations here for my wife's birthday and when we got there the place was crowded.  The hostesses explained the wait, and offered for us to have a drink in the lounge until our table was ready.  They kept checking in on us until we were ready to be seated.  

We started with two cups of coffee and the Dungeness Crab Cocktail.  The crab came out on a cup of dry ice that was smoking and was a very good presentation, as well as being extremely tasty.

For dinner my wife had the 8oz. Petite Filet and I had the Chilean Sea Bass.  The waiter, Piotr, explained that the sides are served family style and that we should share a couple.  We chose the Lobster Mashed Potatoes and the Steamed Broccoli.  My wife, when asked how she wanted her meat cooked, asked for it to be medium, Piotr explained that medium would still have some pink in the center, and sensing the way that she likes hers cooked, recommended medium plus.  When it came out it was cooked perfectly, and was the most tender steak that she has ever had.  My Sea Bass was cooked so it had a nice, crispy shell of the outside, but was milky and soft on the inside.  The Lobster Mashed Potatoes has spoiled me, now I find it hard to not expect that kind of perfection from all other potatoes.

After dinner they brought out a complimentary Chocolate Sin Cake for us to share with a birthday message written in sauce on the plate.  

Overall, this was an amazing meal at an amazing restaurant, and I would highly recommend this to anyone.  The prices are high, but you will get what you pay for.  My only regret is not being able to try the Warm Butter Cake everyone raves about, but I guess that means I have to go here again next time.

One of the worst steakhouse I've ever ate at.. Dirty dishes and knives to begin with. Had 3 of my friends order medium rare and it came out brown.. Told the manager, he had the chef to start a new order, and it came out again well done.. I was speechless. How do you mess up the order twice??? For a steakhouse this is pathetic. If your cooks can't cook steaks .. Please consider a new profession..

The way the menu is designed this is really a place for 6 people or more. Many of the side dishes not to mention the entrees are enough for sharing. Our julienned vinegar and salt french fries could have been a side dish for a table of 6 without a problem. 
   We enjoyed the Rack of Lamb and Blackened Swordfish, both expertly cooked although the blackened fish had more than its' serving of salt in the seasoning. The twice baked potato was rockin' and we also loved the Brussel sprouts. Don't miss the butter cake which comes warm and a la mode. 
   The service was so amazing it felt like we were their only table.

......... I'm speechless... This place is fabulous! I ordered the New York Strip, and they did not disappoint. It was so tender... Usually just the filets are like butter, but believe me, my New York was like cool whip. The staff were fantastic, I believe our waiters name was Patrick... He was so kind and helpful, shoutout to him. We got a few sides and appetizers... We got escargot which was surprisingly good in its garlicky sauce, but I recommend eating with the pastry it comes with. We also ordered the vanilla shrimp which was so plump and fresh and probably some of the best shrimp I've ever had. Our waiter, Patrick, recommended the lobster mashed potatoes, boy was his recommendation on point, it was simply divine. And of course you have to have a green vegetable, so you just couldn't go wrong with steamed broccoli. Then after leisurely eating the main course for about 45 minutes, it was time for dessert... Their specialty is the warm butter cake, which we sadly did not get to experience, instead we devoured the chocolate sin cake. The chocolate was so rich and pure and topped with house made whipped cream and garnished with a mint leaf, but you simply couldn't go wrong with any dessert on the menu. Sadly you can't keep eating all night, it was time to go home with a big doggy bag. Until the next time, I'm sure I won't be disappointed.

Excellent service
Excellent filet mignon prepared to perfection
The scallop potatoes are an absolute must and are creamy yet lightly crisp with spectacular flavor.  Broccoli side dish was huge and flavorful.

Creamed corn- another must try!

Cheesecake and pecan pie were huge and over the top.  A great way to wind down an excellent meal.

Silver Oak Napa Valley Cab is always a winner, but was marked up about 100 bucks way too much but won't hold against them because I bought it anyway.


Again-  perfect service and a well run establishment.

This is our go to restaurant when we are in Vegas!! Now this is a high end steakhouse. You don't want to go to Vegas and not eat here. 

Their steaks are delicious!! Cooked exactly how you like. The mashed potatoes and Mac and cheese are must haves!!
Can't really say anything about the seafood as I don't eat it. But if you want  a great steak with some delicious sides and some good cocktails with an overall 5 star dining experience then you will like Mastros. 

I look forward to eating here again on my next visit!!!

they exceeded my high expectations...the seafood tower was a great start, and you have to have the butter cake to finish off your meal...had the Bone-in Ribeye and it was cooked to perfection, medium rare warm all the way through...on the down side if you are looking for a quiet place...it's not

Excellence in all matters...music, bar, ambience, decor, staffing...and food!  5 stars for GM Nick who came to our rescue when a full house prevented us from ordering cocktails ....came with a server who handily shook 2 martini shakers who handed us our Cosmo & martini while we edited to be seated with the 2050+ guests.  Best service ever, our server Brandon was attentive, charming funny & knowledgeable ...loved this restaurant! Bar is set so high!

I usually go to City Hall but wanted to try Ocean Club. The food and service was outstanding as expected from a Mastro's restaurant. My guests also enjoyed their dinners and dessert (can't forget the warm butter cake- if only for the fresh whipped cream!) The food was cooked perfectly, the dishes came out together and everything was enjoyable. Love the lobster mashed potatoes.

Great location but a little harder to park- Valet, it is easier.

This time I had a plan: share a martini and save room for the warm butter cake!

Since our server, Leonard, kindly allowed me to split a martini with my friend, I actually remember my second visit to Mastro's in its entirety: from the amazingly addictive pretzel rolls, to the heirloom tomato and Campagna burrata salad, to the filet mignon (served with Bearnaise sauce, upon request), to the lobster mashed potatoes--and, finally, the famed warm butter cake.

This cake, alone, is worth 5 stars! The warm butter cake portion was more than enough for the three of us, served with a drizzle of berry coulis, sliced strawberries, a scoop of vanilla ice cream melting on top, and, in a separate bowl, enough whipped cream to frost a double-layer cake.

My first spoonful filled my mouth with warm brown sugar-sweet goodness, with the cake texture somewhere between a Genoise and a pound cake. The cake was wonderful on its own but we couldn't help but top our tastes with the whipped cream. We were so full from our meals (most likely due to that extra order of pretzel rolls) that, sadly, we couldn't quite finish the warm butter cake.

I plan to return for an all-carb meal next time: pretzel rolls and warm butter cake!

This place is just hands down exquisite! White Salmon!!!!!! Start to finish I can't say a bad thing about this place. The decor is impressive, and the drinks awesome. They have a $3600.00 Seafood Tower appetizer if you have that kinda cash. I gotta say though if they ever offer it to you as a special "White Salmon"...  Get it! It was like candy. Never had anything like it. UNREAL!!!!! Now I'm hungry....

Drinks and dessert with with the girls during a Vegas trip. The warm butter cake with fresh fruit was so delicious, melt in your mouth amazing! and the fresh strawberries went together perfectly with it. The fresh whipped cream  that came with it was HUGE like a mountain of whipped cream...way too much we only used like two spoon-fulls.

I'm sad right now. I wanted to like this place so badly. I wanted to have the positive experience others did and be able to happily write about it on yelp. Hubby and I went last weekend; got all dressed up, left the kids at home and took the date car. People watching was great, service was great, even our table location was great. The bar area was great. I loved the atmosphere. Did not mind it being dark at all because it was so cool inside. 
What was NOT great? Pretzel bread was a little stale but butter, lots of it, helped. The seafood tower was impressive, but the seafood adorning it was not so much. The Clear Lobster roll was outright INEDIBLE. Mushy, no flavor, disappointing.
My mambo salad was passable but nothing great.  When I asked for shrimp on top, after hearing so many great reviews about the shrimp, they gladly obliged. BUT when it came, they were overcooked and rubbery. WAH for me. Husband's steak was very good. He was gloating for sure. 
We got two sides, the Crab Truffle Gnocchi and the peas. The gnocchi was decent but I really could only have a couple of bites due to the intense richness with nothing to offset it. The peas, while super fresh, were SWIMMING in oil. Seriously, they took great peas and drowned them to death in a sad, sad oil lake. 
The butter cake was superb. Nothing but fond memories of that. 
So, we spent a small fortune for a meal with one (for me) or two (for hubby) great points. 
I will not be going back. I will not be recommending. We live in Mesa, and were the first of our circle of influence to go and I am devastated to be the one steering people away due to such a lackluster first showing. 
I wonder what went wrong. So many other yelpers just love this place.

A very nice man from Ocean Club at Kierland personally contacted me to make things right. He gave me his name to use when I make the reservation so I can be assured that the dining experience will be special. Thank you very much.

I am a huge fan of Mastros Ocean Club. The food is nothing less than superb. I have been to the Costa Mesa, Newport, and now the Vegas location. This is by far my favorite restaurant/steak house. The mats are perfectly seasoned. The appetizers are all delicious. The desserts, we'll all I will say is Butter Cake!
