Seemed odd to go to an upscale shopping mall for dinner, but the suspended atmosphere at Mastro's gave our evening a very fun feel. We will be back, but still probably won't order a steak.

Meh. Underwhelming. I do not care to ever return to this restaurant. It really just does not feel like a steakhouse, it felt more like a cafe. We stopped by before going out for my friends birthday and we were pretty regretful with our choice. Considering it is Mastro's, I had much higher expectations. Food was bland and so were their servers lol bye.

An exceptional dining experience from start to finish.  

Service = exceptional

Food = exceptional, executed well

Ambiance = Classy - but for people who come in and shorts and flip flops

I highly suggest the filet mignon.  As a meat lover, I ended up choosing the 12oz versus the 9oz.  In retrospect, I should have gone with the 9oz.  Nonetheless, it was a perfectly cooked medium steak.  I started off with a caesar salad, which was a bit salty.

I have been here twice, and I have to say this is probably my favorite restaurant of all time. The food is simply phenomenal and the service is excellent, too. It's definitely on the pricey side, but well worth it if you're looking for something nice. It can be the small things that make or break an establishment-in this case it's the ability to get "half" orders of their salads and side orders. Nice touch. I highly recommend giving Mastro's a try. Because it's in the middle of an indoor shopping mall, it's a little bit of a stretch to say it's super romantic or intimate. But, it's easy to tune all of that out and just focus on your food and company. I hardly ever give 5 star reviews, but I think this place has earned it.

Excellent service here. The food was just okay. We had filets, which the quality of meat was just okay. Could've been fixed with a good sear and finish on the steak, which was just not there. The garlic mash was amazing! The truffle crab gnocchi, not good. Pass on this. Crab was fishy and it was absent of truffle. They still had a fantastic bread basket like most Mastro's but their stars, the steak and seafood were so so.

Just wanted to update all of you and say that the manager reached out to me and apologized for the poor experience we had there.  He informed me that they would be opening up a location in NYC and would be sending me a gift certificate to enjoy on my first visit to the new location.  I will update after that experience, but I was very happy with the response I received from the manager.  He showed that the restaurant really does care about the opinion of its customers.

We went here for our annual Christmas Eve dinner out and experienced lovely service. The Arctic Char was wonderful but the Red Snapper was seared and dried out. No sauce and over cooked which made a bland meal. The butter cake was a rich delicious dessert and I'd definitely eat the cake and Arctic Char repeatedly. The worst part was that my husband (consumed the snapper) got food poisoning afterward. We ate all the same things and the only meal we didn't share was our entrees. Christmas Day was pretty miserable for him and I'm disappointed that we will not visit Mastro's again because the service and parts of the meal were great but to serve food that is not fresh is terrible.

Our wedding anniversary dinner could not have been better. Excellent and attentive service by Jonny. Awesome NY steak and to top it off they gave us a complimentary dessert for our celebration. We will definitely be back.

Good but not amazing. I've had a better rib eye the night before at Steak and Stone. Part of the appeal of Ocean Club is the vibe. Live music, low lighting, and high end atmosphere. Craft beer selection was ok at best. I believe they focus on cocktails. Price point is about $80 a person.

I came here specifically to eat crab gnocci before I started my diet. We could have been seated but I suggested we sit at the bar because we had great service the last time we sat at the bar. We waited a very long time to get a menu, waited a long time for our waters, and waited again to place our order. That's all we did was wait. For everything. An hour passed and I asked for the manager. I told him about the service and that we were still waiting on our food. He comped our drinks and we went to Dominick's. I was really shocked at how bad the service was. When you pay an arm and a leg for food you expect a high level of food and service. I understand there are off situations and I hope that's the case.
Food is absolutely delicious!!!!  Great for a romantic dinner or dinner with a group of friends - my husband and I go once a month!!!!

Visited for lunch last year.  Food quality is fantastic.  Great cocktail menu.  Would definitely try dinner when I have the chance.  Service was great, but restaurant was not busy when I was there.  The Beef Carpaccio as a starter is wicked!!  Big wine list also!!

Our reservations were for 10:30 pm (Valentine's Day), but we arrived a little after 10:00 and were quickly seated in the "tree house", which is more like a bird cage!  Our waitress (Tanya) was phenomenal the entire evening.  She catered to every need and offered excellent suggestions during ordering.  

We began with a few cocktails, which were very tasty.  My wife and I decided to split a bowl of Lobster bisque, since I had read reviews that it was very good (I had Lobster  bisque the previous evening at a Venitian restaurant, and was very disappointed).  This bisque was the best I have ever had!  It was a quite large serving with many sizeable pieces of lobster.  It could easily satisfy as a meal by itself!

As a main course, we split the Chilean Sea Bass ($50, I think).  When asked for suggestions, Tanya recommended the Blackened seasoning.  For sides, we chose the King Crab truffled Gnocci ($29), and Roasted Brussle Sprouts ($11).  The fish came a la carte on a large plate.  For being a split order, the portions were surprisingly generous.  The gnocci and brussle sprouts came as large sides to be shared.  The waitress dished the sides on the main plate.

Now, plated and ready to go, and accompanied by a basket of various breads, my wife and I embarked on the best meal we have ever had!  Initially, we agreed it had to be in the top three, but then we couldn't come up with where we had had a more impeccable meal (and service).

The Sea Bass was tender, flakey, moist, and so perfectly seasoned.  The Gnocci had large pieces of crab mixed with the creamy gnocci.  For the brussle sprouts, we like them almost burnt on the outside to bring out the flavor.  They, too, were perfectly roasted dark and tender!  

We ate the all the fish, even though we were quite full.  We took home the leftover gnocci and brussle sprouts, which was enough to make another whole meal for two.  My wife made the comment that she wanted to take home a piece of the bread that was still in the bread basket.  The waitress said she would get us fresh ones.  With our leftovers, she packed four extra pieces of the fresh "pretzle" bread.

We travel a lot, we love to cook, and we love to eat at quality restaurants.  If you go to Vegas, you HAVE to eat here!  We hope your experience is as enjoyable as ours was!

Great steaks, fantastic pretzel bread, the freshest fish (my wife swears by the crab cocktail appetizer) and of course the out of this world butter cake. What a fantastic meal up in the "birds nest" at City Center.  Still prefer the Newport Beach location but when in Vegas . . .

This is actually 3.5 stars.  So me and the guys had dinner here last night and as usual the food is excellent (5 stars).  

The reason for the lower rating was due to service and ambience.  I've been to other Mastro's and their service has always been top notch.  They always anticipated your needs and followed up quickly.

Our main server here could have worked at Sizzler, Black Angus, Outback or any of those type of places and the clientele there would have thought he was good.  At Mastro's, not the case.  

I am a low maintenance client and in the restaurant business so I understand how it can be.  But last night's dinner service wasn't busy and Mastro's has a pretty good wait staff to client ratio so our needs should have been met fairly easily.  

My biggest complaint are the lack of water initially and follow up afterwards.  We didn't get water until are appetizers were served.  There was never a follow up after any of the dishes were served.  This is pretty basic service for a fine dining establishment so I will not give you any leeway here.  

My other issue is more of a personal taste.  Mastro's is located in Crystals Shopping Center at CityCenter and has an "open top" feel with views of the mall.  The restaurant is not enclosed so it feels like I'm dining at a very expensive food court.  As with typical steak houses they are usually dark but here it's pretty bright.  I didn't feel like I had the full Mastro's steak house experience.

While I really enjoyed the food and time with my friends I'm not sure I will go back since Vegas has a lot of dining options.

24oz Rack of Lamb a bit undercooked, good value $48 but too much for one person. Twice baked potato enormous like $12 - too much cheese on too - potato was not dry thankfully didnt need butter - live entertainment not bad but a bit overpowering - server was cute and good.

We came here for our mothers day celebration. My wife liked it the last time we came to lv so we made a reservation to come back.  We are big fans of Maestros in west LA.  We ordered lobster bisque and caesar salad to share for starters.  The lobster bisque was the star of the whole dinner and the ONLY reason for the 3rd star.  It was really really good and to find real lobster in it was great.  The caesar salad was good and the fact that they portioned it out for us was a nice touch. We  two ribeye steaks for mains together with mac and cheese and creamed spinach.  We ordered our two steaks med rare and medium.  The steaks came out med and almost well done.  I had to give half of my steak to my wife since it was her day and she forbade me from complaining to the staff so I'm writing this review.  The creamed spinach was really good and the portions were generous.  The mac and cheese on the other hand was a huge disappointment - completely tasteless and gummy.  Service was good and they really did treat us well.

All of their locations are great. They have the best steaks west of Chicago, hands down. You pay alot but get your money's worth. Great side dishes & service. You MUST try profiteroles & or cherry cobbler. 
Enjoy this a great restaurant.
This is one of the best steak houses in town.  Only giving 4 stars because of their high pricing.  Overall - great food and atmosphere.  Superb place to go when hanging out with your friends.

Everything about his restaurant screams "top notch"!  I have always enjoyed everything I have ever ordered from this place!  Cocktails are "hands down" thee best, although I will sadly miss the best bartender I've ever come across....Cindi.  Salad, exquisite, steak melts like butter in your mouth, sushi to die for and dessert outstanding.  This place is THEE place if you are looking for a prime steakhouse in Scottsdale.
Really great place for seafood and salads.  Great option for a meal before any of the shows at Aria, MGM or other surrounding casinos.   Top notch service

I will preface this review with the fact that family was in town and this dinner was free!

We had reservations for Saturday Night  at 8:30 pm for a group of 7. I am always leery of a restaurant that is in the middle of a mall. I don't care how fancy the mall is, I think mall food every time I dine at one. Mastro's my friends is no Mall Food Place.

The Service was top notch, we had a waiter and 2 bussers, while I'm sure they had different tables, they were always there when we needed them. It was like they were our dedicated staff.

The meal was top notch, starting with the amazing bread basket, continuing through the entrees, the family style sides, and ending up with an amazing dessert (which they comped to the table).

The Bread basket was a good start, it had Pretzel Bread, olive bread, a Parmesan crisp, and few other breads. The sides were amazing, they are served family style in surprisingly large portions. We had Creamed Corn (some of the best I've ever had), Creamed Spinach, Lobster Mashed Potatoes, King Crab Gnocchi, and Mushrooms. We also had a few salads to pass around the table, 2 Caesars (one regular and one spicy), Tomato and Onion, and Tomato and Mozzarella. A seafood tower and crab cakes were also ordered, I'm not much of a seafood guy but everyone else loved it. 

They entrees were pretty stellar as well, I was splitting the 33oz Wagyu Tomahawk cut with my uncle, but since he was too full from the salads and sides, I had to man up and eat the whole thing myself (the things I have to do). This was one of the best pieces of Cow I've had in my life (and I've had A LOT of cow). It was cooked just a touch under medium rare (perfect IMO), the marbling in the meat was insane, and it came out on a scorching hot plate. I don't know how they cooked it but it was perfect. 

Table mates also got the Seabass, A Filet, and a few other meats, I was very impressed with the size of their portions, most places would serve about 4oz of fish, but their filets were about 12oz servings.

After dinner, they brought out a Warm Butter Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream for the table, it was a great end to the meal, and comping it was a nice touch!

I have no clue what the meal ran, but it was amazing. My only complaint is that their bar area isn't the best, if they're going to make you wait 10-20 mins for your table they need more room in the bar. They did however have a great piano player and singer who played a variety from christmas carols to current hits which only added to the amazing meal.

Will I be back, hopefully, especially if someone else is picking up the tab!

Heard about Mastro's for a long time and finally had a chance to try it in Vegas.

This location is insides the Crystals @ Citycenter.  If you go to this location make sure to request to sit in the tree house (it's the giant wooden structure you see in the pictures), it's much more interesting then just sitting in the regular dining room.

The service was impeccable; water was always full, the plates and crumbs were constantly being cleared and the waiter was friendly.

Me and my wife shared the double cut porter house.  This thing was REALLY good, and was probably the best steak i've ever had at the time.  We were not even hungry and we ate half of it.   Took the rest to go and the next day i just straight up ate the leftovers straight out of the box (no fridge or microwave in the hotel room).

My boyfriend made a reservation here for our Anniversary. And my oh my was I pleased! It was wonderful.

To start, it is very classy and nice. Beautiful interior décor. Fancy place settings.

The service is wonderful. Very professional and high class. You get what you pay for there.

The food was wonderful. I got salmon of course and loved it!

We told them it was our anniversary as well so they were nice enough to bring us a piece of cake and a candle lit!! So nice of them.  We left there stuffed.

This place is just marvelous. Loved it!! If I could afford to, I would go back every weekend.

Came here for a friend's Birthday. 

The service was superb, a big thank you to Peter our waiter for dealing with such an unruly large party!

I had the Kansas City Strip Steak...was amazing. They use a great rub or some other seasoning. 

We started with a couple dozen Oysters which were fantastic, and not too expensive. All the sides were great, including the potatoes and spinach. 

Great wine selection, and its only 2X for certain bottles of wine. We had 3 bottles each around $100 but top vintages of some great wineries in Napa. 

I believe the birthday boy got a free desert of some kind, but at that point in the meal I was having to much fun to notice. 

This is a clean, fun, and delicious higher-end place to eat with friends. I will definitely be back

I can think of no reason to give one more penny of my hard-earned money to Mastro's. Our anniversary dinner was supposed to be special - it wasn't.

Service was rushed. 
We were a two top at 5:15 - the waiter had the warmth of a stop sign; his demeanor rushed throughout the visit. An unsolicited 'reminder' about how entrees take 25 minutes upon delivery of our appetizer "and to order soon' only signaled their wanting the table for another cycle, so we'd better hurry the fuck up!

Drinks are overpriced.
Two cocktails came to just under 50 bucks. A glass of wine with dinner was 23.

Stop pushing the seafood tower for Christ's sakes! 
We were two, not twelve. When I bring clients in, it's a consideration. Not a $300 pile of shellfish for two, however. I heard our server offering the damned thing to an eighty year-old couple seated next to us, thinking; "Now just how - IN THE FUCK - are these two old codgers going to wolf down a hundred pieces of shellfish, pre-meal no less!"

Oysters didn't taste fresh, making me wonder if they use canned oysters and re-use the shells like so many other chain seafood specialty restaurants.

"Black truffled mushroom sauce" an optional side for the steak topping, was anything but. It was white in appearance and had no detectable smell or taste of truffles - only high levels of sodium. For fifteen dollars, save your money. I had to scrape it off and loathe a little white pile of salted, shitty 'gravy' throughout the meal.

Lobster in their signature mashed potatoes were like bites from a rubber chew toy; overcooked and flavorless. (I think someone finally found the Busy Bee) Potatoes had a film of grease - butter I presume. Someone should have thought to give them a quick stir, like I had to do in order to make them visually pleasant enough to want to take a spoonful. Prior to my doing so, I watched as a small yellow puddle developed at the edge of the dish. 
This was concerning.

Wife's drink was returned twice, both times too strong - overpowering the cucumber in the martini. Bartender must confused her with Amy Winehouse I suspect.

Six ounce filet ordered Pittsburgh style - no detectable char anywhere. 
Wife's was ordered medium - nothing even mildly resembling pink.

If it wasn't for the tasty bread basket and plate of semi-soft butter, the dinner would have been a complete bust. 

We stopped at AJ's on the way home for dessert. 
After fooling us on every aspect of the meal, we weren't going to get fooled on another disappointing menu item. We skipped their dessert offerings.

When I told my wife this morning how the dinner was less than memorable for such an important anniversary, she disagreed, explaining; "Negative experiences can be just as memorable as can good ones."
She's right.

When so many things go wrong as quickly as last night, ie; the returned drinks, the small flavorless oysters, the salted 'truffle' sauce, you (as in me) have to decide how many times you're going to send stuff back before it returns with a hidden present from the chef. 
I realize this isn't likely at Mastro's, but I didn't want to be deemed the 'difficult' couple at table 31  and take the chance of pissing off the staff. 

So we stopped sending stuff back after the drinks, took our lumps, and got the fuck outa there asap.

Goodbye Mastro's and good luck.
You will never have to endure another of my Yelp rants - unfavorable or otherwise.

One of the top 3 restaurants in Vegas! Third time coming here this year and I have never been disappointed. Service from the waitress was on point and she was very thorough with explaining the specials on the menu. The shrimp cocktail is probably the best I've ever had along with the lobster bisque.  I had the rack of lamb as my main course which was amazing. Black truffle gnocchi as a side is brilliant also. The one thing you cannot leave this restaurant without ordering is the legendary butter cake!!

My wife took me here for my birthday and I enjoyed it.  I had the Porterhouse and my wife had the filet.  Not the best steak I have had, but still very good.  My wife enjoyed her filet.  We had a couple sides which were amazing.  Have music in the bar area, good place for a date.

Dined here after a show for wife's 60th birthday - a special day. Arrived earlier than our reservation and Concierge said party at our reserved table was just closing check. We headed to the bar for drinks and after 1/2 hour I went to inquire about the delay. A different concierge informed me the party was just getting dessert - what's the real story? Was getting late so we took another table and enjoyed dinner. Would expect better from a higher end dining establishment - Concierge never offered anything for the delayed seating. Several other restaurants along the Strip with comparable food and more attentive staff.

This is by far the best ribeye I have ever had! The only downside is the way you are welcomed and the atmosphere isn't as classy as I would like it to have been. When paying $50+ for a steak I don't like to feel rushed. I fealt that we were sort of being rushed since there were so many people waiting to be seated. Other than that, I loved the food.

Nom nom nommy noms. We were in Vegas for an anniversary trip and needed a place to indulge and Mastro's was a great choice. We made reservations a few days before and got a phone call to confirm. It's located in Crystal Shops at City Center which is connected to Aria. 
We were a bit early but were still seated as soon as we arrived. The restaurant from outside err inside the mall looks so cool and it's even nicer from inside. Very nice ambience which calls for a relaxing meal.
Now for the food:
The bread basket had only one bread i liked. Basic french bread...typical. Then we started with drinks. I knew I would be having wine as opposed to my typical cocktail while DH unusually ordered beer so we were living wild! I needed help with finding the right wine to pair with my meal and the waiter was very helpful. 
After tasting two wines, i settled for the Remy Pannier Chenin Blanc which was excellent with my Alaskan King Crab Legs. DH had the Alaskan Amber which was great with his meat haaaaaa. For sides, we went with Asparagus and Scalloped Potatoes. Both sides complimented the filet and crab legs and the meal was very tasty AND filling. To finish, we had the Creme Brulee and ice cream which were decadent. 
This was one of my favorite experiences in Vegas. To top it off, we received a call the next day thanking us for choosing them and asking how our experience was. I would love to stop by again our next visit to the Sin City!

Mastros you were very disappointing. We were very excited to give this place a try because of the reviews that were given. 

First off the service was horrible. And keep in mind I'm not asking for you guys to bend over backwards to keep us happy, but the attitude needs a lot of improvement from the host to the server. 

I didn't keep that in mind for long because we were here for the food anyway and I thought the food will make up for it. We order the hamachi appetizer, which was the only decent tasting dish. We ordered the sea bass, rack of lamb and scallop. They were all just super basic dishes. It was literally just a protein with no sauce whatsoever! I could have done this at home and this would have tasted better at a local BJs. I expected much better from you guys. 

Then when we were about to leave I asked for a box so I could take the bread to go so that we could snack on it later. I got attitude and was asked twice am I sure I did not want to take the courses to go. There's a reason why we didn't ask for box to go and we obviously thought it was NOT good enough to take it to go, and I understand why our server gave us attitude. He thought we were wasteful, but the food sucked so just leave us alone and don't ask twice with an attitude. 

I would skipped this place if you're in Vegas, you can find much better places to eat around here. I understand sometimes it sucks to be working on a holiday or the weekend, but keep in mind we all work too and we spend good money to have a good meal out here too. We don't deserve any of this nasty attitude or food.

I went to Mastros during a trip to Scottsdale with my husband and some friends. This was by far one of the best meals I've ever had. The wait staff was attentive. The Martinis came with a shaker of extra drink. The food was delicious. I can't say enough how great this meal was. We will seek it out next time we travel.
Tried this place for dinner and was not impressed.  Had lamb chops and scalloped potatoes. The potatoes were half cooked and the lamb was bland

For the most special of occasions, Mastro's Ocean Club is king of providing excellent service, food and atmosphere.  This has been my second time dining at Mastro's (first time for birthday, second for anniversary).  To say that they will raised the bar even on the second time dining, is quite impressive!
Entering Mastro's you are taken immediately to your table (reservations strongly recommended, especially if celebrating a particular occasion).  There is a bar area off to the left side, with ample seating, then to your right the general dining room area.  A private dining room is available for groups.

Your waiter or waitress promptly arrives at your table to welcome you ever so warmly to Mastro's.   Warm conversation is most certainly to be had, and most of all, it's sincere.  Mastro's really made us feel like royalty (even with many people around us sharing the same dining experience), and conversation was earnest with our waiter and friendly.

Mastro's boasts a variety seafood and steak dishes.  The highlight of this particular Mastro's being seafood; one cannot go wrong with their ever well stocked Mastro's Seafood Tower.  This tower is truly amazing!  It can be tailored for the amount of people in your group, and can include a variety of fresh seafood appetizers of your choosing.  Of particular deliciousness, are their crab and their jumbo shrimp cocktail.  Chilled to perfection, each bite is a seafood lover's dream.

For the main course, the 12 oz fillet is of most generous portion.  Any steakhouse in the area would be rivaled to Mastro's generous portion and taste.  Each bite (even with my being well-done) was juicy and flavorful.  Be sure to pair your steak with a vegetable and starch, which rounds out your meal perfectly.  Their steamed spinach is light, yet full of flavor.  The lobster macaroni and cheese is full of rich and creamy cheese, and portions of lobster meat mixed in.  This dish is extremely filling, but a unique experience for any macaroni and cheese lover.

To round out the evening, one cannot forget about their decadent desserts.  For this particular evening, their Signature Warm Butter Cake was a delivery from heaven!  This dessert is full of buttery and soft cake tastiness inside, along with a heaping scoop of vanilla ice cream to balance out the warm cake.

I look forward to my next trip to Mastro's Ocean Club.  Mastro's will truly pull out all of the stops to make your evening the most enjoyable in their surroundings and unforgettable dishes.  Check out Mastro's Ocean Club for your most special of occasions.  Mastro's locations can be found in Arizona, California, Nevada and Illinois.

Was a big fan of Mastros steakhouse so as soon as I heard about the Ocean Club I had to try it. I'm so glad I did. It is a wonderful restaurant. The cold seafood tower is delicious. The king crab and oysters were so fresh. The salads are so good, such great choices and unique variety. Great cocktails, wonderful bread, incredible service and the desserts are yummy too. Great central location in Kierland. Highly recommend this one for anyone is Scottsdale.

By far the best meal I had in Vegas. I had the crab cocktail, grilled swordfish, crab gnocchi, wild mushrooms, and the buttercake - of course. The crab cocktail was delicious, perfectly cooked sweet crab with a decent cocktail sauce. The swordfish was a little dry on the sides but perfectly cooked towards in inside. The mushrooms were fantastic and full of garlic and butter. The gnocchi was to die for, so delicious and creamy and oh so full of crab- they do not skimp out here. The buttercake was delicious. 

My largest complaint about Maestro's is the waitstaff. While they were very nice they were very pushy. They came 3 times in five minutes to ask if they could take our plates. It was probably around 6:30 and our plates were half full. There was no need for a rush.

Who's taking me to Ocean Club?  Anyone?

Holy Crap I was there last night for the first time and just had a few drinks at the bar with friends.  DEAR GOD if the food is anywhere near half as good as it smelled....  And I've heard that it is.

Extremely pricey and the bar was packed.  A little rowdy too for the age group there, definitely an older crowd...lots of cougar hunting going on by my 20-something guy friends.  Definitely more of a scene than, say, Capital Grille...louder, etc.

Loved the decor and the music (they had some dude singing but it wasnt obnoxious), not to mention the bathrooms are impecable and huge.  

I only wish I could give a review on the food but like I said, we didnt eat...  *sigh*  Maybe one day....

I decided to make reservations here for my hubby's bday dinner and an early anniversary dinner as well! Our anniversary is a few days after his bday. I had let them know we were celebrating both occasions and gave us one of the best seats in the house! We sat in the tree house. Our server was Hooper and he was very imformative, proffesional, and even split all our food for us without being asked to! We Hooper brought us out their famous butter cake decorated with "happy birthday" and "happy anniversary"  The best part, they actually comped the dessert for our occasion! I have been to Mastro's in Chicago and I can honestly say that this location is nothing less than exceptional. Great food and great service with attention to detail. I am a true fan and can't wait to come back to this location next time I'm in town!

I usually go to City Hall, but the service has been subpar lately, so I thought I would give Ocean Club a go. I was not disappointed. The service was amazing and the food was great and timed perfectly. We started with blue point oysters and jumbo shrimp cocktail. It was phenomenal. We continued with a filet and family sides. The whole experience was delightful. Unexpectedly the next day, Ocean Club called me and thanked me for dining with them! I have dined at City Hall many times and never received an after call. I will continue to go to Ocean Club!

My boyfriend and I came here with his parents and the first point I'll make to get your attention is that our bill came out $450. Now that i've got your attention.

Service: One word excellent. I'd like to start off by saying that I came here for my 21st birthday and you know how usually you'll mention it to restaurants in hopes of getting something free and they'll come out with some weak bite sized dessert. My boyfriend's parents were the one who mentioned it and I quickly got a happy birthday and I expected nothing of it after. But for dessert I actually got a full on, very generous portion of a piece of chocolate cake (with raspberries!). It had come while I was in the bathroom so I wasn't expecting the waiter to relight it again but he actually did! The waiters were very nice, they made jokes and conversation (not just about food but where we were from, etc) They really knew their stuff, like not just knew what the specials were but they were very knowledgeable about their menu.

Food: For starters we ordered escargot, chilled seafood, and crabcakes. The escargot was probably the disappointment of the evening. I've had much better elsewhere. There was just no taste or not a great taste. It wasn't gross or anything but I've just basically tasted better marinated or sauced escargot. For the chilled seafood, you're allowed to pick however many pieces you want and what seafood you want on it. It came in this platter that had dry ice in it. The shrimp were so plump and juicy. The crab was the best part though. I don't even know how to describe it but my boyfriend and I were fighting for the last pieces, just popping them into our mouths one by one. 
-Rack of Lamb: So juicy! It was probably the best lamb I've ever had. The taste was there, it was perfectly cooked. 

Dessert: We ordered their signature cake and it was very unique. I don't think I"ve ever tasted anything like it but I wasn't raving about it as much as the rest of my table were. It tasted like butterscotch or toffee angel/sponge cake. I couldn't really put my foot on what it was, it was just so different. 

Bathroom: This is actually the first bathroom I've been to where it had a bathroom attendant who handed you towels. They had tampons and other amenities on the counter. She opened and closed the door for me. It's too bad I didn't have my wallet to tip her but she was very nice. 

View: Where we were seated, you could basically look out into the mall and people watch. 

My boyfriend and I will definitely be back to this chain, maybe for an anniversary.

The experience was not unique and the ambiance where we were seated for reservation was awkward for a fine dining experience.  Not what you look for when you visit Las Vegas.  My lobster roll was ok as best and my wife's fish was just ok as well.  Drinks were good.

WOW. Best meal of my life.  

For being located in a mall this place very nice.  We had a very good bottle of red wine that paired well with the bone-in ribeye and lamb of rack.  Speaking of the ribeye was humongous and melted like butter.  The rack of lamb is actually 2 racks which the waiter kindly had the chef slice for me so I didn't have to feel like I was performing surgery in the middle of my date. This had to be the best lamb I've ever had.

The food was soo good that we made a special trip back to the aria before seeing Ka at the MGM.  (PS my feet paid the price)
Just like the one in Bev Hills...needs no further explanation, everything is yum and oh that butter cake ending=happy ending

This is definitely one of my favorite Steakhouses! Took my mom there for her birthday last week and it was amazing! Started off with a berry martini....delish!  For a starter i had the wedge salad you can never go wrong with the wedge :). As my main course i had the filet mignon which i absolutely love!!!!! Its so tender it melts in your mouth and the flavor is beyond amazing! Most restaurants don't know how to season their meats :/ Not Mastros. My mom was even amazed with the flavor of the filet. FYI my mom is a picky eater :/ actually so am I haha. We ordered three sides to share (the portions are pretty big just to throw out there). There was 4 of us In our party and we had lots of left overs. We had the Mac n cheese (a must have) creamed spinach and sauteed mushrooms. Dessert time we had the butter cake. I swear this has to be the best dessert I've ever had... No joke! Once you start eating it you can't stop....its addicting!

Horrible food! We go to Mastros in Scottsdale arizona very frequent and this location in Las Vegas was nothing but disappointment. Sent my steak back because it came out over done and then it came back cold. Their scalloped potatoes are my favorite, except at this location they were pure salt. Total disappointment. Don't waste your money here!

It was either a off night, or they were training a new steak cook.  I ordered my bone in rib eye medium and at best it was medium well.  My buddy's filet tasted like liver, that really strong iron taste.  Should have ordered the fish at a place called "Ocean Club".  Or next time I will stick to Wolfgang's Cut.  So disappointing.  Service was good.  Should have sent back my steak, but I hate wasting food.

been a few times and the vanilla crusted twin lobster tails are still amazing
also some of the best seared ahi I have ever had
great location inside crystals in the city center
look for the giant wood shaped tree house hovering in the air....thats it!!!

This shall be short because Mastro's is just plain awesome.

Lobster Tails = Delectable
Creamed Spinach = Delish
Scalloped Potatoes = RICH! Very yummy cheeses in the dish
Ahi Tuna = Yum! 
Chocolate Cake = Da Bomb

Corkage Fee - $35.
Service = IMPECCABLE

This is our go-to place whenever we're in Vegas for an expensive dinner. The boyfriend goes here when he's in Scottsdale for business dinners. It's just fantastic.  A pretty penny, but amazing.

I was pretty excited to eat here last Thursday night. We had a 7:15 reservation, but we didn't get seated until 7:35ish. It was busy, which is a good sign, but dang it was loud. The food was good, but not great. The filet was just ok, I could easily do it just as well if not better myself. I got the sea bass, which is i think their signature fish, and it was really average. I just st expected a lot more from a upscale expensive place like ocean club.

Came here last week for Las Vegas Restaurant Week and the menu was absolutely delicious! We had the tuna tartar, caesar salad, halibut, filet mignon, mushrooms, mashed potatoes, creamed corn and creamed spinach! For dessert I had the butter cake which was absolutely PHENOMENAL! My friend had the chocolate cake which was good too. I ordered a martini and it was so tasty, they even bring you the remaining in the martini shaker! Brandon was our server and was very professional, the bussers and water servers were so on point as well! Would highly recommend this place!

Im a local and this is probably my favorite restaurants in vegas. The staff is tentative and the food is great. The tomahawk steak, rib eye steak and Chilean (blackened) sea bass are my favorites. Of course no meal is complete without starting out with their crab cakes. Top 3 crab cakes I've ever had. The key lime for desert is a must have as well. I tell everyone I can about this place. Don't forget to mention if you are celebrating a special occasion.

We ate at Mastro's at their Los Angeles location earlier this year. The steaks that we had were the best that we had ever had. We were in Las Vegas during part of the Labor Day Weekend and had long decided to eat at the Vegas location in a shopping mall leading into Aria Hotel/Casino and in a tree house. We were staying at The Cosmopolitan Hotel it was a breeze to get to the restaurant.
We were seated immediately to our table as per our reservation. The server was very attentive and informative. I had a bone-in filet for dinner with garlic mashed potatoes and a dessert in the end. All of the above with a forever flowing bottle of red wine.
The steaks at Mastro's Ocean Club (Whether in Los Angeles or in Las Vegas) are dry-aged and prepared to perfection. The texture is so soft and buttery with the flavors bold and bountiful. I have to tell you that the term, "Melts in your mouth", can literally be used at this establishment and it would not be over stated. We paid a pretty penny for this meal as well however it was well worth all of it and then some.

I went here for a work dinner hoping to find a good seafood restaurant In Las Vegas but left very upset with both the dining experience and the quality of the food. 

The food: we started out with some alacarte cold seafood. I had the oysters which to my surprise was only served with a cocktail sauce -  not vinegar. A shame for otherwise good oysters. My colleague had the burrata with the heirloom tomatoes, but the cheese was more like mozzarella and the tomatoes un-ripe and hard.

For our mains we went with the seafood - I had the sea-bass (blackened) and to my surprise it  was drenched in butter and tasted more of butter than the fish I was expecting. My colleague had the swordfish - which was overcooked, and cold by the time it came out.

The service: the service was non-attentive and several times the staff walked by not noticing our empty glasses or asking if we would like another drink. 

When we got both our apps and our mains the staff served us the wrong courses- we all got each-others dishes.

Lastly - Once dessert rolled around (we had ordered two deserts to share) -we only got two plates which was very inconvenient. After once again waiting for the staff to come around and not noticing we had not started eating, we managed to get some plates brought out - albeit - the plates were hot and miserably watched the ice cream melt as it hit the sizzling plates.

Overall we left Maestros pretty upset with the experience and the food - especially considering we brought our client here for a fun evening.

Follow up: the following day I received a follow up call asking how we found the experience - I told the caller about the experience and I had a manager try to reach out to me after. I will post an update here after I get in touch with them again.

I did not get to enjoy my meal as much as I wish... =( but I know for a fact that the food was really good..

Me & my girl friend (Amy L) made reservations for 6PM on a Saturday. After dragging ourselves over here from Vdara, we finally made it on time. It was an absolute drag because we were awake for 30+ hours & we felt really crappy from all the "beverages" we consumed... basically we felt like utter sh** and couldn't enjoy our meals =(

Located in the City Center, the restaurant is pretty much in the very center of the building. Service was good but a bit slow. I love the assortment of bread, my favorite is the crunchy cheesey-garlicky one =)

Here's what we ordered:

Lobster Bisque - comes in a huge bowl, tastes very very VERYY rich, not too many pieces of lobster but still pretty delicious

Seared Sea Scallops - I've had this before at Mastro's in Beverly Hills, same thing, still delicious, comes with 3 scallops & yummy cheese/garlic bread. Scallops from Mastro's comes in 2nd place after Providence's :P

 Bone-in Filet - cooked medium. Comes on a sizzling plate, very good rich flavors and good texture. I was only able to eat 2-3 bites. I did eat the leftovers the next morning & it was still pretty tasty. 

Chilean Sea Bass - blacken cajun flavored, I think.. It was pretty damn good, texture is very similar to scallops.

King Crab Gnocchi - big enough to be an entree on it's own, holy sh*t, I don't know how this thing can just be a side dish lol it's meant to be shared amongst 4+ people.. I thought it was pretty yummy, I love cheese and king crab meat... but this is super duper heavy, I probably would not order this again...

Garlic Spinach - tasty but a bit too garlicky for me, it was so infused with garlic that it tasted a bit bitter to me..


I am so sad that we were so full that I didn't get to try to butter cake, AGAIN! =( We didn't have much of an appetite at all, plus I think we ordered a little too much lol... we were stuffed after having a few bites of our appetizers.  Service was good, our waiter was a bit slow though. Our water glasses were never empty (thank goodness, we must have drank a total of 13 glasses each..)

Restrooms are located on the second floor, kind of a hassle to look for. Bad idea to go when you're intoxicated..



Lesson learned: do not attempt fine dining after a night of debauchery....excellent restaurant & food! Must try the butter cake one day.... =(

Impeccable.  Awesome.  Tasty.  

We come here every year for special dinners, and of all places in Vegas, THIS place is our favorite.  Amazing structure to dine in, such a good menu.  Impeccable top to bottom.

Exceptional experience from start to finish. Our server, Sam, was impeccable from the moment we were seated. Staff is coordinated in their approach and teamwork to make your dining experience flawless. Food was excellent: Swordfish and rack of lamb were our selections accompanied with two plentiful sides. High marks for Mastro's!

Surprised my wife with a trip to Vegas for our anniversary.  Stayed at Palazzo and have eaten at Craftsteak, Cut, Delmonico, and being from Chicago, we know our way around our Beef (Nine, Gene and Georgetti's, Gibsons, Chicago Chop House, Keefers, Kinzie...).  Considered return to Cut, booked and unbooked Carnevino and Prime before settling on Mastro's because of our evening plans (Mandarin Oriental for drinks) and because we've wanted to try the newbie here in Chicago.  

Request, and wait for if necessary, the tree house dining.  

Mike R (ASK FOR HIM, HE'S THAT GOOD) did an excellent job with the pacing of our meal.  He knew it was our anniversary and he made sure to congratulate us several times, chat us up without being intrusive, and sincerely took an interest in making our experience pleasurable.

Wife had the bone in Filet (12 oz) and I had the bone in Rib eye...plate, ordered the au gratin potatos to share (our server Mike R recommended one side to share due to the size) and the meal was worth every single of the five stars we are giving this place.    

For our anniversary, they treated us to their signature butter cake.  We were stuffed but did our due dilligence....very tasty, very good, and if you actually save room for it, worth ordering. 

Upon reflection, this was a perfect destination to celebrate an anniversary.  Live music was noticable, but not intrusive, the tree house, particularly when the sun went down, created a very romantic atmosphere.  Have read complaints about the setting (basically in the middle of the mall) but I don't share those complaints.  Yes, you are in a mall, albeit a mall the average person can walk through but not afford to shop in, but you hardly notice the people honestly.  Saw many people enjoying either bottles of wine (like us...oh, and yes the list has some mark up and bottles you would have to mortgage your home to afford, but also some very reasonably priced, well worth the mark up bottles to be enjoyed ... ) or their signature cocktails which were generous pours and will be on "the list" next time we visit.  

But I have to come back to Mkie R, he was a throwback, a restaurant professional who knows the food, knows the wine list, knows the importance of making your feel as though he is there only to make your experience memorable.  I am not kidding, REQUEST him when you visit, you will write me and thank me profusely if you do.  

We return to Vegas in September...will definitely drop by for drinks and desert at minimum.

When you are looking for an incredible meal, look no further then Mastro's Ocean Club located in the Crystals Shopping Mall at the City Center. 

I started with the jalapeño tuna sashimi. I loved this dish. Thin slices of tune w just the right amount of jalapeño made each bit the perfect amount of spicy. Only down side was the dish was a bit oily. 

For my entree I went w the Sea Bass. I can't express enough.. this was hands down the best Sea Bass I've ever had. 

Last but definitely not least.. I finished w the famous Mastro's Butter Cake. Mind blown. It gets better every time.

This place is still a 4 to 4 1/2.  Pricey but great food and service.  The steaks, lobster tail, and sea bass were all worthwhile.  They have a nice bar that you can grab a drink at before dinner and the music they play live is nice.  Typically, standards.  Leave room for dessert.

Decided to have a nice dinner with my husband and everyone recommended to come here.  We were both really excited and wanted to a enjoy a nice dinner even knowing that it would be pricey.  The server was very nice and a great salesman.  He knew exactly to recommend the most expensive items on the menu.

The bread basket is amazing!!!
I think the drinks are WAY too expensive especially with the Vodka that they offer, $18 for a martini with SKY vodka is ridiculous!

Ordered:
18 oz Bone in Filet Mignon - Medium
Lobster mashed potatoes
Mushrooms
and Truffle Fries
Note - side orders are really big and are family style.

Results:
Our steak even with the bone did not look 18 oz (not even close) our steak came rare, we sent parts of it back to cook just for a couple of more seconds and got it back totally well done and gross.  The Lobster mashed potatoes were ok and NOT worth $39 as you barely tasted the lobster and all you tasted were massive amounts of butter.  I would have been happy with garlic mash.  The mushrooms were amazing and probably the tastiest item we ordered.  The really expensive fries were soggy and didn't have much flavor at all.

The manager was nice enough to not charge us for the overly cooked steak but it was quite disappointing to go to specialty restaurant where they don't know how to cook their meat the right way.   Even after they took off the meat the bill came out to $140 and it was totally not worth it.  Very disappointed in our experience here.

Plenty of reviews already so I am going to jump right into it. For sure make reservations if you want to sit in the tree house. We did and we loved it! Waiter was really nice and explained the menu to us while suggesting very popular items. 

For appetizers we started off with the "Oyster Rockefeller" and "Sauteed Shrimp".
The oysters were not bad but let's just say we won't order them again. The shrimp on the other hand were very delicious. Had great seasoning and the creamy butter sauce was pretty amazing.

Main course le boyfriend and I each both had the "22oz Bone in Ribeye". And for sides we did the "Lobster mashed, Cream corn & Sauted mushrooms". Both steaks were cooked and seasoned to perfection. "Seriously best steak I've ever had in my life"... those were the boyfriends words since this was my first time in over a year eating red meat. But I have to agree with him. The lobster mashed potatoes were so creamy and buttery. Cream of corn was very tasty, almost reminded me of the mexican corn with out all the cheese. The sautéed mushrooms were also very delicious. Very happy with the entrees and sides we got. I fell in love with all of them.

Las but not least, DESSERT!. 
Waiter brought us out a chocolate piece of cake with fresh whipped cream. I did not care so much for this cake as it was a little on the dry side for me but eh it was complimentary for our Anniversary. I knew I had to order the famous Butter Cake so I did. The butter cake came out super warm with a big scoop of ice cream on top. Okay so this cake was good but I feel like I've had better dessert. I hate salt on any dessert so this was a huge downfall for me. Cake tasted like a very sweet, buttery corn bread. I don't know how to make out of this cake but if I go back I probably won't order it again. Yes I know very sad as everyone literally worships this cake. Over all I had a great experience and I cannot wait to go back again. I think this is my new favorite steak house.
Awesome fish and wine list.  Service top notch and a first class place.  They could use some musical talent.

Typical high-end steak place format. The location in City Center is unique, in the wooden "treehouse".
Highlights were potatoes gratin, creamed corn, and grilled asparagus. 
The bananas foster cocktail is like a rum desert.
Of course the service is upscale as expected. 
I have been to Mastro's locations in Orange County and here, both were consistently good.

Fab!

Make a reservation and sit in the 'treehouse.'

I was a bit concerned when I read reviews because I am a HUGE fan of the LA location but everything was GREAT! 

Who knew items from the Seafood Tower can be served warm?!?! Pre-cracked Crab Legs? 2lbs heated up please!

The 12oz Petit Filet was devine.

Gnocci with Truffle and Crab, Shrimp Scampi, Sweet Potato Fries... Oh boy!

The staff was also very aware of show times and kept asking to ensure we did not miss our show.

So I have to say starting out I am a Mastro's Ocean Club fanatic! I decided to spend Valentine's day dinner here because oddly enough I live in Las Vegas and never been to one of my favorite hotel chains? What better else day to try it out right? Booked my reservation through opentable.com and actually because of the level of high priority reservations, I had to put down a credit card just to hold my spot. Reservation was for 9PM and once we arrived we were seated immediately which was great because I was starving! Things started off a bit rough for the experience but they made things right and THAT's the part that counts. I know what the quality of food should look and taste like because I dine at the one in Beverly Hills all the time. So for our order we went with the Tomhawk for 2 which was running for $115 and added on a lobster tail ($36) to go with it. The steak is obviously sharing size but the cool part is that they can cook it to the temperature of what each person would like. I am more of the medium and my partner is medium well. So when the steak came out it was incorrect and we asked to have blue cheese crust added which didn't get added and the mac n cheese came out sub par as well, very dry with just no taste! Not sure what the chef was thinking last night but anyways. The fact that I was able to pull the manager aside and address my concerns with the presentation of my meal left me satisfied because he actually cared and fixed it. I commend the him and the staff for going above and beyond to make things right. My Valentines Day meal will now be memorable! Shot Out To Dan! Thanks again!

Wow. Yes wow - the service was amazing only topped by the food. My steak was the best I have ever eaten - I will now dream of this steak, and compare all future steaks to this one!!! Class setting and wonderful night!

Very romantic atmosphere with live music in the bar area (you can also eat dinner there) with superb service & excellent food.

My hubby & I went to Mastros Sunday night to celebrate his birthday.  Everything is a la carte (and very large portions)...so, we split a cesar salad (average but not disappointing in anyway), swordfish (I loved it, but my husband who is very picky thought it was too fishy) , 12 oz filet mignon (great cut of meat cooked to perfection), garlic mashed potatoes (very tasty, maybe a little gluey) and sauteed broccoli (tasty, but boring...we've had the sauteed snap peas before and they are better).  They put a small piece of dry ice in the bottom of my martini glass and my cosmo had a little dry ice smoke...loved that.

Since it was his birthday, they brought out a slice of chocolate cake with a candle.  The cake was damn good.  

Our server was very knowledgeable and helpful.  He was very professional...the entire wait staff was on point.  They took very good care of us.  

BTW, there is an attendant in the bathroom...so bring a dollar with you if you want to be able to tip.

Everything was absolutely perfect. Service, food, atmosphere. Love, love, loved it.

My MIL always says that the first sign of a really fancy restaurant is that if you request a black napkin (to avoid the white lint on your clothes of course), they don't bat an eye and bring you one immediately. Well, at Mastro's, we didn't even have to ask - as we sat down our white napkins were removed and black ones were draped across our laps. Superb start.

Our waiter was both professional and friendly - we really enjoyed the service here.

The food was excellent, and too much of it of course! We wanted to try so many things that there was no way we could really eat it all. 

And, they brought out a complimentary, decadent desert for my 30th birthday to end the night.

We drank and ate our way to belly bulging bliss...ready for club XS after this!

OMG! Where do I start. The Customer service 
is great. I came here for my 5th Year Anniversary. 
The atmosphere was beautiful. They made a lovely
Anniversary menu for us. The food was Delicious. I 
had Roasted chicken & garlic mash, Brussels sprouts
Mmmm, so good my Husband had a Ribeye steak 
mouth watering he said. Just perfect. The end of 
our dinner they presented us with a cake how sweet
was that. Thanks for making our special day 
memorable.

We read the reviews and thought would be a great place for dinner. The live music was so LOUD we could barely talk to each other and we were jammed into a table that had to be moved so we could sit there and still felt like we were bumping into our neighbors. The first waiter that showed was excellent but the second was clearly a jerk. How can this be at a premium restaurant?  I ordered a steak medium and it was grey and overcooked and the 1lb potato was under cooked. My wife's sashimi was good but for these prices, never again.

A very classy restaurant, expensive but worth every single penny... The service is one of the highest First night my waiter was Nick and second was Tim very nice and attentive... Highly recommended this restaurant The food the drinks the dessert the service I don't have anything negative to say my birthday dinner was totally successful.... The cocktail DREAM BERRY is the best and sweet the creme brûlée.. Thank you Mastro's keep up the good work!!!!

GREAT food, bad execution. 

Took my girlfriend to Mastro's Ocean Club last night for her birthday. My parents and I had been there for their anniversary last year, and because of some snafus with the service, Mastro's had thoughtfully provided a gift card for a return visit. The gift card was then given to my girlfriend as a sort of re-gift present. 

Upon arrival, we were seated immediately, and provided everything we ordered with speed and efficiency. In-all, the food was excellent. Too excellent, as it turned out. After our appetizer and soup course, both of us were pretty much full. She was (with much difficulty) able to finish her steak, whereas I was able to consume about a bite-and-a-half of my bone-in ribeye. We basically didn't touch either of the side-dish that we ordered. Dessert was thoughtfully provided to her, as it was her birthday, again which we touched very little. 

Each time our wait staff cleared our table, I informed them clearly that I would be taking whatever remained home with me. That the food was wonderful, but that there was simply too much of it. So imagine my surprise when I went to grab some of the steak and side-dishes for lunch today, only to discover that they weren't there. In fact, with the exception of the dessert, and the remains of one salad, none of our leftovers were sent home with us. Probably a good...$75 wasted. 

The food is amazing, but after my parents' issues, and now this, I will probably not be returning to Mastro's again.

First off, location, location, location.  While it has the name, with this spot inside a shopping mall, you know something else make up for it.  Unfortunately with the rather loud "Billy Joel wannabe" pianist playing all night, and the shoppers strolling by looking at your dining selection, this place does not rate as well as it should.  

While the service was outstanding, the quality was mediocre when comparing it to other similar, better located, places in Vegas.  Price hurts a little too...guess the uberMall rents are high so the costs need to be passed along to the diners.

Since service is one half of a successful dining experience, this is what saved it from garnering a single star.

If you are looking for convenience and staying at Aria or Vdara, you could try this place....or you could walk a little further to other higher end dining experiences.

I've been a big protagonist of Mastro's since I first visited their Beverly Hills location almost four years ago. That visit was hands down my greatest overall dining experience with the service and all things considered. Since that visit, I've been here to the Ocean Club twice... both times were special occasions made very unspecial with the experiences here.

I'm not sure if the Beverly Hills location is just so far ahead of everyone else, or perhaps Mastro's being bought out not too long ago was the cause for a dip in overall quality, but I just don't feel the same about this place. 

There's nothing imaginative or cutting edge about the menu here. It's typical steakhouse fare... beautiful cuts of prime beef, lobster mashed potatoes, king crab gnocchi, louie salads, seafood towers, butter cake and overpriced cocktails. Among your big hitting steakhouses, execution of the chef and service is what will set you apart. 

To my disappointment, Ocean Club LV just doesn't stand out. Both times I've been, the last visit being last month, the service didn't stand out like my first visit to Mastro's. 

When I came for my best friend's bachelor party weekend, three... THREE of our 5 steaks were severely undercooked. We got black and blue ribeyes, and they just re cooked the same steaks we had already cut into and gave them back to us. Pretty laughable for any establishment, let alone one that is supposedly of the highest quality.

Came with my fiancée the second time and the service was SO slow. Our waiter was not at all attentive and very difficult to track down the entire night.

We have been here a few times prior. This time the service was good but the entrees were just average.  My wife had the sea bass and I had the bone in ribeye. The bass was okay but lacked flavor. My ribeye was perfectly cooked but was probably the leanest ribeye I have ever eaten.  Good flavor just needed more fat like a good ribeye should have.

The food is great & the portions are generous.  I had the tuna tartare & the twice baked potato & my boyfriend had the filet & sweet potato fries.  This place never disappoints!  I always look forward to eating here & the one back home in LA.
Impeccable service every time I go and amazing food. You can't go wrong with anything you order, especially the martinis
The food is great (especially the lobster bisque) but for the price I wasn't really feeling the location of the restaurant.

Okay so last night I went on a date the place was nice service was good but 1 would not give 5 stars 4 okay we ask Sautee shrimp for an appetizer Delicious flavor was good shrimp were HUGE great then we ordered our ceasar salad not the best it had some kind of bad flavor to it.. Like seafoodish  and i must of ordered just the wrong meals because it was okay but NOT 5 stars
Any trip to Mastro's is always a good one!! The food and drinks are always perfect!!

In a city full of excellent restaurants Mastro's Ocean Club is too-shelf. Great selection of beef and fish served by an attentive wait staff. We've also gone to group dinners there and they did a wonderful job for 40 guests.

Called in to ask of I can wear sneakers.. the lady said yes! So.. I went in for an amazing birthday dinner..  Steak Filet,  lobster mashed potatoes,  and green beans with a nice glass of wine. Finished with a delicious chocolate cake with a single lit candle.. 
 with freshly whipped cream in a side dish! Heaven!  My waiter with his beautiful smile knew exactly what I needed on my special day! Never had to ask for a thing. His eye contact let me know.. he understood it was MY day! He spoiled me...
Thank you so much. Food was amazing, service exceptional,  the restaurant was beautiful,  peaceful yet elegant!  I loved it and can't wait to return.

Mastro's is among the best steak houses in the country. I like the prime filet. The seafood tower
Is spectacular.

I came here for my Birthday. The food was very impressive and so damn good!!! The pretzel bread they serve is the best!! Our Appetizers were crab cakes and ahi tostadas(these were just okay I've had better :/) I ordered the Sea bass lots of flavor juicy on the inside and a great crunchy crust on the out. My BF had the Lobster, juicy and buttery. Sides were mashed potatoes and green beans all yummy!! And they brought me out a birthday cake that I inhaled!!! 
You definitely get what you pay for..

On my third trip to Vegas, my main priority was not to get sht-face wasted and it was not to shop until I dropped, but rather it was to eat in a treehouse. And that I did! I was sooo excited to try Mastro's (Mah-stro's or May-stro's?) after hearing ridiculously good things about this place. I made reservations online, and called ahead to request a seat in the treehouse. 

Service is impeccable here! Everyone was super nice and friendly. We started with the lemon drop dry ice martini and it was possibly the coolest (pun intended) alcoholic drink I've ever had! The dry ice fizzles over the top and there is a mini tornado in your martini glass!! It tasted great as well! Perfect blend of sweet and tart - with, of course, a kick of alcohol!

To eat, I ordered the filet mignon and we split truffle gnocchi, lobster mashed potatoes and sugar snap peas as sides. My steak was perfectly cooked, silky and tender. The gnocchi and mashed potatoes took it over the top to glutton overload. Those dishes are soooo richhhh and decadent and creammmyyy. Yum. I definitely think I gained 10 pounds that night. 

Bad for your waistline, bad for your wallet, but great for your taste buds!

Two vegetarians walk into a steakhouse and walk out thinking, "That was the best meal I've had in Vegas!!" So what happened?

After spending the day hiking in Utah and then driving 4 hours back to Vegas, we were tired, disheveled, and hungry. It was our last night in Vegas. My dad had raved about Mastro's mac n' cheese for years. So we decided to have some for dinner! 

I admit, I was a little worried that we wouldn't be treated well, being that we were not ordering high priced steaks or seafood. That was definitely NOT the case. We had extremely attentive, first class service the entire time. We decided to eat in the bar so we wouldn't take a table away from steak lovers, and since we were more casual. There was live music, which was loud but not impossible to talk over. 

Our waitress was just awesome. She explained to us that the portions of the sides were huge and we definitely could share. We appreciated this since we didn't need leftover food. We ordered mac n' cheese, asparagus, and drinks. I had the paloma, a grapefruity drink. It was good! Not overly sweet. My friend loved her berry lemonade. Bread was brought out and was very fancy! There were different kinds of rolls, crackers, breadsticks, and pretzel sticks. Very yummy! 

Our meals came out and WOW... the sides were huge! Our waitress served us everything... and whenever we finished, she came to refill our plates. Very classy! We ordered pomegranate martinis on the way through our meal and again... WOW. They were amazing! Order one! They come in a shaker, and are poured table side. There is enough for more than one. The waitress came over and refilled our glasses as needed too. 

We finished every single bite of the mac n' cheese and asparagus. And were full. Too full for dessert. The meal was $100! I can only imagine what it would be with steaks. But it was $100 worth it. 

This would be the first place I'd come back to eat at in Vegas!

I'm sure the entrees were delicious, but in this outing I was in a fast so all I had was vegges and water.  Now on the other hand everyone I was with at the table which was about 20 people loved their entree.  Next time I will indulge.
Must visit if you're in Vegas. Great atmosphere, great service & awesome food. Definitely will go back.

We went there for our anniversary. We usually do not eat at a $$$$ resturant, but it was a special occasion. The menu has wonderful choices for seafood and steaks. Our waiter Austin was the best part of our meal. He was informative about our questions of the steaks and side dishes. Austin even brought us out a delicious chocolate cake for our anniversary,  as a surprise! We enjoyed our meal very much, but we probably wouldn't go back, just because of the expense.

This is one of the most interesting (fancy) places I have ever dined at. The restaurant itself sits in the middle of the Crystals City Center retail area. We were seated in the treehouse-esque area so had a nice view of retail shops and passersby. Service was prompt without being stuffy. Some menu items are $$$$ so be prepared. Sides are rather large so maybe share with your group. This is a great special occasion type of place.

This review is not going to be that long because everything can be very simply put. My wife and I got the filet mignon, it was the best we have ever had hands down. The mashed potatoes were fantastic when they were hot, once they cooled down they were kind of hard. The calamari was the best we have ever had, and the shrimp cocktail was amazing. They brought us out a complimentary chocolate cake for our anniversary, which was great. To top it off the next day they called us to thank us for coming in and asked us if everything was good. Impeccable service, and amazing food this place is a must!!!

Nothing short of amazing.  We spent our anniversary dinner here.   The food was amazing, and the service was top notch.  We had sautéed shrimp as an app, and split the bone in filet, garlic mashed and 2 lobster tails.  All was great, but he highlights....
    1.  The sautéed shrimp was one of the bet things I have ever eaten.  Perfectly cooked.  And the sauce was to die for.  It came with soft garlic bread to sop up the sauce.  I would have been happy with this for my entire meal.  
   2.  I got lobster tail two ways, but the vanilla fried was amazing.   
 
   Lastly and maybe most important was the dessert.  I am it a huge dessert fan, and we probably wouldn't have ordered dessert if it wasn't for them offering it for free for our anniversary.   We are fans for life.   I think they call it butter cake.   It was insane.   We had leftovers and ate it for breakfast.   Soooo good.

*** Word of warning: this steakhouse is located inside a mall and you will most likely have a view of a high-end store while you eat. *** 

Typically, I'm a huge fan of Mastro's and every time we are celebrating a special occasion, we will pay a visit to Mastro's. Unfortunately I was a little disappointed in the Vegas location. 

I will start with the pros. The food was sublime. It was exactly the quality of food Mastro's provides at their locations in Phoenix. I started with the Ocean Club Salad which came with fresh shrimp with blue cheese dressing, avocado and tomatoes. The salad was refreshing and delicious and filled me up! However, I wasn't done just yet. Following the salad, I ordered the crab cake and shared the lobster mac and cheese with my husband. The crab cake was made of fresh crab and was more crab than filling which was perfect. The Lobster Mac and Cheese is always a must and you can't visit Mastro's without ordering it! I also stole a bite of my husband's filet which was cooked to perfection. Yes, I did roll out of the restaurant but rolled out fat and happy from the amazing food! They cook everything to perfection and it's always a gluttonous good time. 

So why the three stars? Sadly, that goes to ambiance and service. The restaurant in located inside a mall. Granted, it's a very high-end mall but it's still a mall just the same. That wouldn't make a huge difference except that the restaurant has an open floor plan with an open balcony which means you are looking out into the mall while you eat. It's very light and bright and just doesn't provide for a very romantic experience. They do have a tree-like structure that you can eat in which hides the mall a little bit, but it's hard to forget that you're in a mall during your meal. Considering that it's Vegas and there are so many venues with wonderful ambiance, I would choose another restaurant next time. 

The customer service was also a bit disappointing. I felt like we were always trying to get our server's attention. He wasn't very attentive to us and anytime we wanted to order another drink or food, we had to hunt him down. We were going to order dessert but it took him so long to check on us that by the time he came to our table, we were just ready to go at that point. I would have liked it if the server was a bit more attentive so that we didn't have to track him down the whole meal. 

While the food was amazing, the ambiance and service left something to be desired and since Vegas has so many restaurants to choose from, we will choose a different restaurant during our next visit to the Strip.

There were 7 of us for dinner.. What we all loved was the personal recommendations from the servers.. From the drinks to the apps to the entrees.. It was pricy, but it was worth it! We got the seafood tower, lots of steaks and recommended sides.. And a free birthday cake/ice cream.. That was amazing... 

We all enjoyed ourselves, everything was great!

We searched so many fine steak houses. Most were four stars and just a few were 4.5.  
Starting with the bar it was a great experience. Huge selection and fat pours.  Our bartender knew her sprits well and we did some taste testing.. And learned some things too. 
The service was great. Everything we asked for was prompt and accurate.  
Food was delish. Bone marrow apps.. Yum.  My steak was perfectly aged and well marbled. 
Everyone at our table was praising me about my selection of this place! 
The bill was reasonable.
The extra bonus of course was that we were not treated like rubes the way Gordon Ramsay Steak does. It was so nice not hearing about the "Hell's Kitchen special" five time before you cane get a word in.

Any chance we can get a date night, we visit one of the Mastro's restaurants.  It's our favorite place in Scottsdale for a relaxing night out without kids.    Great steaks and halibut.    Not recommended for families with kids but perfect for special occasions or when you want a nice night out.

Excellent service from start to finish!  Wife's crab cocktail and filet were perfect.  I was a little disappointed in my bone in New York.  Meat had a large vein of gristle  running through the  middle into the bone.  Martini was larger than average!!

Before I write a review on the food, I need to give a big shoutout to Patrick Donahue, our waiter and his wait staff. Patrick and his team provided excellent service to our table!

I came to Mastro's with 14 clients and everyone was raving about the service and the food. 

Patrick gave us excellent descriptions on all the different kinds of shell fish available. He knew what oysters were  more mild than others, where they came from, and he did a great job putting 4 different seafood towers together. I highly recommend the seafood tower if you like shell fish - everything tasted so fresh!

I had the Chilean Sea Bass, and it was the best piece of fish I've ever had! Growing up in New England my whole life, I've had some really good seafood but nothing as good as this Chilean Sea Bass (blackened). 

Everyone else either had the Chilean Sea Bass or some kind of Steak. Everyone loved their food and said the steaks were cooked to perfection. 

 Dining at Masteo's is more than just dinner, it's an experience you won't forget!

I also have to give a shoutout to Tanya, the  event planner. Tanya did an excellent job coordinating our reservations and preparing us for the evening.

Thank you to everyone at Mastro's!

- Kevin

A huge thanks to Brandon (manager) and Marc (server) for making my bf's birthday a night to remember!!! The service was amazing and the food was delicious. We enjoyed the oysters Rockefeller, halibut and the filet, along with the peas, and a few drinks. I loved the berry cocktail and the after dinner chocolate cocktail!! Marc ended our special celebratory evening with a slice of chocolate cake (which is my bf's favorite!) and a birthday candle. Everything about the restaurant is top notch!! Look forward to going back on our next visit to Vegas. Thanks again to the entire staff that made the night so special. :)

If there was a choice to put 10 stars, id so rate it a perfect 10!!!! Loved the food, everything was as fresh as it gets, service was awesome, by far the best place we've dined at in arizona, the setting is lovely!!! Everything was perfect, eventhough its pricey, but definitely worth every penny!!!!
Good seafood restaurant here at crystal mall Las Vegas. And I really love drink here they're call Mastro's Lemon Drop and Dream Berry serve with dry-ice that so cool.

Thanks to a coworker's recommendation and fellow Yelpers, we had a wonderful Christmas dinner here. We requested the Tree House area and it's where you want to sit. We had a drink at the bar while waiting to be seated and Randy served up an awesome Lemon Drop martini for me and a Key Lime Pie martini for my wife. We had the grilled salmon and ahi tuna sashimi, so good. And as many before me have said here, the signature butter cake dessert is phenomenal. Finally, a comment about service. Kudos to the entire staff and management are due. We walked up to the hostesses and we were welcomed by big smiles. Then off to the table, from the bar, and the hostess carried the drinks for us. Robert, our waiter, and a host of other men with bread and water and what ever we needed made this one special dinner experience. Thank you and see you again soon.
Love the Ocean Club! Lobster Mashed Potatoes! Doesn't get much better than that!

Hand's down, some of the best seafood I've ever had.   Everything was fresh and excellently prepared.  The sides are great for sharing and it's definitely worth it to take the plunge for the lobster mashed potatoes.  The service was exceptional and the interesting martinis were a treat!  Great people watching with it being located in a fashion mall in Las Vegas as well.
The N9ne is much better....I've had better at Red Lobster and that's sad...save your money or go to the N9ne at the Palms

Second time to eat here, almost exactly one year apart from each other--both times for a bachelor party.  We actually had the same waiter both times.  This place is fantastic.  We had a seafood tower for the appetizer with all kinds of incredibly fresh items (dungeness crab, two types of oysters, lobster, shrimp, snow crab, etc.).  You can get that made to fit a particular price point per person.  The scallops were incredible.  The wine selection is great.  Highly, highly recommend.

My wife and I just ate here for the second time last week.  We were on a short vacation from the east coast.  We had loved this restaurant the first time and have been talking about the chocolate cake dessert for the previous two years.  Well the second time around was as good if not better.  Wonderful margarita cocktail, steak, fish, sides and of course dessert - chocolate cake and the butter cake.  We were enjoying the leftovers for a couple of days.  Will definitely come back here next time we are in Scottsdale.  Many good restaurants in the Kierland area.

took some clients here for a business dinner after reading some reviews from other yelpers.  the meal was jaw dropping to all of us!

started with a seafood tower, which featured some excellent, fresh tasting selections.  continued with one of the best caesar salads i've ever tasted, then a great bone-in ribeye.  i highly recommend the lobster mashed potatoes as a side.  

everyone else reported high marks on their entrees; i also tried another person's scallops entree.. unbelievably good.  if i ever return, would probably choose that as main course.

bottom line, i dont think you can go wrong here.  we ordered a LOT of food, and all of it was stellar.

A bit disappointed with their steak, our group had an array of steak, rib eye bone in, rib eye, filet mignon, and a salmon dish. Granted it's Mastro's ocean club, their salmon was excellent, but their steak. Egh, dry not too flavorful. Service was excellent, we sat upstairs in our own room which was lovely.  However the service did not make up for the food. Will not be returning.
