My wife had the Alaskan king crab legs, and it was literally 3 giant legs, already half shelled. Amazing. Good dessert, great selection of scotch and fancy drinks and presentations for plates. The ambiance was great too. You could tell it was all fancy. Service was good. Definitely don't come if you are in a rush. We were there for over 2 hours, but we never felt like we were waiting. It was a "good" 2 hours. Unless you're super rich and you know it, I'd hold off wearing jeans and tennis shoes. This place is too fancy for normal attire. Slacks and a nice shirt or polo would do fine.

I've been to the mastros and Costa Mesa, but this one in Vegas probably has better customer service.

The food quality is the same, and tastes the same. They offer most of the same food items but for some reason Vegas is a little cheaper. 

For the appetizer I got the lobster bisque and the mastros Cobb salad? I suggest ordering the salad as a half size the portion was huge even split between two people. The lobster bisque was soooooo good! I didn't want to share, but I did. I'd definitely pick that over the salad any day. 
We ordered a bottle of red wine...forgot the name but it was pretty reasonable for $45. 
For the main course I got the bone in ribeye, snap peas, mashed potatoes, sautéed mushrooms. All were really good! I was super full from drinking and our appitizers we had to make most of it back to our hotel. But the leftovers were still amazing as a late night snack. 
I suggest sitting in the "tree house" it seems a little more intimate than in the other section.
Lastly thy brought us out the better cake and oh my gosh! They did not have this option at the Costa Mesa one. This seriously was so good!

I've been to the Beverly HIlls location and it is my favorite steak joint. The service was awesome here but the food was very disappointing. Portions were way smaller and the quality was not the same. Very disappointing when I was hyping it up to my family. I will not be back.

First time here. We had a private dining room for large group. Dinner overall was great. Seafood towers ordered & very fresh. Ordered swordfish but it was a bit salty and was not able to eat it all (didn't care to send it back, it was very tender though) Lobster mash & other vegetable side dishes were good, didn't care for the lobster mac n cheese.  My husbands steak was good, others ordered the salmon which looked delicious, will order the salmon or steak next time around. I've never had ahi tuna which was also ordered by some in the group & they were very happy with their choice (it did look good). . The waiters hustled, but at the end of our meal I requested a coffee & never got it while others did. We managed to get dessert the warm butter cake. Yum!!!  It just felt like they were overwhelmed.  I'd rather come to visit just the hubby & I for our 2nd visit.

Absolutely recommend Mastro's Ocean Club.  We had a wonderful experience in the tree house.  We started with an apple martini and a berry martini.  The apple martini comes out smoking, we also saw a Cosmo come out the same way.  A really cool touch!  We order an appetizer of shrimp cocktail, it come with three but since there were two of us Lionel ( our server) suggested we get four, so we did.  They were huge and very tastie.  The cocktail sauce was delicious along with some very hot horseradish, perfect balance.  We also ordered ahi tuna as an appetizer, this was amazing too.  Ordered salmon prepared blackened style and my husband order tuna Asian style with a side of asparagus.  We ordered way to much food as the portions are very generous.  We then had raspberries sorbet, which was to die for.   So, I mentioned large portions..we took home tuna, salmon and asparagus to our hotel room and ate a wonderful lunch in the room the next day.  They also boxed up the bread, which is a variety of sourdough, pretzel roll and something like a baguette.  Our lunch was just as good as our dinner.  I mentioned Lionel earlier in my post.  Well, you must request him as your server, he is personable and very professional at the same time.  Be sure to sit in the tree house.  It is expensive, but well worth the splurge!

My husband has been spoiling me rotten for the last days of my 30s. We had the pleasure of coming here Monday night. We were greeted my the beautiful Jasmine who told me she had the same exact birthday as me ( only she was 1993 and I was 1973) but we were so giddy about it. Once we were seated our server Allen was one of the most attentive servers I've ever had. He was so polite and knowledgable, he knew every detail about the menu and made sure the food was to our liking. I got the lobster bisque, and the scallops. My husband got the fresh oysters, and seared tuna. Everything was perfect! Then they came with my chocolate cake with fresh cream. I cried, it was magical! I hope I don't have to wait another ten years to come back. What an experience!

Ocean Club is expensive, flashy and some say a "must-do" in Scottsdale. We found it expensive & flashy but a "MUST DON'T!"   Try someplace else your money is too precious to waste here.  Everything from wine to food was wrong but all served with a smile. We started with oysters Rockefeller. This old school dish should be warm, bathed lightly in spinach and cheese & above all succulent.  These were flat out over cooked. The  oysters were rubbery and the cheese was bone dry & crispy. All-in-all the major components were flavorless. The predominate flavor was bacon. Hence, we never eat "Bacons Rockefeller" again. The salads were unevenly dressed so that the top was tasty & the bottom swimming in globules of dressing. As for the main courses, my wife's lemon sole was ok but my Artic char was over done and mealy. Moreover, the restaurant seems to be afraid of their products so they default to butter or bacon for flavor in all the dishes we had. Finally, the wine service failed. My wife asked if their Chenin Blanc was dry "oh yes," replied the server.  Wrong - it was sweeter version of this Loire varietal fortunately they switched easily.  Then with our bottle of wine it took 3 tries to get it right and they failed there. They first presented the wrong vintage (not the one represented in the wine list); then they tried to offer a bottle $100 more than requested. They and we settled on wine from a different vineyard and vintage. They at first wanted to charge us $60 more for the bottle to match what I asked for, but adjusted when I pointed out the discrepancy.  Again don't go
Biggest shrimp I've ever had in a shrimp cocktail. Smoked salmon, perfect! & the duck horn red was mui deliciso!

The name Mastro's is known to a lot of people for their steaks already.  We happened to be in Vegas for our anniversary, so we decided to have dinner there as our celebration.

Because this place is located at the City Center right in the middle of the mall, so it doesn't carry the same kind of "exclusiveness" as the one in Costa Mesa or B Hill.  Dress code is also easier, only required hotel casual, so shorts and tees are welcome.

Just as mentioned by most, the staff are extremely polite and friendly, that was a great start already.  We got seated fairly quickly and our waiter brought us the wine / cocktail list quickly.  I asked for the Mastro's Mojito cocktail, which is rum with lime and mint.  It's not very strong and I like it a lot.

We were aware of the portion at Mastro's, and since my wife is pregnant she can't eat too much.  So I asked the waiter if it's OK for us to split the steak and allow us to try more other dishes.  They were very understanding and said absolutely no problem at all.

For appetizer, we went ahead and ordered the sauteed scallops.  We were both very very impressed with the dish.  Three gigantic scallops, all prepared and seared to perfection, and the sauce was awesome together with the bread.  It was very rich and good.

We also ordered the lobster bisque, and they went ahead and split the soup between two bowls for us, that was very nice.  The waiter also came and helped us split the scallop appetizer on our dish, that's great service.  We also tried the pretzel bread together with the soup, they all paired together very well!!!!!!

My wife particularly loved the lobster bisque.  She commented that a lot of times the lobster bisque she has is way too salty, but the one we had was just right.  Very smooth and rich in lobster flavor, but it doesn't get overpowered by the saltiness.

For steak, we ordered the bone-in 18oz filet and we asked them to split a small portion for my wife (medium well).  Mine was cooked medium rare.  It was simply fabulous.  Meat was very tender and juicy, and even my wife's portion, though cooked medium well, was still very tender.  

And I have to say one of the most important thing they did right was resting the steak well before serving.  Most of the time when I eat steak, by the end it was juice all over the dish.  But not this time, all the juice was retained inside, that was awesome.

We also got the lobster mashed potato as side dish.  It's good, a lot of lobster as stated by others, though I agree with my wife, while it's good, for $36 bucks, it's basically lobster mixed with mashed potato.  It doesn't have that "specialness" in some sense.

Since it was our anniversary, they gave us a big chocolate cake.  It was BIG, and it tasted really good too!

At the end of the day, we were impressed with the dinner.  It's not cheap by any means, but for special occasions, the quality and quantity of food?  I think it's worth it.  Although part of me still wonder how the experience would differ if we were to go to the one at Costa Mesa.

I didn't believe it when I heard the Ribeye was hard to finish.

From my experience, fine dining is hard to get full. This was not the case here. I was warned about the size of the steak and from the menu it was 22oz! That's ridiculous! Even if the bone was about 5oz, that's still a whopping 17oz!

All the servers here are exceptionally knowledgeable and professional. I felt like I was not treated as a kid eating at the adults' table. 

We all shared a portion of the lobster mashed potatoes and by far they are the best mashed potatoes I've ever had. I would highly recommend trying this dish.

For my main entree, I ordered the 22oz Ribeye cooked medium rare. Although next time I would probably get rare+, I thought the medium rare was still delicious. The steak was massive and amazingly flavored. By the end of the meal I felt overwhelmed and defeated. I have never been conquered by how much steak there was until Mastro's.

My brain kept telling me to eat more but my stomach fought against this decision.

Overall, Mastro's was a great experience. The steak here, so far, is only second to the Kobe beef I had in Japan. I would definitely come back for seconds.

Ocean Club is a great place to impress a date. The atmosphere is great, service is fantastic and the food is good. The atmosphere and service surpasses the food. 
They serve a great basked of bread. But they can skip everything but the pretzel bread. I am totally addicted to Ocean Club's  pretzel bread. I always order more and they bring another basket which the waiter delivers without a roll of the eyes . The butter is soft - can't stand it when the butter comes out a cold little ice cube. Here it is soft and ready to spread. We started with the Seafood Tower. We picked crab, lobster and a few others.  That was where we could have stopped and been full but didn't. 

I had the lemon sole. Okay I was not that impressed. It was  a bit dry and not much flavor. That was disappointing but since I was full already - not a big deal. My guy got the Chilean Sea Bass and loved it. Of course we had the lobster potatoes which is a rich and large dish that could be a dinner for two. Then we topped it off with their signature Butter Cake and chocolate cake. Both were great. But portions are big so you really only need one dessert (and more romantic to split a dessert!). 

The service is the best thing about Ocean Club. The wait staff is attentive but don't interrupt you every 15 seconds. They seem to just know when something is needed or wanted. 

If you want to impress your date, get seating inside the restaurant area. If you want to do people watching and the noise doesn't bother you, the bar area is the place to be.

A mall restaurant by any other name is a mall restaurant.  Beautiful mall by the way. This restaurant is very very very expensive.  My personal recommendation is don't order rack of lamb well done.  It comes out inedible as punishment for liking well done.  I have made and ate well done rack of lamb all over the world. Never has a restaurant cooked it in such a way that a knife could not cut it AT ALL.  Service was great though. My husbands steak just ok.  Butter cake was wonderful though.  We would not return.  Much much better restaurants in Vegas.

We had an amazing time ringing in 2014 at Ocean Club.  We made dinner reservations at 9 intending to hang out the rest of the night.  Table was ready right away, server was awesome and the food didn't disappoint!  We all ordered a surf-n-turf steak and lobster combo and shared the lobster mashed potatoes.  The warm butter cake is a MUST order! Yum!

Great way to ring in the new year and we are considering going back next year!

BF and I stopped in while enjoying an impromptu mini vacation in Arizona.   There is something wonderful about deliberately leaving your Southern Calif. coastal community in late August and going to Scottsdale Arizona during her off season.  Everything is open and everything is available.   And Mastro's never disappoints. 

The service levels are so superior that the food pales in comparison.   Every moment is attended to with grace and professional courtesy.  

Dinner was a "made to order" surf and turf split between the two of us.  They even split the steak and cook ours to order, his rare and mine medium.   The lobster was sweet and moist.  The creamed corn and creamed spinach beyond compare.  Everything was done with our intent in mind.   

Only small flaw was the Creme Brulee.  Our server highly recommended the butter cake and I think we should have listened.   It seemed as though the Brulee was made earlier in the day and sat in the refrigerator.   The caramelized sugar was too cold to have been made to order. 

The wine list was a little more limited than my expectations but was quickly relieved with a reserve list upon order. 

And a phone call the following day to thank us for visiting. 

It get's no better than this. 

Thank you!

Ocean Club has been one of my favorite restaurants since moving to the area 3 years ago.  I ate there again two weeks ago and was reminded of how much I love it - and why.  The food is amazing.  Ah.ma.zing.  And yes, you can get amazing food at many places, but the service is really what sets it apart.  There are few places that I actually enjoy paying this much for dinner, but here I'd gladly pay more.

Must have's:  seafood tower, lobster mashed potatoes, butter cake

I live in Orange County and have always wanted to try Mastro's steakhouse but have never had the chance. A short trip to Vegas and we needed a place to dine- so Mastro's Ocean Club was the choice for the evening! When we made reservations, we asked to be seated in the treehouse- what a cool ambience! Bread basket was super yummy but pace yourself- don't want to fill up before that delicioussteak gets to your table! Orders at the table included: Mastro's salad, filet mignon, shoestring french fries, baked potato, side of mushrooms, and the sauteed asparagus. All were delicious! All 3 of us had the filet and it was perfectly cooked and DELICIOUS. Can't wait to go back! We were so full but had to have dessert so ordered the butter cake and we were not disappointed. I'm not a huge fan of cake but this was one of the best desserts I have ever had. Great service and great food!

Went here on a recommendation from a friend who is a regular.... went with my sister for her birthday.  Now you know the place is great when its part of a basket / bird nest sculpture...

On a serious note, the food was out of this world. I had the bone-in filet mignon, medium - one of the best filets I've EVER had...and I've had a lot of filets.  I can't remember all the sides I had, but they all were great as well. The sides are served "family style" so you can share with one or two people at a time.
Service was at part overall. The hostesses were very accommodating with reservations (might be because it was a Monday). We did have to flag down our server once or twice...and usually I ding a restaurant for having to do that...but the food was so great this place gets a pass.
Oh, and I think we were the youngest patrons the entire time. Could've been a fluke...again, was a Monday night.  

Definitely would come again!

Place was amazing! How can you go wrong with Mastros! The only difference here is that their is a lot more seafood on the menu. Great service, great environment, come early and have a drink at the awesome bar/lounge/piano lounge. Seafood tower was amazing, butter cake was amazing as usual, service was not as good as Chicago but it was still good for Arizona. Place was packed with a lot of older people, and football players that I had no idea what team they played for. Great date spot, or even just for a fancy cocktail or glass of wine. We have a great time, my
Boyfriend loves Mastros

Went to this Mastro's last year while visiting the area for a meeting, and as expected, had a great experience. I have been to the ones in Vegas and Laguna beach a few times, and the food, drinks and service have been consistently great at all locations. This Mastro's has one of the most lively scenes, and it was packed to the gills. The crabcake, and the swordfish were excellent. I really like their cocktail menu, and wine list, which are fairly similar to the other locations. While crowded and a bit loud, it was a fun place to go, and will definitely go back next time I get to the area.

Yes yes yes! Took some friends and clients for a beautiful dinner here. What can i say? Amazing food. Highest quality I've had in a VERY long time. The steaks were amazing, perfectly cooked and all topped off with their truffle butter (highly recommended but an extra $15 add-on, I know. I can buy a lot of butter for $15, but worth it). Yum! Also ordered a fairly large seafood tower. It was stocked with lobster, large crab claws, oysters, crab legs. Can you say, Unbelievable! With our steaks, we ordered the following sides. Creamed spinach, mac and cheese, and the gnocci. All amazing. Obviously the price here is fairly hefty but was well worth it. Impeccable service with our waiter anticipating our every need. We ordered so much food that they ultimately comped us on a free desert. Way to go Maestros. Will most definitely come again!

Definitely must do spot if you're celebrating a special occasion.  Pricey? Yes, but you're worth it!  
Hubby took me for my x0th bday. 

First order of the night were drinks and appetizer. I ordered a lemon drop and surprised that the whole shaker remained on the table. I had probably 3-4 glass servings. There was dry ice in my martini glass so the fog effect was a nice treat!  For appetizer, we shared the crab cake which was just enough for us two. They brought out the bread (different types) and ALL freshly baked!  We also shared a Caesar salad per recommendation of our server cuz it was a good size. Not your average Caesar - you can tell is was all from scratch down to the anchovies.  For the main course, I ordered a 6oz filet and hubby ordered 12oz. Both perfect as expected. For the sides, we had the lobster mash potatoes (OMG!) and sautéed asparagus. All of it was scrumptious. Finally, they brought me my bday cake - butter cake topped with vanilla ice cream and a side of housemate whipped cream.  It was yummy and rich, But truly, this could be shared by six people, I barely scratched the surface. 

Great atmosphere, great servers, awesome food!

I'm so disappointed to write this review.  We had such high expectations of Mastro's having been to their other locations.  Celebrating our wedding anniversary and completely giddy, we sat down, ordered cocktails and dove into the incredible bread basket.  Our waiter seemed annoyed with us from the start, but no big deal, we ignored it.  I ordered chicken (please spare me the "you don't order chicken at a seafood place" lecture...I ordered it because it was on the menu, so let's get through that, k? Lol).  Our waiter was non-existent all evening, so he wasn't around at all for me to tell him that the chicken was glaringly under-cooked.  The manager happened to see us looking around and took it back to the kitchen.  He brought the same re-cooked piece back, but one spot (it was a really thick piece) still didn't look ok.  We had the flash light out and kinda debated if it was cooked enough, but the chance of eating slightly under-cooked chicken and getting sick was not an appealing option to me.  (And should I be having this debate at such a fine restaurant?).  I decided not to chance it, but not say anything.  The manager saw me not eating (our waiter was still in abandonment mode), took it away and insisted on replacing it with a filet.  The filet came out and was delicious and we were happy, albeit the mood had changed.  We felt like we had done something wrong.  Honestly, our least favorite meal of the whole weekend.  No butter cake, no second drinks--happy anniversary to us.  :(

Thank you to the manager for not charging us for my chicken or filet and really trying to fix it, but I'm so sad we spent our anniversary there.

My husband & I went to Ocean Club on Saturday to celebrate my new job (yay!). If only we could afford to celebrate more at such an elaborate restaurant!

I love a good bread basket & this one did not disappoint. We started with oysters which were fabulous (you get 6). For my entree I ordered the sea bass & Ryan ordered the scallops as well as a side of garlic mashed potatoes. The portions were more than generous & everything was cooked perfectly. It was so much food that we didn't have room for dessert, so the warm butter cake will have to wait til next time.

Between the topnotch service & fabulous food, you have to expect a hefty bill. We'll probably only be so lucky to go once in a blue moon, so it was worth every penny!

I Love to try new restaurants whenever I visit Vegas.  Our party had a craving for High Quality Steaks and we luckily found Mastro's though Yelp.

We scheduled a reservation last minute and they were able to find a table for us.  Food and drinks here was delicious and the service was great! 

The next day I noticed a discrepancy with the charges on my credit card.  I called and spoke to the manager.  He was very attentive and responded to my concern in a very timely manner.  The experience here was wonderful.

If you're in the mood for a luxurious dining experience in LV, definitely try Mastro's Ocean Club!!

I was so excited to try Mastros for the first time after hearing such amazing things about the place. Boyfriend made reservations here for our 8 year anniversary on a Saturday evening, requesting to sit inside the "treehouse" that everyone on yelp recommended. They even called him the day before to confirm if we were still coming. 

We arrived about 5 minutes early and the host immediately had an "oh crap" look once we gave her the name for our reservation. She said if we wanted to sit in the treehouse it would be a 45 minute wait.. I was so upset because we made reservations almost a month in advance and the fact that they called us the day before to make sure we were still coming... Whatever

We didn't want to wait the extra 45 minutes cause we were starving, so they sat us at a different table. 

We ordered cocktails, which were really good and strong! We got crab legs as appetizer and they were really fresh, I liked the cocktail sauce that came with it. We decided to share the bone in filet because we didn't want leftovers because the hotel we stayed at had no fridge, they were kind enough to split this for us. We also ordered scalloped potatoes as a side. The steak was okay, a little too salty for my liking. The potatoes were still hard, I wish we got Mac and cheese instead. Even though we split the steak we still couldn't finish it, we ended up taking it togo along with the potatoes. 

For dessert we got the infamous butter cake and it was delicious! They put and candle and wrote happy anniversary, which was really sweet of them. When the check came I noticed that they charged us for the anniversary cake, I was reading other reviews that people got their dessert comped?! Anyways, overall I'm not sure if I'll return, at least not this location. I'm still bitter that they couldn't accommodate our seating arrangement for our anniversary.

Oooh, we fancy!

The boy and I got all dolled up for after-dinner drinks. It was around midnight (where the night just begins on the Vegas strip), and the place was beginning to clear out (big win for us).

He ordered a Manhattan (as a real man does) and I wanted something spicy, so I got a Bloody Mary. 

His drink: strong, bold, tasty--just like him!
My drink: spicy, salty, and filled with every vegetable you can imagine--just like... me? 

Seriously, though, the Bloody Mary was excellent; it was one of those that burned your throat; being the masochist that I am, I quite enjoyed it. I was also able to snack on the olives and giant celery stick that accompanied it. A drink AND a meal--what more could you possibly want?

It wasn't cheap, but then again, we didn't expect it to be--a snazzy joint like that.

Poor customer service. Very rude hostess (Asian young lady with dyed blond hair working on the evening of 09/26/15). No eye contact when we arrived, no eye contact as we were speaking to her. We understood that there were extremely busy during the time and we had to wait, but interaction with the first person you encounter makes a big difference in your whole experience. The first encounter ruined our whole dining experience. We made the mistake of staying because we were so hungry even though we had to wait an extra half hour even with reservations. We were hoping the service after the first encounter would be better but the whole experience just felt rushed. The food was so so. The one star is for the Chilean Sea Bass which was excellent but the rest you can find at other similar restaurants. For the price you spend at a restaurant such as this, we expected better customer service at the very least.  Would not recommend as there are much better coptions in Vegas with similar menus, much better service, and much better ambiance (not in a mall).

We dined at Mastro's at the suggestion of my client.  It's an interesting location in the Crystal shopping center right off the strip.  The food was very good as was the service.  But it's spendy!  $18 glass of Glenlivet 12, $14 for Soli and Tonic.  And a word of advise, don't open the wine menu if you are faint of heart.  With that said, if you just crushed it at the tables and you got some money to spend - have fun!

Mastro's is definitely one of the best places for a nice night out or for a celebration dinner in Scottsdale. The food is always good, and the service is great as well. The only downside is that even when you make reservations, I've previously had to wait up to 30 minutes for our table to be ready. I've enjoyed Ocean Club several times, but on 5/11/18, though the food was still good, it did not live up to the expectations I had from previous times eating there. Pictured are everything I ate/tried, the clear lobster roll, seared scallops, truffle crab gnocchi, truffle butter wild mushrooms, and the butter cake. The sauce under the sushi was amazing and spicy, and no complaints on the butter cake! However the scallops could have been seared more, and the mushrooms were so drenched in the butter that they became soggy (if you want mushrooms from here I prefer the roasted button mushrooms they are to die for!!). Overall it was still a good dining experience and I will definitely be back again.

I have to say, the staff was absolutely fabulous! We came to mastro's at the last minute after having a terrible experience elsewhere. We had to salvage our anniversary dinner somehow and mastro's was able to squeeze us in on a busy vegas night. Not only did they listen to our story(which is another review entirely) but made up for it tenfold. 

Our waitress was knowledgeable about the menu and the wine list, and helped us select the perfect dinner choices. I must say the gnocchi w snow crab and truffles was exceptional, literally the best I have ever tasted. We also ordered a pair of lobster tails that were also excellent. To our surprise they comped us their signature desert w a happy anniversary message written in chocolate across the plate. Everything we tasted was outstanding.

Again I have to thank the staff for a truly memorable experience. Every person from the busboys to the manager were very professional and treated us like regulars. I would give Mastro's my highest recommendation and encourage anyone to give them a try.

Everything here is absolutely amazing. I had the ribeye and it the best I've ever had. The truffle mushrooms are to die for and the Mac n cheese forget it. Our drinks were wonderful and the service was impeccable. Can't wait to go back!

The service here is amazing - probably the best I've experienced.  The attention to detail was ridiculous.  All of the wait staff was very friendly and attentive and worked together seamlessly to make our experience as pleasant as possible.

They had a moderate sized wine list with a good selection of reasonably priced bottles as well as several by the glass options.  No complaints there.

For our entree, I ordered the bone in ribeye and my wife got a filet.  This was probably my first experience at a high end restaurant where the steaks were wet aged.  My impression was unfortunately mixed.  The steaks were definitely supremely tender but they lacked that meaty punch that good dry aged steaks usually have.  Overall they tasted like a really tender version of a supermarket steak - not bad but definitely below expectations.

We got the warm butter cake for dessert which was very good.  It's big enough for 2-3 people to share though you won't want to share it.

Anyway, aside from the somewhat disappointing steaks, this was an amazing meal and experience.  We'll certainly be back next time we're in town.

Everything from the bread basket to my appetizer to my steak to dessert to service was outstanding at Mastro's!!  I have nothing bad to say about this place.  Okay, if I had to pick one thing... I would say if you're looking for a "romantic" dinner date setting, I would probably say this is NOT the place.  It's in the middle of a mall.  But, romance is what you create so to me, if the food is good and service is great, that's really what counts!  Our server was awesome.  He made great recommendations, was attentive, was kind, was not annoying in the sense that he was trying to recommend only the most expensive things.  He was honest about what was good and not just based on price.  The steaks were cooked to perfection and they are huge!!!  You can seriously share a steak.  Like really.  The sides were amazing and also huge.  I mean seriously... Truffle Gnocchi!?!?  Holy hell!  And Lobster Mash?!!!  Yes please!  And you need to save room for the butter cake. You just have to.  It was so good.  I mean like really good.  I don't know what else to say, it really was that good!

The service was excellent and the food delicious. However, the location wasn't my favorite since the restaurant is located inside the Crystal's LV shopping center and it has an open view which you can see all the shops. Otherwise, it would be 5 stars.
Amazing service and fantastic food. Well worth the price tag! Servings were more than generous. I recommend the Crab Oscar!

Had our late Valentine's dinner here tonight, and this place is phenomenal! My family and I love to try different restaurants, and out of the many restaurants we've been to, living her in Vegas for the past 20 years, Mastro's is by far the best we've been to! Capital Grill, Gallaghers, Sonoma Cellar, Hank's, and the list goes on, but nothing beats the food and service we've experienced tonight. The staff there were very attentive, someone always there to make sure everything was as we liked it. The food, I must say was exquisite! The ribeye steak was cooked to perfection, soft and flavorful. The salmon filet was flaky and juicy..the lobster mashed potato is a must! And to end it all, as full as we were..we just had to get the butter cake, which I can say was heaven! Very good experience, and we will definitely be back! Thank you Mastro's for an unbeleivable night!

Came here for a business meeting and my boss told me to try their martinis. 
I am not, what-so-ever, a martini drinker but, I cannot rave enough about their Dragonberry martini.

Off the bat, I was thrown off by the jalapeno in the drink but, I think that's what made the drink different, special, and delicious for me.
It had that extra kick with alllllll that alcohol.

My dessert and drink experience was definitely worth five stars, but I can't give five stars without tasting the dinner menu. The butter cake dessert filled with cream cheese is out of this world. Three of us shared it.

The Fountain of Youth is the drink to get--if you're considering that or the Raspberry Flirtini. 

Service was amazing. Prices are high. Drinks are around $17 each.

For what you pay, I expected much more on all fronts. First off, we had to get our entrees to go because we were going to be late for a show (not the fastest restaurant) and they forgot to include mine...so so sad :(  Too late to return to get it though. Otherwise I was just generally unimpressed. We were put in the darkest corner with no lights so the ambience was a little off to me. All the food was just blah, not bad, but not what you expect for the price. Fried calamari had too little seasoning for me. Seared ahi tuna was pretty tasty I will say, but there was like 4 thin pieces not much to eat. Spicy mambo salad was basically like ceasar salad. Seafood tower was decent and included raw oysters, lobster, crab...the basics. I was going to take pictures, actually I tried, but as I said place was nightime dark in there. Anyways, I'd take my money elsewhere personally. But again, I didn't have my dinner so...

Dan is an amazing manager. He accommodated a different table for us to our liking after our reservation. I have been her a million times, or so it feels like, and each time it the menu and staff improve. The oysters were amazing. It is definitely worth asking what the catch of the day is. We had Fanny Bays, which are a bigger more meaty oyster, the blue points and the kumomotos were spectacular. 

We ordered the scallops- to die for. However everything is great here. From the bone-in-ribeye to the swordfish. We started out this evening with the crab cakes, which were phenomenal. 

Our wine choice was point on, Dan did direct us in the right direction. We shared Justin by the bottle , along with speaking pelligrino. We did have two glasses of an amazing red blend as well at the bar. 

I have never been unhappy with Ocean Club. It is the best of the best!!

My wife and I had dinner on August 9 as a treat while we were in Vegas. We were not disappointed. It was an overall great dining experience. The atmosphere was excellent. The food was good to great. My wife's steak was a tad over cooked, but my steak "Oscar style" was awesome! The sides were generous and delicious (lobster bisque, gargonzola Mac & cheese, king crab gnocchi). And the butter cake for dessert...wow! The service was impeccable from our waitress Tanya to the support staff. Tanya was informative, attentive, and most of all friendly. If we make it back there, we will request her table for sure because we were very impressed. So, even though it is pricey, I highly recommend Mastro's. Cheers.
Excellent service and amazing food! Wish i could eat here more often. Best appetizers and everything is cooked perfectly. And the butter cake is wow
Couldn't stop eating...steak, calamari, scallops, lobster mashed potatoes, spinach, butter cake!!  Impeccable service, nice views of crystals, and awesome leftovers:)

Wow! Wow! Wow! is all that I can say!  I am a huge fan of Mastro's and have been to most of them in the Los Angeles area but I have to say this is the most unique one I've ever seen. Located in the shops at Crystals which in itself is a gorgeous mall, this beautiful wood structure houses The Ocean Club Mastro's in Las Vegas. And as usual the food is always amazing here. My go to favorites have always been the bone in ribeye, the cream corn and the always delicious pretzel bread. And to top it off the always delicious butter cake.... the best dessert I've ever had in my life! I have tried to go to other steakhouses but I always come back to Mastros...hands down the best steakhouse in the country....

Omg great cocktails food excellent and The service the best this place is top notch valet parking also must go too they also have a live band/dj area by the bar surrounded by glass so you can't hear it in the dining area

The halibut was great! It did have a white wine butter sauce but the scallops were to die for. 
Definitely a great spot to come back to!

The bread was great, and the cocktails were amazing, but that was the extent of it.  I got the scallops, and they were a bit overcooked and really greasy, and they were served on a limp, super greasy piece of what I think was supposed to be garlic bread.  Not sure.  We also got the gnocchi, which was great.  A little rich, but I think that was intentional.  Friends got fish and a sushi roll, both alright, but I expected a lot more out of a place that was charging so much.  Definitely can get better quality, especially in Vegas.
A beautiful fusion of woods, forward leaning design, sushi & seafood selections and warm service make this a great large party dining experience.
Go to Mastros City Hall (Drinkwater) for a better steak, but you can get decent seafood here and great atmosphere with a bar scene.
Incredible food and even more amazing service! Number one experience this trip to Vegas!

Maestros Ocean Club for dinner with clients. Its actually in the mall upstairs in the back so took a little while to find it. Good wine list, excellent service and the seafood tower was a hit with clients. Overall very solid dinner
Went for a romantic dinner on our anniversary. Bad table, but we moved into a high top in the bar and it was perfect. Now one of our favorites!

It was delicious!  Excellent service and a great wine selection. The oysters were amazing!!!  They have a one of a kind bar too. Only con for me- I would've liked some steak and seafood combos without having to get two whole separate entrees, like steam topped with lobster- but that wasn't an option when we went.

Love at first sight when the bread basket came out.. What does that tell you? Oh my goodness! This place was amazing! 

 My husband made reservations to have dinner here and he requested a nice table in the tree house! So much fun! We were treated like royalty here!! Everyone was! Their customer service here at Mastros was superb!! They know how to make customers feel like they're having a great eating experience. 

We started with a bottle of Moscato! Nivole Moscato D'asti is my favorite!! 

I had a little trouble deciding what I wanted to eat for dinner, but when I saw the Chilean Sea Bass in the menu, I was hooked! They rubbed panko bread crumbs and fried it lightly to perfection!! My husband had the rib eye cooked medium well! And guess what? It was medium well!! They had a long list of sides. We went with the Lobster Mashed Potatoes, which had big chunks of fresh lobster. The lobster and potatoes just melted in your mouth because of all the butter! And then we had the Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese! 

I was so sad that our hotel room did not have a refrigerator. I would have definitely took our left overs with me. As we left the restaurant, I was devastated! The food was absolutely delicious and I wished I had room in my belly to finish all of it!

One of the best dinners we've had in Vegas! We had early reservations and the restaurant quickly filled after we arrived. The "treehouse" atmosphere was adorable yet elegant! The entire staff has very friendly and attentive. We ordered the Dungeness crab cocktail, Boston clam chowder, and Chilean sea bass with Ahi tune and mushrooms for our entrees. We both agreed that the Chilean sea bass was by far the best fish entree we've ever had! The sea bass was prepared perfectly (we opted for the fish to be grilled). My favorite type of crab is Dungeness... and it was super flavorful, tender and moist. Not one complaint with the entire experience. I even received a follow up phone call from the restaurant to ensure that we enjoyed our visit. We are both looking forward to returning to Mastros for another wonderful experience!

The decor in this restaurant is pretty amazing even though it's in a high profile mall.  Who would've known!

The service, food, and drinks were all delicious.  They our large party of all ladies at the high tables with the high stools.  It probably would've been easier if we were seated at the regular tables as it was also very dim in that section of high tables. 

The steak and the fish were all very delicious and large portions.  So ladies it's ok to share!

Our server, Brandon, was so extremely nice.

I took my family to Mastro's for my dads 60th birthday and he was ecstatic. The food was fantastic as I have gone to Mastro multiple times and they truly never let us down. The butter cake is phenomenal and easily one of my favorite desserts!

We spontaneously decided to eat here tonight for dinner and they seated us right away which was great. The table we were assigned was not one we liked and they had no problem letting us sit beside the balcony instead... I ordered the oysters on the half shell and even though the month of July has no r in it, they tasted extremely fresh. Their horseradish is amazing! For an entree I ordered the scallops. I have not ordered scallops in years because it's such a difficult food for restaurants to really have fresh but this was a worthy choice. My partner is vegetarian and her sides were homemade mashed potatoes, brussels sprouts and asparagus. Everything was so good that we forgot to leave space for dessert... Even the complimentary bread was irresistible. Thanks Mario!

We are locals and have been to Ocean club many times and it's our go to spot for celebrating and special events. 

This past Saturday was a complete disaster....from the moment we walked in we got the bad vibe. Dozens of people standing around the hostess station griping about waiting for overdue reservations added to which for some reason the hostesses thought it was a great idea to leave the front door open. It was very cold that night and there is almost no seating in the lobby so we went to the bar. 

After waiting 45 minutes after our scheduled time we expressed our frustration with one of the hostesses who told us "we have no control over our customers and it's not our fault" 

Back to the  bar we  went and waited another 15 minutes. As we were standing there getting bumped around by the wait staff, bus boys, and other customers in walks a guy who I swear looked like Ron Jeremy ( a 80 porn star ). Suddenly there were managers and staff carrying a table onto the floor especially for this one guy aka Ron Jeremy. He sits down right in front of us like he owned the place. 

Talk about mad we were steaming... Back to the hostess stand now over 1 hour passed our reservation we expressed our anger without cussing or threats and this time a different hostess got the message and our table was magically and instantly available. Off to our table and what do we see all the tables around ours are EMPTY!!! 

I wish I could say it got better...Nope, a trip to the bathroom where the attendant wanted to give me back $15 for a twenty...$5.00 to use the bathroom cmon this isn't Beverly Hills.

Back at the table where our waiter was friendly and apologetic but you could see in his face he was exhausted and ready to go home at 9:30. 

Our food was excellent as expected and saved the night for our guests who were at Ocean for the first time. 4 guests = $600.00 plus tip. 

We have guests coming in town again this weekend and we will NOT be going to Mastros...

I'm thinking Capital Grille instead...hopefully no Ron Jeremy sightings this weekend.

This will always be my favorite place to eat & eill continue to be but, When I asked about the steak sauces and got a full description at the tail end or beginning I feel the waiter should've used the words, " At an additional cost or for a fee".  He said nothing.  So when I saw the $5 which is nothing really but I was annoyed.  In my profession I am require to tell clients everything I know.  The asparigus I chose said "Sauteed".  Which means to mean with butter and so it was but also with garlic.  Un-smiley face, I was hoping to kiss my date after words not after that little secret they brought to my plate. I forgot how far away the table was I missed my date he was so far away.  Ha Ha.....The food was delicious as always and I will be a fan.  I just didn't like all of the things I felt I could've been told & was not. Oh, well next time I will be prepared for surprises that's all.

Very good food but I have to be hard on a place like this. You're paying top dollar for everything from environment to world class service and thus you'd expect the food to be equally top echelon, but I could nit pick my steak and the food's temperature. Sitting at the bar was not top echelon service attentiveness, just good. The chef and owner need to pay more attention to detail if they want to be seen as Las Vegas' best restaurant, which they very well could be.

We always wanted to try this restaurant and we were not disappointed. The level of service that we received was awesome. The bartender was knowledgeable with the menu and was able to provide great recommendations based off of people's preferences. 

Our waiter was the best. He provided us with the perfect suggestions for our selections of appetizers and entrees. The steaks were cooked perfectly and we are glad that we got the seafood tower. The only thing I wish is that I had a larger stomach. 

But to top it off, they even helped my wife and I celebrate our anniversary. They gifted us a butter cake to help us celebrate! 

This has easily become one of our favorites in Vegas.

I love the ocean club from the drinks to the service to the amazing food. The Sea Bass Oscar Style is amazing with the creamed spinach. I love the butter cake at the end too. I am always so full I can barely walk out the door.
One time we went and had a seat at a table that had no sign and the waitress tried to tell us we couldn't sit there but the manager let us continue to sit there as there was no sign indicating we did anything wrong. I really thought that was really kind as well. The customer service really is stellar.

AMAZING dinner. We went here to celebrate my bday last week. Jamie was our server and he was fantastic.  I wanted stuffed lobster which they don't have on the menu, but Jamie said no problem and VOILA, a 2 pound lobster stuffed with crabmeat and scallops. I finished every bite. My boyfriend had NY strip, chefs cut which was so big he could not finish it (he has never left anything on his plate). We did half salads and the amazing mussels. And everything was perfect. To finish it off they brought me their famous butter cake. I typically do not eat dessert, but this was way too amazing to pass up. Thanks for the great experience, we will be back!

4.5 Stars
The seafood tower was amazing and my ribeye was very good.  Very expensive.  Much better experience than the ocean club in Newport Beach.

Atmosphere: huge plus for being inside Crystals mall. Classy, a bit on chatty side.
Food: amazing!
Service: he meant well, but...

The snow crab claw was by far the best I've had. It's served cracked, fresh, and insanely cold with a dramatic dry ice presentation. 

Food and service deserves 5 stars, but here's what I want to take a point off of. Nobody warned us that portions were HUGE. We left half the food on the table, which was meant for one person. 

Keep in mind I am a size 0, it's not hard to guess I won't have a huge appetite.

The smooth talking waiter talked us into getting the steak special, 20oz bone in for $90-100, not on menu. He said it was for ONE person. Also he suggested the lobster mashed potatoes as a side and sushi roll. 

The steak was good, but too big for both of us to finish. 
Then the server hands me the charred bone bit - actually, more like plop it in the mashed potato - and tells me to eat the meat off of it. Really? Are you expecting me to lick my fingers off after I chew off the meat with my teeth and hands like a classy lady?

We opted for half portion lobster potatoes instead of a full, which was still a whole bowl of potato mash swimming in a pool of butter. Whatever happened to mixing?
The half portion of sweet potato fries had so much breading that I couldn't taste the sweet potato. I'm sure there's a lot of people who drool over this type of side dish, but I was certainly not one of them.

I'll give 4stars, but next time, please don't suggest ordering extra food when it's clear we can't even finish one plate. It's too good to waste!

Super delicious, great service and most of all amazing displays with all the dishes! The martinis were good as well! (I don't typically order martinis but these ones made the cut) I tried many items here ranging from; duck, to crab, to shrimp and some drink dessert after that tasted like black licorice (forgot the name). Our waitress had a great sense of humor and yet was very professional!

On 2/13/18 we had a reservation for two at 7:15.  We have been to this restaurant many times, but this was the last time.  We inquired several times, including to a gentleman that appeared to me to be a manager when we might be seated.  He explained that the "two tops" weren't turning very fast that night.  At 8 pm we were finally shown to a "four top" and noticed many empty tables.  It took ten to fifteen minutes to get a drink, but the kicker was after the appetizers were finished, the empty dishes stayed on the table with person after person just walking by like they were blind.  After ten minutes or so, I finally stopped one of the gentlemen and demanded that they clear the table.  Our server (who really did work hard trying to make up for everything) cleared the second course herself.  Finally at 9 when the food was served, we looked at each other and had them box it up.  The server did remove the drinks from the bill, but a manager never did come over, knowing we were quite annoyed.  This type of service might be okay when one spends $50 on dinner, but the food was over $300.

The food is consistently good, but for the prices they charge, the service does not match.  In fact, it doesn't match the restaurant's reputation at all.  It's interesting that their management thinks that it does.

I've been to two out in LA/Orange County area.  This one doesn't quite meet the same standard as set in California.  Still good, don't get me wrong.

Had the bone in filet.  It was cooked correctly, it just lacked flavor (as I'd expect from a bone in steak!).

The lobster gnocchi is always great.

Really enjoyed their wasabi salad (sorry- can't remember what it's called).

The restaurant itself is in a bit of a strange location- it's in middle of the mall. So atmosphere is very bright and you can see the stores while dining.  Didn't really like this setting for eating good steak.

We went to the restaurant and we all got food poisoning. We called the manager who indicated that he would look into it. He never returned our call after we spoke to him. Do not go there as you could get food poisoning. Most managers of restaurants would call back as we had eaten there many times and he did not have the intelligence to return our call

This place is always pretty good! This location in particular is a bit odd, though. You're literally eating in the mall much like a food court (with a large bill). But hey, at least you're surrounded by designer names..ha!) 

The seafood tower is the way to go. The bone-in filet is NOT the best thing on the menu despite what the masses say. It's a bit chewy. My girlfriend had a regular filet and it was much better and cooked perfectly.

The butter cake is terribly overrated. I always find that it's a bit dry and for lack-of-a-better thought....NOT worth the calories.

This is a premiere place.  It's priced that way also.  As long as you understand that you will enjoy the experience.  We went specifically because they had Stone crab claws on their raw bar.  We started with those along with two martini's.  They were delicious.  The bread basket blends the old steakhouse feel with the updated and vibrant space that Mastro's projects.  We shared the large bone in ribeye.  It was presented at the table sliced on a hot plate.  It was cooked perfectly as well as the spinach we ordered to accompany it.  We ordered the butter cake to take home and it was a highlight when we enjoyed it later that evening.

Excellent dining experience which started with the hostesses, bubbly smile and welcoming personality. Heard many reviews about the bread basket, come on its bread. Now I eat those words. Several choices, sour dough roll, kalamata olive, pretzel (my fav) and others. I had seared ahi tuna. Generous portion cooked to perfection with wasabi and pickled ginger. My date had the pan sautéed scallops. She loved them and my taste was wonderful. She also had the lobster bisque. It was so rich and creamy.  For sides we had mushrooms, sautéed with garlic we loved them. Also had creamed spinach. We both thought it was fine, have had better. Both portions were very generous, more than enough for both of us. Service was fantastic.

Wow, what a great dining experience! It was my boyfriends 21st birthday weekend and I wanted to treat him to something special, and special it was. 
We were seated in the "Treehouse" and our server Lionell was the best, he gave us great recommendations and he was very attentive. We shared an order of the tempura shrimp for an appetizer, I had the twin lobster tails, my boyfriend had the new york strip and we shared a side of the creamed spinach. Wow, wow, wow is all I can say. They also brought out a huge slice of chocolate cake after dinner for my boyfriend, something he wasn't expecting, it was a nice surprise and we both really enjoyed it. 

The whole experience was great. We will definitely be back, no doubts about that.

Very cool decor and excellent service.  We just finished eating elsewhere before we found this hidden gem and were completely bummed we didn't find it sooner.  So we sat at the bar and had a nice glass of malbec - a very generous glass of wine - with a very friendly bartender, Melissa.  She explained the menu to us in great detail and told us exactly what we should order the next time we visited.

Great food and service!!! 
Service - 5 stars
Food - 5 stars

This is the epitome of fine dining! The restaurant is located inside what looks like a mall on the strip, and is in what looks like a cage. I came here for my girlfriends birthday. The service was excellent. We arrived at 5:30 pm, on a Saturday because we knew it would fill up for dinner time. They also only opened half hour before that. They provided us with delicious bread, one tasted like a pretzel. We each had a mixed drink. Mine was good, but my girls drink was excellent. It was a strawberry mixed drink. It tasted perfect! I ordered the largest steak; a 22oz. ribeye. It may have been the best steak I have ever tried in my life. Even the fat parts disintegrated in my mouth. My girl had the filet mignon. It was also delicious. 

For her birthday they brought her out a slice of cake that said 'Happy Birthday!' along with a fresh batch of whipped cream. All in all it was a memorable and splendid experience.

Great Filet Mignon. Asked medium rare but received it medium but still very juicy and tender.  Double baked loaded baked potato was huge and amazing.  Great for dates but was actually there with a bachelor party of 10 men and worked out great.  Very pricey but when in Rome..

Overrated, expensive, dull and slow is what comes to mind when I think of this restaurant.  A group of my friends visited Ocean Club tonight (a Sunday evening in early October at 6pm) for a friend's birthday.  I was very disappointed with the quality and flavor of the food and the service, which I would rate as terrible, especially for a fine dining establishment such as this.

When you arrive it's clear that you're at a fine dining restaurant.  Dark rooms, fancy table settings, a well dressed wait staff.  It's too bad that our experience didn't match the ambiance.  In general everything just fell short--- beyond what you might expect at your typical over priced, stuffy steak house.

I ordered the Scottish salmon blackened.  It was cooked correctly (rare) but lacked in flavor.  The presentation was terrible- a filet on a white plate and a small cup of what resembled an olive tappenade.  I would have asked our waiter but he was largely absent with the exception of when he walked us through the menu upon arrival which largely just confused the group. My husband ordered a salad and two types of oysters.  He requested that they both be served as a main course.  The salad arrived as an appetizer.  When the oysters arrived no one pointed out which oysters were which- they left him guessing.  We ordered wine and had wanted a second bottle. We eventually were able to order it but well after our entrees had arrived.

In general we wanted to have a relaxed dinner but service was so slow that there were points when I questioned if the staff even remembered that we were in the dining room.  We also had interesting interactions with our busser.  She first came to remove the bread from the table.  She asked us if we were done, to which my husband said "you know what, just leave it and we'll pick at it throughout the meal." She smiled at him, looked at the table and took the bread.  It was clear she didn't understand him.  She mumbled for the rest of the evening and in general was incomprehensible.  I was really surprised.

All is all this place was disappointing. There's lots of competition for high end dining and perhaps I'm a snob but if you can't get the small stuff right then it's not worth the cost especially when the food is just mediocre.
i felt like someone importanttttttttttt their service is amazing and the food... melts in your mouth like butter.

Disgusting customer service by manager Gill ! 
Just because your restaurant is busy gives you zero right to treat customers with such nasty attitude.. will take my money elsewhere

I am not a steak connoisseur as I rarely eat red meat, but I did try my boyfriends rib eye when we ate here for his birthday and OH MY GOODNESS was it incredible! It was perfectly cooked as a "medium rare" steak as he requested, and it was melt in your mouth quality. I only have one other fancy steakhouse restaurant to compare it to and that's Ruth Chris' Steakhouse....And I would say this is better. The buttercake dessert is also to die for even though you might literally die from a heart attack from it because I'm sure it's not the healthiest thing out there, but it is sooo worth cheating any diet to try it! Again, I rarely eat red meat and I freaking love the steak here and believe that this may have been the greatest thing I've ever tasted. The texture and taste are both on point. I definitely want to come back!!!

This is a follow up and it's long overdue. We did eventually hear back from the restaurant and the manager offered us a gift card so we can go back and try them again. I was extra careful on food choices at the 2nd visit: steak and chocolate cocktail (no seafood, no fresh veggies or fruit), and yes it was a great decision, no upset stomach this time! 5 star service, 4.5 food. Combined with my negative experience from 1st visit, solid 4 stars as a final.

There are three steakhouses in the country that are in a class by themselves.  The III Forks chain, Jean George (Aria/Vegas), and the Mastro's chain. The warm pretzel rolls, gigantic but perfectly ripe salads, perfect meat, and amazing desserts make this an absolute can't lose.

For my 1600th review, I chose the 3rd and final restaurant in the Scottsdale/Phoenix Mastro's trilogy.  I've dined at the other 2 restaurants and this was the last one....I am now complete! :)

What more can I say about this place?  Outstanding service and food!  Wifey and I dined with 2 colleagues from out of town.  They'd never dined at a Mastro's before, so we decided to go all out and give this location a try.  Here's what we ordered during this visit:

Beef Carpaccio
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mastros-ocean-club-scottsdale?select=0A3PEoUl8nKmlvj8EF5-oQ#0A3PEoUl8nKmlvj8EF5-oQ
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mastros-ocean-club-scottsdale?select=Ixj6faa-nc0dTkGppacixw#Ixj6faa-nc0dTkGppacixw

Shrimp Cocktail
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mastros-ocean-club-scottsdale?select=3AR60YF7zUfUTlMkpHYINw#3AR60YF7zUfUTlMkpHYINw

12 oz Bone-in Filet
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mastros-ocean-club-scottsdale?select=QVxssj3cmGN4HCaFUaGUUg#QVxssj3cmGN4HCaFUaGUUg

Lobster Tail
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mastros-ocean-club-scottsdale?select=7Au-elHq0sjklrUCFmc9Rw#7Au-elHq0sjklrUCFmc9Rw

Swordfish
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mastros-ocean-club-scottsdale?select=NSB9arDBjuxvveTXfEw9yA#NSB9arDBjuxvveTXfEw9yA

Gorgonzola Mac 'n Cheese
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mastros-ocean-club-scottsdale?select=LqVgNLZiYkTlHyI4l27kMg#LqVgNLZiYkTlHyI4l27kMg

Buttercake
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mastros-ocean-club-scottsdale?select=fxt_7zzR_OwjQGnVuODPzw#fxt_7zzR_OwjQGnVuODPzw

Key Lime Pie
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mastros-ocean-club-scottsdale?select=Rf66dP2sU3DFvFST48WwfA#Rf66dP2sU3DFvFST48WwfA

Whipped Cream
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mastros-ocean-club-scottsdale?select=V4XXNRsCPC481hDNixC9hg#V4XXNRsCPC481hDNixC9hg

Chocolate Cake
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mastros-ocean-club-scottsdale?select=tNoj-p2RTdwGIyDk-0sDtw#tNoj-p2RTdwGIyDk-0sDtw

I had the Bone-in Filet and the Gorgonzola Mac 'n Cheese....these are my favorite Mastro dishes.  I sampled the Carpaccio, which was phenomenal....it's soo tender and full of flavor.  For Dessert, we all shared 1,000,000 calories worth of dishes (Buttercake, Key Lime Pie, Chocolate Cake, Whipped Cream)....but it's all good when you're dining in a top notch restaurant with great people.

I forgot to mention that we put away 2 bottles of Wine during dinner and a nice glass of Port at the end of dinner.  A perfect way to end an evening.

Tip - Don't forget that Mastro's is not cheap.  It's a fine dining joint....expect to pay for it.

Return Factor - 100%

Nothing but greatness to be expected from Mastros and once again they lived up to their reputation. This was the first Mastros Ocean Club I have visited and i was very much impressed. DISCLAIMER: They do tend to undercook their steaks but they did take it back and fix my New York strip. And of course we had to try the seafood tower. I love that you can build it yourself! Our waiter was so pleasant and attentive. Seriously he just made the night. Wish I could remember his name but all I remember was thay he was Canadian lol Only because I am a die hard Michael Bublè fan lol

Here's the bottom line, the food is GREAT, always is, quite pricey but that's a known fact. Visited the Keg in Chandler the night before and checked out their wine list, pretty amazing and the prices were great! Ocean Club has many of the same exact wines that The Keg had, same years, etc...the cost of the wine at Ocean Club were DOUBLE of the cost at The Keg, literally DOUBLE, sometimes more that DOUBLE, it was absolutely disgusting. We were all so taken aback that none of us ordered wine...Realizing the mark up on bottles of wine which we buy all the time at Total Wine and realizing the restaurant has to make a profit, this was absolutely out of line and turned me off completely. They also have the nerve to charge $48 for ONE stone crab, seriously ONE? I could fly to Vegas and eat at Joe's Stone Crab and get 6-8 at that price! The butter cake and homemade whipped cream were delish as always!

Ocean Club was the 2nd leg of our progressive dinner last night (8-14-2013)  It was my dining companions birthday celebration and he had never been before.  I chose Ocean Club for our main course.  We were greeted promptly by name and seated immediately.  I had stopped by the restaurant earlier in the day to drop off a birthday card and flowers for our table.  Yes a little redundant, but I'm all about going all the way or nothing at all!  At that time I explained that we were having appetizers 1st somewhere else and moving on to another restaurant for dessert. All was well when we were seated, card and orchid in place (whew).  I ordered Swordfish for myself and the bone-in Rib Eye/Crab leg combo for my companion.  I also ordered the Lobster Mashed Potatoes, and the Sautéed Mushrooms.  Our server Lloyd was amazing, treated us as if we were his only guests.  We were not!  Once we were finished, Lloyd had our leftovers boxed and sent us on our way knowing that we had a 3rd reservation waiting.Thank you to Lloyd and Mastro's Ocean Club for making it an amazing mid-course to our evening!!!

Cool place to enjoy a nice dinner with friends. Upscale experience without a ton of fuss. Awesome servers who know their stuff. Very cool structure in the middle of Crystals that almost makes you forget you're in the middle of a bougie mall. Went with a group of 6 and everyone's food looked great. I got a Spicy Mambo Salad and would probably skip it next time, only because it's just a caesar salad, sans croutons with a hint of wasabi. Kinda boring, but not worth losing a star over. Sweet potato fries are bomb, as are the mac & cheese and mashed sweet potatoes. DO NOT SKIP THE BUTTER CAKE. Thank me later.

The food was absolutely amazing. Everything was seasoned just right, and it was served nice 'n hot on that 400-degree plate. 
If you like cocktails, I highly recommend the dream berry. And if you really want a party in your mouth, top your meal off with their delectable butter cake. You won't be disappointed.
One of my favorite places to dine or have a drink. Love the food and live music. Bartender could be friendlier, but overall great experiences when I go there. Management is awesome.

I've been fascinated by this "tree house" for the longest. This was my first time visiting Mastro's and I had long heard of the famous warm butter cake, so I was excited to come for a pharm. rep dinner, get to learn and try a new place. 

We made our selections from a pre-set menu.

My first course I went with the Caeser Salad, this was pretty standard except for the bits of anchovie throughout, which is my favorite kind of Caeser. 

For my entree I chose the 8oz filet. I asked for it to be prepared medium. What came out was between rare and tartare. Since we were in a small private dining room for the lecture, I didn't feel comfortable sending my steak back, it would be disruptive, and I didn't want to interupt the lecturer. I ended up giving it to my friend to take home to her dogs.

The family style shared sides weren't impressive either. Mashed potatoes had no flavor, and the sugar snap peas as well. Only one I liked was the creamed spinach. 

Dessert we had a choice between chocolate sin cake and cheesecake. I went with the chocolate cake, it came with a side of homemade whipped cream which I thought was better than the cake itself. 

Pretty disappointing meal all together. I would come back for a second try, just not in a hurry to do so. I definitely enjoyed the lecture more than dinner.
Amazing!! Everything was perfect. Dinner ran about $300 pp including alcohol and tips but we were dining extravagantly. I cannot wait until I win the lotto so I can eat here once a week!

This was just an amazing meal.  Wish we could have been seated in the large wood sculpture portion, but a great meal none the less.  

Thanks!

Oh and thanks for the call the next day.  That was a 4 star to 5 star conversion

I don't say this much.  OMG, this place is amazing.  I was in Vegas with friends, and my buddy said i should try this place out  and i would love it.  i was skeptic at best..

We had a group of 8 and we decided to do family style and order apps.  We ordered the bone marrow, escargot, scallops, and calamari  

The bone marrow was okay in my opinion, but everyone loved it on my table.  I would have like some more accompaniment to enhance the flavors.  There was plenty of marrow, bread and  micro greens, and fine sea salt flakes.  It was very rich and flavor, but i had better.  it is still worth it.

The scallops were perfectly pan seared, and it came with a pleasant herb-y butter sauce.  Each bite was amazing and when you are done with the scallops.  The sauce was great for  bread  dipping.

The escargot was good.  it came with the standard butter, garlic and shallots.  T
here is probably a few other herbs in there, but we ate them too fast to really look.
.  
The friend calamari was good and came with two sauce, tartar, and i think a remoulade.  After having the other items, i wasn't too impressed.  This would be a great dish, if it was somewhere else. But we are talking about Mastro's.

The OMG moment was a  bone in petite filet we ordered.  When i first saw it, i was very disappointed when i saw the waiter cut it,  It look raw.  I was thinking how can a place like this, don't know the difference between medium rare and raw.  Boy was i wrong.  The table decide we should try it and not waste it, because we all thought the same thing.  But when i bit into it, it was the most wonderful steak i had in recent memory.  It has a full of flavor, it was season to perfection.  Every bite, i wanted another one.   In the end, i would have fought off the table for the bone.  Lucky for me, no one wanted it.  I love the acidic marinade they used for the steak.  I guess it is a balsamic vinegar marinade.  Man, i want to go back so badly.

Anyway, i don't think i can top anything else in this review.  I have to say the signature pound cake was good, but you must really have a sweet tooth.  

Waiters and bus people were amazing and entertaining.  they are here to give you the best experience they can.    so please tip well.

The decor is amazing, just go look at the pictures online.  

Now i just want to go to any Mastro's and have that steak again.

Excellent food,service and ambiance. The original Masteros in AZ is a go to favorite. The Vegas version doesn't disappoint. 

In the landscape of Vegas dining where return visits are rare to the scale and innovation of dining venues. Masteros will get additional visits from myself, family and corporation.

I had the crabcakes, ahi tuna, seared scallops, gnocci with truffles, spinach, chilean sea bass (I like this fish for future reference), and creme brulee with homemade whipped cream (best whipped cream ever).  WOW.  It sounds like so much food now - no wonder i was hurting!!!!  Don't worry though - the pain is gone.

Really bad experience, here. Was hoping for an awesome night for my 50th birthday. Based on reviews, I chose Mastro's. Wish i hadn't. Filet came out well done, sent it back, came out raw in the middle. A fine restaurant that can't cook a filet to medium rare should just close its doors. On top of that, my wife and son's NY strips tasted like liver. Not sure how they achieved that. The manager was very apologetic and tore up the check, but I still can't recommend this place.

My friend made reservations for Christmas Day dinner 2 weeks prior to Christmas. When we arrived we were told 40 minute wait for the "treehouse" which she requested. She was furious. We were seated 5 minutes later, I'm really not sure what the deal was, but we didn't have to wait. Drinks were good as was the service, however the food was not great. The mac and cheese was lacking the cheese. I ordered lamb chops and they were cooked ok, medium rare, but lacked flavor. Totally not impressed. I ate half my lamb, and we got a go bag for everything else. When I got home my lamb never made it to the go bag. Really? $48 for 1/2 an order of lamb. This place is pathetic. Go to Del Frisco's if you truly want to be impressed. Epic fail here!

My new favorite steak and seafood house in Las Vegas. 
Went again last night and had a magnifcent experience!

The manager, Scott, is a terrific guy.
Our server, Sylvia, was charming and attentive.
And the food...
How about a 32 oz bone-in ribeye!! OMG!
(I'm just getting out of the hospital now...had my blood cleaned.)

It was worth it.
That's why Crestor was invented.

Several friends were in town and they booked dinner at a different restaurant, after the entrees were consumed I suggested we walk a few blocks to Mastro's Ocean Club in the Crystals at CityCenter for desert and nightcap beverages. It's one of my favorite steakhouses in Vegas and #1 choice for outstanding deserts and port wines or a glass of late harvest liquid gold (Far Niente Dolce). Made a quick reservation on Yelp and we showed up around 9:30pm. The bar was lively. I ordered one Chocolate Pudding Cake and one Cherry Crisp, plus the "100 years flight of Port flight" and a glass of Dolce. The dark chocolate pudding cake was warm, fresh, and delicious. The liquid cream and fresh whipped cream, serving of blackberries and mint were exceptional and we all enjoyed. The Cherry Crisp was scrumptious. Highly recommend this venue as the architecture is remarkable, service attentive and friendly (Kaitlyn was wonderful) and it's convenient to The Strip action.

Best experience in Vegas. Everyone was an absolute pleasure. Our waiter and Aaron made sure our time was spectacular. My sister and I both had the 12 oz filet with truffle butter and I must say it was phenomenal I couldn't put my fork and knife down. We also had the Cesar salad, mac and cheese and lobster mash so happy we came here. Thank you so much for everything we can't wait to come back!

Completely different experience from the first time we dined here. We started in the beautiful bar area where we each had a Mastros signature cocktail. The Fashion Forward was a refreshing twist on the old fashioned and the hubs had a classic martini with a lemon twist. For dinner we shared the chefs cut bone in ribeye 33oz of medium rare heaven! Truffle buttered mushroom and a side of lobster mashed potatoes to die for. Our server Duke was amazing as well as Erma so friendly and helpful. 
Our dining experience lasted nearly 3 hours we truly enjoyed every minute of it. 
Minus 1 star because the gift card that was sent to us from Corporate was not accepted ??? Regardless we are happy to have given Mastro's a second chance.

No surprise here.  MASTRO'S always does a great job.  The martinis,  the food and the service were all superb. We had to split the check for 4 of us 8 ways due to no alcohol is allowed to be on an expensable reciept. This was NO PROBLEM which is not usually the answer. The dungeness crab app was to die for. Everything was perfect .

I went here with colleagues while in Vegas at a conference. Happy I was there for work as it was quite a pricey dinner. Overall, it was a great experience, the service was good and the food and drinks were overall good, but not necessarily amazing (thus the 3 star rating).

Drinks: they have a great cocktail list. The first one I had was a nice smoky drink with a little bit of spice. I also had the spa day which was a strong but refreshing cucumber drink. The drinks were pricey ($15-$25) but everyone seemed to be happy.

Appetizers: We had shrimp, calamari and bone marrow. All was tasty and I would order again.

Main meal: For the main meal, I had the pacific swordfish Cajun style. This is where my rating got downgraded. My fish was a bit over cooked and this dry.

Given the variety of restaurants in Vegas, I likely would not go back.

We dined at the Ocean Club last night, must have been 5 yeas since we have been here. As we remembered. it was great. Great crowd, fast seating, very attentive service, and great food. 

Very crowded for a late Sat. night, and it was a fun night out. May have to come back sooner than 5 years.

This is now my 4th trip there and I wouldn't be doing the place justice If I didn't write a review. Steaks: huge, cooked right, and delicious. Seafood- fresh fresh fresh.  On the late fall the stone crab claws are the largest I've ever seen.   Prices: on par w the rest of SIN CITY for a high end place 
The real difference is the service. We literally had 7 people taking care of a table of 4. They are on top of everything. 
If you want a high end meal or want to impress business clients, this is a no brainer.

I wanted to love this place because I really loved the vibe when I walked in. Busy social good music and upbeat.Had the food not been a trio us we would be back every weekend. Our steaks were burnt the potatoes were way too strong. I'm not sure how a steak house burns a steak but it was nearly inedible.  Had we not been with friends and on our best behavior we would have sent it all back but due to it being my birthday and my friends we tried eat what we could (the middle of the steak) I'm so dissappointed. I was expecting Ruth ' s Chris taste with a club atmosphere. If I ever go back it won't be for the food

40th Bday dinner for my girl and what can I say....Mastro's didn't disappoint. Once again our food/service was awesome, ambience great and drinks were too good! 

* Try the dream berry martini if you like strawberries.
*  Try the Mambo salad. It is a Cesar salad with horseradish in the dressing so it has a spicy kick. Have them serve it with shrimp for something really delicious.
* Lobster mash is good and sinful. Don't let it get cold

We had dinner one night at Mastro's, and what a great choice!  I can honestly say everyone on staff made our dining experience a complete delight.

For dinner I got the chopped salad, gulf red snapper, and the twice baked potato.  In addition, our server also brought some warm, fresh bread out to the table.  Everything was SO GOOD.  Truly, the fish was so fresh I would not be surprised if it had been caught that very same day.  The seasoning on all the food was perfect, and I didn't have to add salt, pepper or anything.  Truly tantalizing.  The portions were also large.  The potato was definitely big enough to split with at least one other person.

To top off my experience, someone from the restaurant actually called me the next day to ask how our experience was!  That was a first for me, and I was majorly impressed.  The next time I go back to Vegas, we will definitely be stopping in at Mastro's again.

Mastro's has a name for a classy dinner out, no contest there. This location delivered, I was impressed by how great the service was as well as how much fun dining with live music is.
