I have a shellfish allergy... I know why go to The Ocean Room?? but it wasn't my birthday so this is where we ate. The server was very responsive to my request to make sure my food was safe for me. 

I had the bone in filet, medium rare plus. Red but warm center. Wow tasty meat. It was 12oz ands nearly ate it all. Another highlight, butter cake! I'm a chocoholic but this buttery lightly toasted and served warm cake was worth the caloric intake.

Was planning a trip to Scottsdale from out of state for a sunny bday weekend. Looked a various restaurants nearby and when I saw Mastro's dinner menu, I was sold! 

The whole experience was amazing: decor, food, server, cocktails/wine, and the towel service in the restroom. 

Came mainly for the seafood and it was all amazing. Will have to plan another trip down to Mastro's as the steaks looked delicious!

Mastro's Beverly Hills is my favorite steakhouse in LA, so I was eager to check out the Vegas branch. While there are obviously similarities, here are the differences:

1. There's a separate room inside what's called the Treehouse, but it looks more like a giant wooden stomach. Which is appropriate. I'd strongly recommend getting seated there and not because of the view (The "breathtaking" scenery consists of every high-end luxury goods store on this planet. Then again, I know people who enjoy staring at $5000 handbags from a distance.). It's because the other half of the restaurant looked packed as hell. I wouldn't be surprised if the diners were eating their neighbors steaks by accident. 

2. There's more fish on the menu - hence the name - although there was no noticeable difference shellfish selection-wise. Sadly, Billy Ocean wasn't singing at the piano. Mastro's, you screwed up on a golden opportunity here.

3. The bar's wall o' liquor is an impressive monument to chronic liver failure. Then again, this is a city where it's legal to walk down the street slurping Everclear out of a foot-long Eiffel Tower. 

4. Steak's great. But not comparable to the Beverly Hills branch.

This restaurant was recommended by a family member who lives in Scottsdale. The atmosphere is upscale, classy and dimly lit. 
Our server was informative and attentive. He provided helpful responses to our menu questions.  I started with the lobster bisque which was flavorful and included lumps of lobster meat.  My entree was the Sea Scallops which were toped with a wine sauce and lightly broiled.  Awesome!!  My friend had the salmon and the macaroni and cheese with bacon.  Our waiter suggested ordering the crumbled bacon with the Mac and Cheese.  It was delicious.  Our food was promptly delivered to our table while it was at the appropriate temperature.
It was a superior dining experience and I highly recommend it for seafood.

This place was unbelievable front the time we walked into the time we left the service was great. The food was perfect  as well. I got a steak that was perfect. The lobster  mashed potatoes were great as well. They are for sure a must try.

So the food is decent. I'm not gonna sit here and say it's BAD, cause it's not. But I'm. It gonna say it's AMAZING either cause it's NOT. The service is great. And the butter cake is beautiful and it IS AMAZING.

Great food, great service. awesome execution, and a wonderful wine list - This was the best meal I had in Las Vegas this year. I went back twice this week! Gnocchi with Alaskan crab ,truffle oil then topped with shaved black truffle and crisped panko bread crumbs is decadent and delish! It is served sizzling and definitely  enough to share between two people. I ordered a half portion the second visit and it still was enough between the two of  us! One of the best things i have ever eaten. I am picky about gnocchi and they do it light and pillowy here with a white sauce. On to the steaks, PRIME CUT EVERYTHING! all steaks are served on 400 degree plates with clarified butter and ur choice of salt/pepper or u can request cajun blackened. Phenomonal steaks and yes I am from Texas and still say this, My favorite winery is Michael David from Lodi  ..they make the good ol 7Deadlyzins, petite petit sirah and Mastros serves their Earthquake Cab for only two times markup (51 bucks)! this is a GREAT value for Vegas . SW steakhouse in the Wynn charges an obnoxious 5x markup! - This is important if you love wine with ur steaks. I had filet mignon, tomahawk ribeye,  truffle crab gnocchi, chocolate pudding cake, gorgonzola mac and cheese, lobster roll, and oysters rockefeller this week at mastros. The gnocchi , steaks and lobster roll were NOT TO BE MISSED here. I wasnt crazy about the mac and cheese but that may be because I was totally spoiled by the gnocchi(priced at 32 full portion, 16 for half portion) . If you are budgeting however the mac is only 13 and 6.50 for a half portion. try it you will love it ! Our waiter was excellent and attentive , this place is worth the money in the big pool of steakhouses in Vegas

One of the best places with top notch service, atmosphere, fine dining in  Vegas. 

I always get the 18 oz bone in filet with lobster mash. 

They have an extensive wine list aswell. 

Great place for a business meeting.

It's my second visit at this particular Mastros. Kinda hard to find. 
The restaurant is inside the mall "The shops at Crystals," next to Aria hotel. 
Just look for the giant wood art sculpture second floor of mall. it is breathtaking. 

I love love love their lobster bisque 
Ordered the filet mignon with garlic mash potatoes and roasted Brussels sprouts. For added flavor and $$$ I added truffle butter   It was awesome! Bread basket warm and delicious. My favorite is the pretzel bread. 

My son had the Chilean sea bass. It just melts in your mouth. We had it simply prepared as pan seared. 
My husband and other son had steak too and they were so focused on their meal so I know they loved their steaks. 

Our server Micheal provided great service. lt all ended with their famous butter cake with homemade fresh whipped cream. 

Our meal for a family of four was costly but worth every penny. 
We visit Mastros every time we come to Vegas. See you next time

I stopped here with a co-worker after a business meeting in Scottsdale.  We had a redeye flight late that night and wanted a nice meal before heading to the airport.

We got there early before the dinner crowd, and finished up some work form our meeting and then enjoyed a glass of wine and dinner.   I'm a vegetarian so I ordered a salad.  Salad was definitely tasty, but my coworker raved about her fish.  She said it was the best she'd ever had.    Sometimes when you read great reviews it leaves space for disappointment, but that was definitely not our experience.  I'd go here again when in Scottsdale.

I live in Chicago and have been to many fine dining restaurants. The Mastros in Chicago is my absolute favorite place to eat. I went to Las Vegas and noticed they also had a Mastros so I naturally made sure I go. There is no way I could actually like Mastros any more than I already do right? Wrong! Mastros Ocean Club was even better than the high bar that the Chicago location set. Aside from world class food, Tanya and Juan, who waited on me, were the absolute best servers I have ever had. They know the restaurant food very well and its almost amazing how they know almost every ingredient used in every dish. They also gave me great recommendations for the rest of my time in Vegas and were just overall great servers. Not only does Mastros have some of the best quality food around, and the ambiance is second to none, but Tanya and Juan made it such a great time that I can not wait to see them again this upcoming February! No matter what you will love Mastros but if they are working, make sure you sit with Juan and Tanya for a truly exceptional dining experience!!!

I am never disappointed when in Scottsdale and dining at Ocean Club!
Excellent service (always!) and the food beautifully prepared and served.
Word of advice- everything can be split and unless you are a typical American-you'll walk away stuffed like their clams! Sides are all great too!

Came here with a couple friends.  We were sat in the modern tree house which over looked the crystals mall, I would definitely ask to be sat there.  Everyone was hungry so we got right down to business, Crabcakes, Oysters Rockefeller and seared ahi tuna to start followed by the 22oz bone in ribeye for myself with creamed spinach and sweet potato fries.   Apps were flavorful,  Steak was cooked perfectly Midrare and the sides dishes were great .  Service was impeccable as expected. Overall great dinning experience, wasn't the best steak I've had but definitely worth trying even though technically this restaurants prime focus is seafood.

Review for Restaurant Week Fall 2012 menu only:

I went to Mastros tonight for the first time and I convinced my wife to try Restaurant Week, too!  We were very pleased with the meal.

We got a nice bread basket with several types of bread.  I really liked the pretzel rolls with salt.  There were five choices in the basket.

Course 1:  We each got a salad--my wife's was a Caesar and mine was their spicy mambo salad.  They were both the same greens but my dressing was made with some wasabi, hence the spicy.  Both salads had a good amount of freshly grated cheese on them and they were very tasty.

Course 2:  I ordered the Scottish salmon and Andrea got the 8 ounce filet cooked medium.  I had several preparations from which to choose for the salmon and I chose the blackened option.  The salmon was delicious.  The filet was very good, too.  

With their Restaurant Week menu, diners can choose two sides.  We each ordered garlic mashed potatoes.  My wife ordered the creamed spinach and I got the creamed corn.  The sides were huge.  Since we each ordered the mashed potatoes, we got a regular portion which is their standard size for sides.  The corn and spinach were smaller versions.  All three were very good.  I needed salt, but then anything needs salt.  Samantha started us out by giving each of us some of the sides so we each could try everything.

Course 3:  For dessert, Andrea got the chocolate layer cake and I got the Key lime pie.  ALong with the desserts, we were brought a large bowl of freshly made whopped cream--lightly sweetened.  The chocolate cake was huge.  My Key lime pie was more a normal size.  Both were outstanding!!

We ate in the Tree House overlooking the shops at Crystals.  Service was superb!  Our server, Samantha, was excellent.  The staff cleared tables promptly, cleaned the table cloth between (not that I'm a slob or anything), our iced teas were refilled often, and the pace of the meal was perfect!  

I am so glad Mastros participated in Restaurant Week.  It gave me a chance to try it and I will be back.  What a fantastic start to RW Fall 2012.

Today was our friend's birthday and our server Tanya was so friendly and really went out her way to make sure our dining experience was excellent! The food was delicious and Tanya was very knowledgable and friendly. We had such a lovely time at Mastros Ocean Club and next time we come to Vegas we would love to come back!!! Thank you Tanya and Mastros for ensuring that our lovely experience!!!

Awesome! Dion our server was awesome made the visit a 5 star visit on top of great food. We had the rib eye bone in with scallops potatoes and sautéed asparagus AWESOME! For dessert we had the butter cake OMG! We loved it!

I have been here 2 times in the last year  the staff is freely and very attentive. This time we got to sit in the Bird house which is really cool.  

The first time was great had the Herb Roasted Chicken*24oz, Lobster Bisque Soup & Heirloom Tomato & Burrata, Creamed Spinach, Creamed Corn, Grilled Asparagus but the best part was the dessert that Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake is by far the best dessert you will every taste.  

So on our second visit we wanted to see if they could repeat it.  Again we got the Herb Roasted Chicken*24oz - it really is very good and enough for two to share.  We got the Blue Cheese wedge and the  for the sides this time we stuck to the same creamed spinach, creamed corn but added the onion rings )which are fantastic) and the grilled Brussels Sprouts(i have to admit these were not bitter at all.)  then came the end that Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake was even better then I remembered its so gooey it melts in your mouth, you have to have it warm because we have stopped by just got the cake to go and it was server cold s not the same.  

I recommend to anyone weather you live in Vegas or visiting try this place you will not be disappointed.

Delicious! Best steak I've had compared to: del frisco's, papa's, Perry's, Ruth Chris, Flemings, the strip house, Vic and Anthony's, Morton's .... All of them and more. 

I don't remember what my cocktail was but it was a strawberry drink with a sugar rim. The shaker had an endless amount. I ended up with at least 3 full refills for $18.

The calamari was crispy and deceptively flavorful. They appeared to be plain, but the seasoning was just right. I did not care for the horseradish/mustard type sauce though, but I think that was just my dislike for those types of condiments. 

I ordered the 12oz filet medium rare. It had a beautiful seared crust that was crispy and not burned. The inside was so perfectly tender juicy red and melted in my mouth. The texture of the two was perfect. 

For sides we had the baked potatoe which was huge! But was the least appetizing item all night. The Gorgonzola Mac and cheese was delicious! I don't tend to like blue cheeses or very much cheese, but this cheese goodness was Devine. I enjoyed it so much I'm going to try to remake this this week for dinner! It was served in it's own skillet and was more than enough for myself and my two othe dinner companions. 

Warm butter cake. What can I say but order this! I usually love tiramisu and cream brûlée but mmmm this cake was so moist and had a crunch sugar top under the vanilla ice cream. The cream brûlée was actually disappointing. I didn't care for the crust or Vanilla flavored cream... Or perhaps the butter cake just stole my heart.

The live small band sounded great with dinner. They werent too loud and the music was a good mix, classy good sounding modern and hit music, not clubby like stk. you wo t leave with a headach and sore throat.The atmosphere of the restaurant was light and elegant. I didn't mind that it was located in the crystals. Honestly I liked being able to walk around while we waited for our reservation we made through aria, our hotel. If you do have a bit of a wait go down stairs to the little water tornadoes. They are touch sensitive and you can control how they spin!
Food was good had the lobster 2 ways buttered and vanilla battered! Also we had the mashed potato, green beans, and the twice baked potato. Service was great as well

Growing up in Beverly Hills I have attended the Mastro's on Cañon close to 100 times. They have the best steak in the game, I don't care what anyone try's to say. Last night me and my friend Paul had the night off in Vegas so we decided to check out the Mastro's here in Las Vegas at City Center. It not the traditional Mastro's setting but the food was still remarkable! Our waiter Deion was the man he helped my friend choose the perfect wine to accompany his bone-in filet topped with foie gras! Which just melted in ur mouth! (Pause) I myself took down the 22oz Bone-in Ribeye cooked medium rare plus like a beast and enjoyed every single bite! Once again Mastro's was an A+! Pictured below was the Bone-in Ribeye.

BEST SEA BASS IN MY LIFE.  The portion was much bigger than I was expecting, and because I ordered it medium rare, the fish was cooked just right!  Everyone at our 8-person table had either the sea bass, rib-eye, or bone-in filet, and everyone's dish was delicious.  Would definitely come back here!!!

Mastro's Ocean Club is a wonderful fine dinning restaurant that you will want to return to again and again.

Make reservations or you will not be getting in. Don't dress like you are going to a buffet. I suggest a jacket for men and something nice for women. 

Once you get there you are greeted by lovely people. You will be seated in a beautiful space with comfortable chairs. They have a full bar and an extensive, and very expensive wine list. Not being rich, I skip the wine so I can have more starters. All of them are amazing.

They have the best oyster rockerfeller you will find in the state. As for mains, the sea bass, any steak, the lobster and any fresh fish are cooked to perfection. Get the lobster mashed potatoes. Get two--I do, but I forgot about a diet years ago. They are just heaven. 

You are never rushed but there is great service and they are there when you need them. Have the best time.
Best food love it there i am always in the one in nyc  and now in vegas love this one to !!!!good scene great staff Craig the waiter was so nice and professional  the way it should be !!! A must go

I went to a Mastro's in Chicago with my brother. I loved their butter cake so much that after seeing a show in Vegas, I took my wife to experience the greatness that is Mastro's Butter Cake. 

If you haven't tried it and you are on death row, this should be your final meal (for dessert). If you are not on death row or in prison, you should definitely make a trip and try it out. The rest of their food is really good as well, but we came for THE dessert. 

I can't describe it, except it is scrumtralecent. I envy anyone who lives within an hour of Mastro's. If you live within an hour and haven't tried it yet you should be deported... to Idaho.

If you want seafood in AZ, this is the place to go....actually, this is the best seafood I've ever had.

The scene:
Okay....the bar area?  Older crowd, for sure.  It was actually quite entertaining watching these older women trounce around like they're still 20something, getting hit on by the older men...well men probably in their age bracket.  

The food:
Great.  Amazing.  The presentation and service is fantastic.

Unfortunately this was not one of those awesome Mastro's visits that everyone raves about. We've been to both Mastro's in OC and the one in LA and this was by far the least pleasant visit. We've also been to a lot of the high-end restaurants in LV and typically skipped Mastro's because we could get it easily when we lived in SoCal. But now that we live out of state, we were craving BUTTER CAKE!

When Mastro's called to confirm our reservations, we mentioned that we would be coming in straight form the airport, and they said it wouldn't be a problem to store our luggage during dinner. Upon arrival, they didn't have any room in the clutter closet behind the hostess stand. We brought our luggage to the dinner table which was slightly awkward but there was room.

We had two different main waiters and the service was a bit off. The appetizers were cleared from the table and placed on a stand next to us...not sure why they weren't just removed. Then the entrees came - we were warned about the hot plates but they were barely warm. I ordered the steak medium rare and parts of it was rare so I didn't eat it. It took a long time to flag down someone to get our dessert order. I had previously mentioned in my OpenTable reservation that we were celebrating a friend's birthday. Mastro's was very kind in bringing out a slice of chocolate cake for her with a message written on the plate. When the butter cake finally came out, it was also not very warm. We didn't finish the cake but it was still pretty delicious.

Maybe this experience was an anomaly or off night, but we won't be back soon. Even if the butter cake is divine.

Amazing! Incredible treehouse setting, stupendous service and great food. Las Vegas has a new jewel high atop the rather dull Crystals shopping center at the dreary City Center. I can't tell you how wonderful the entire experience dining at Mastro's is--it's magical. Go, enjoy and bring your camera and appetite.

Great ambiance and amazing service!  Not to mention the food is just fabulous.  We started with tuna tartare which was good but nothing spectacular.  But then for the main entree I got the bone-in filet with a side of Mastro's mashed potatoes.  The meat was perfectly cooked to medium rare and the flavor was melt-in-your-mouth delicioso.  Even the simple mashed potatoes was creamy and savory.  It sure is a splurge but I highly recommend it if you are in Vegas and want to pamper your tastebuds.

The most amazing steak I have ever had.  Silence fell over the table as we ate. I was pleased with the suggestion of wine and the sides were to die for.  We had mashed potatoes with enormous chunks of lobster.  Wow!

Wonderful service that matched a great array of fresh and exquisite shellfish selection. The mains were also a delight but I found the sides to be quite rich (which took away from the main attraction), substantial and unnecessary. The wine list was a fairly condensed affair but what was on offer certainly complimented their menu satisfactorily.

This meal was FANTASTIC!
      We started with the calamari, it was so fresh with a spice on it and the sauce was tasty. The bread was fresh and I just love a good piece of bread yum! My husband had a salad and he enjoyed it greatly.

For the main course I ordered Chilean Sea Bass, OMG! prepared just right. My fish just melted in my mouth. I forgot what my husband ordered but he was completely statisfied. We ordered the Gnocchi and the sauteed broccoli as our sides, loved the Gnocchi and the broccoli was good. 

I cannot recall if we had desert, but if we did I'm sure it was great. As far as ambiance goes, the place was nice and they had live music going thoughout dinner and we enjoyed it.

So I am a huge fan of Mastro's and frequent their Costa Mesa and Newport locations. I gotta say that this was pretty close to the CA locations, minus a few minor details. From the pretzel bread to the seafood tower appetizer, I was pleasantly reminded of home sweet home (OC). The atomic horseradish is the perfect paring with your chilled seafood, and that is the perfect way to kick off you meal at Mastro's. I ordered my usual bone-in ribeye and sides of lobster mashed potatoes, creamed corn, grilled asparagus and creamed spinach - all were pretty good. The finale AKA warm butter cake, is where they finally dropped the ball. They brought it out and it was cold. Now this is a dessert that you absolutely must eat piping hot, and considering I had just ordered a dinner for 9 people and 2 bottle of Caymus, was not too thrilled at the anticlimactic ending to my meal. The service was great and I would definitely eat here again. Maybe was just a minor miss on the dessert? Anyways, Mastro's remains my favorite steakhouse and I will definitely give it another shot next time I am in Vegas.

The first time I dined at one of the Mastro's was over 5 years ago in SoCal.  I was with co-workers celebrating a huge case and were told to expense our entire meal.  My first experience was over-the-top due to the amount of money that was spent for dinner, desserts, beers, and alcohol.  I never had the chance to try Las Vegas' Mastro's until recently. 

We were celebrating Valentine's Day a couple of days before the actual day to avoid the crowds.  We arrived about 10 minutes before our reservation and was immediately seated. Service throughout our entire dinner was as good as expected from a place like Mastro's.  We were served bread pretty much as soon as we sat.  The entire bread basket was very good.  The bread basket consist of a dinner bread, garlic bread, and pretzel bread. The basket had two of each, which is perfect if you're sharing with just one other person.  I ordered the 8 oz. filet and it was marvelous.  It's so lean, tender, and enough to keep me satisfied for a few hours.  We also shared the twice baked potato and this was a beast.  It's huge and a half serving is equivalent to most restaurant's full sized potato.  The highlight of the evening had to be dessert.  I have steak all the time and have to admit that I was looking forward to their Signature Warm Butter Cake the whole evening.  The dessert is really simple....just a butter cake, ice cream, strawberry drizzle, and heavy whipped cream.  Every part of this dessert was amazing.  Trust me, the Signature Warm Butter Cake is worth the trip to Mastro's.

So after searching many of the fine dining restaurants online  in Phoenix I decided on MOC 12/8/17.
I was celebrating my girlfriends birthday so I wanted her to enjoy her dinner most of all. The food was excellent! We started out with 1/2 dz oysters and the calamari which was great. Then we both had the petite filets, lobster mash potatoes and roasted Brussel sprouts. The food was awesome! Here is my complaint.. I knew the cost going in and was ok with it, I mean it's fine dining. My issue was our waiter. From the very moment he presented us with the menus he tried to push the most expensive items. From the wine, to the appetizers, entrees and even the after dinner drinks. I spent $300 for the two of us and had no qualms about it! I can read and I knew the cost so I just can't fathom other than tip why he would insist the way he did. It was annoying and we finished one bottle of wine and after he suggested another, we declined it was like he went MIA on us. We tip well when treated well at min 20% but he was not deserving of more than the 17% I begrudgingly gave only because I was thinking of the bus boys and the tip out. MOC talk your staff, no need to push those items, most patrons going to places such as yours I think will tip accordingly and considering your prices I'd say your waiters probable do ok for themselves w/o the push!  Could have easily been 4 stars....

My my my...what a treat it was to eat here. From start to finish, the food tasted superb, and service was impeccable. 

FOOD HIGHLIGHTS
* Bread basket: Served steamy and warm with Mastro's fresh salted butter. Pretzel bread and cheesy, cracker-like breadsticks were my favorites.
* Truffle-lobster gnocchi appetizer special: The chewiest, richest gnocchi I've tried, with tender lobster meat and drizzled with truffle oil.
* Bone-in filet steak, medium rare: Soft, tender beef, topped with clarified butter and a pinch of herbs. Served on a 400 degree plate, so it stays nice and toasty throughout your meal!
* Butter cake: Devastatingly moist, melty, slightly salty, and of course, buttery, with a crisp crust, a scoop of French vanilla ice cream, and whole plate of freshly whipped cream. Not overrated in any sense of the word.

I'm going to stop writing now because I'll drool all over my work laptop keyboard otherwise...

Mastro's you ought to be ashamed.

First let me say this is a terrific nightclub as far as crowd and drinks.  The talented bar staff makes wonderful cocktails from martinis, manhattans, old fashioned, etc.  

And there isn't a better place in the valley to mingle with the wonderfully attractive local ladies.

But the live entertainment is/was an embarrassment on my visit last week.  The three person combo involved a girl on the piano, and female singer and fella on rhythm guitar.  Mastro's why do you hire impersonators as musicians?  The gal on the piano could actually sing.  But more than half the time the persons were simply imitating a soundtrack being played:  she wasn't even pushing down the piano keys, the guitar fella was embarrassing how he pretended to play and the other gal couldn't sing, or was told not to.  Really awful.  Years ago the club has some terrific musicians and played LIVE music.

I'll be back for sure, it pains me to give them a 2 star review because this really is one of the best bars/nightclubs in the country.  

But c'mon!!!  Try  a little harder Mastro's.
Excellent service, food was delicious. We were in a hurry to get to a concert and they were very accommodating.

I went for a birthday dinner last night and everyone had steak except me because I don't eat red meat. I had chopped salad without romaine & iceberg lettuce with spicy mambo dressing, it was disappointing. The salad was a bit soggy because it was over dressing. My suggestion is that NEVER order salad in the steak house. If you don't eat red meat or you are a vegetarian, but your friends throw party in the steak house then you are screwed!
The staffs were very nice thou and the lady with red hair at the ladies room service was super nice.

An excellent bar experience!  

I have eaten at Mastro's Ocean Club in Las Vegas on several occasions.  The food is always fresh, creative, exceptional and special.  

The atmosphere at Mastro's is open, airy, cool and is perched inside a funky tree house in the center of Crystals at City Center. 

But my most recent visit was to the bar for a drink with a friend having just seen Akhob by James Turrell at Louis Vuitton.  It was about 4:45PM on a Thursday.  The bar is not incredibly large, but is it welcoming, tasteful, upscale and classy.  Their drinks are priced in the $15-$21 range, but are really the essence of a great mixologists and high style.  The cocktail list is extensive.  The bartender was quick to have me taste a few things and explore my senses a bit.  

A solid bar experience!

A good friend of ours suggested Mastro's when we asked for a recommendation for a seafood on the Strip. So I made a reservation online for that night at 7pm on the Mastro's website. What I didn't know was that I had somehow clicked on the Chicago location. Luckily I was walking around the Crystals shopping center that afternoon and went to check out the venue and was chatting with one of the hostesses who offered to check on our reservation to confirm it .. good thing she did and we fixed my error. They were pretty booked that night but were able to squeeze us in. :) 

The service was pretty much top-notch from start to finish, hostesses, servers, and bussers,  all were very attentive and knowledgeable as well as being friendly and personable. Loved that they dish out our sides for us .. that's a really nice touch. 

The food, we had a variety of items which were all delicious but at the top of our favorites were the Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi and the Signature Lobster Mashed Potatoes. Both are must haves to accompany any steak or seafood dish. We had the bone-in Filet which was melt-in-your-mouth delicious as well as the pan seared Chilean Sea Bass which my dining companions said was spectacularly prepared and seasoned. 

Dessert was over the top .. we had three .. Mastro's Signature Warm Butter Cake, 
the Cherry Crisp, and the Profiteroles. The first two were topped with Vanilla Bean Gelato. Both were to die for. I had read lots about the Warm Butter Cake and it was everything I had expected and more :) .. and surprisingly I also loved the Cherry Crisp .. I am not huge on Cherry anything but the flavor had just the right amount of sweetness and was not overpowering and the Crisp part is a crumbly granola like topping which is an nice balance with the Gelato and fruitiness of the dish. It's something I would definitely order again! 

My only complaint is that the server didn't warn us about the size of the Beef Carpaccio appetizer. Mom and I each ordered our own, and when they came out .. they were absolutely gigantic and even though we had a party of 5 we were unable to finish both. Being in the service industry myself, I would have definitely warned my guests about the size of the Carpaccio dish and suggested something else to order with it. 

All in all it was a fabulous dinner, the restaurant, even though it is in a busy mall .. has a nice ambiance, and we will absolutely be back.

Best steak I've ever had. I had the Bone in filet cooked medium rare and it was so tender it just dissolved in my mouth. I also shared the lobster mashed potatoes and it was probably the best mashed potatoes i've ever had as well. It was super creamy and the lobster was cooked perfectly.

I came here w/ a group of 20 other guys for my friends bachelor party and we were given a private room w/ a tv so we could watch some football. Boys night out w/ steak, wine, and football? Cant beat that. The Bachelor kept saying this was way too fancy and it was all too much when he walked in the room. But one of our waiters told us "This place is fancy...but you can act ghetto if you want. just relax and have a good time."

We had an excellent experience w/ even better food. This place is legit.

The food is wonderful and the ambiance is incredible.  The restaurant is in the Shops at Crystals, and in this very unique architectural element called the nest.  The food was wonderful, we had shrimp cocktail, steak, sides, and dessert.  I was here in the summer and I did not pack for formal wear that most nice restaurants in Vegas require, however, this restaurant is business casual.  I have a hard time wearing pants for anything in 112 degree weather...  It was also conveniently located near Aria, Mandarin Oriental, and Bellagio via tram.
This place time and time again will always be the best. It is the restaurant that I use to compare all other dining experiences I have. The Creme de la Creme!

Best butter cake I've tried so far. This place is really good I think the food pictures are self explanatory. Only thing that sucks is they serve the food extremely hot so you can't eat it right away lol.

Definitely one of my favorite spots for dinner. The lobster mashed potatoes are a must! Make reservations and take your date for a nice dinner. Definitely a quiet romantic spot for a dinner for two. They have a singer and piano player that make this place even more enjoyable.

The bad - made reservations at 9, didn't get seated until 10, paying $15 for a drink, it better be a damn good drink. Far from it. We are in Vegas there are plenty of options at here, so for not being in a club, i didn't want to pay $15 for a bad drink

I split the special - waygu steak bone in, it was a huge piece of meat, but for a $100 i truly didn't see why this was such an expensive piece of meat 

The good - the manger did come over due to us waiting an hour before we got seated and she brought over some Beef Carpaccio which was some of the best i have ever had.

The Ok - Lobster Mashed Potatoes, sounded better then they tasted.

I wouldn't recommend this place and i will not be coming back.

After reading the Yelp reviews on Mastro's, I was excited about having a high-end steakhouse experience. I was a little suspicious that their Yelp rating was so high since they were nowhere to be found on multiple lists of the best steakhouses in Vegas, but we needed a place that could accommodate a vegetarian, the Yelp rating was 4.5 with over 1000 reviews, and the decor looked inviting and unique. However, I wish I had listened to my gut and gone something else.

The service was incredibly slow and poor in quality. I had to ask twice about the location of our waitress after being seated for 5-10 minutes with no service. Each time, I was told she was "on her way," and one server offered this same excuse even after our waitress finally showed up. It seemed like a standard line they were using rather than actually communicating with each other and coordinating adequate service. Furthermore, they serve the side dishes for you, which took an unfortunate turn when one of the servers missed the plate with our macaroni and cheese and decided that pulling the hot, cheesy mess over my wife's lap was a better idea than putting the spoon over the plate or returning the mac and cheese to its dish. 

Also, they heat their steak plates to over 400 degrees, a fact that they are quite proud of. In my opinion, a truly high-end restaurant shouldn't have a gimmick, let alone one that has no appreciable purpose. I really enjoyed not being able to adjust my plate on the table, in addition to having a personal space heater for the evening. /s

I like my steak medium rare, and I was warned that they tend to undercook their meats, but I ordered a medium rare NY strip anyways. Imagine my surprise when I received a steak that was medium at best (medium pink center with a few reddish juices) and too chargrilled on the outside to really appreciate the cut of meat (44 Farms). I've had better steak for the same price at restaurants back home. How is this considered a good experience in one of America's steakhouse meccas? My wife ordered the clam chowder and couldn't even bring herself to finish it. 

The sides weren't terrible, but I don't agree with the other reviewers about the lobster mashed potatoes. For $35 I expect to see more than 2 tiny pieces of lobster meat. They tasted fine but were nothing mind-blowing. For that price, there should have been at least a few whole chunks of lobster meat to enjoy. The twin lobster tails run twice the price on Mastro's menu; am I supposed to believe that the cost of potatoes is so much that they couldn't afford to include even half of a single lobster tail? The brussels sprouts were overcooked as well, with their charred exterior overwhelming any proper flavor.

The treehouse design of the restaurant is an interesting concept and looks cool in pictures, but in reality, you are floating over a shopping mall, and seeing/hearing shoppers meander about really detracts from any sense of class you hoped to have during your meal.  

Overall, I expected much more given the critical acclaim Yelp has for this place. The next time I'm in Vegas, I'll stick to the big name steakhouses or at least those that worthy of a mention on Eater.

I found Mastro's on Yelp and didn't realize that it was the cool restaurant that looked like it was encased in a cocoon (now known as The Treehouse) when I shopped at the city center a couple of trips back.  I made reservations that day via Yelp and although we waited for about 15 minutes for our 9pm reservations, we were lucky enough to be seated in the Treehouse.  Very cool!  

I had the lobster bisque for a starter and the bowl was HUGE!  It filled me up quite a bit and from the mid point on, I wished I had it to share but managed to drink it all.  It was a bit rich so I was kind of done with it before I finished it off but didn't want to waste any of it so I was a trooper and drank it to the last drop.  Chilean sea bass seemed to be the popular recommendation so that's what I ordered for my entree and that was definitely delicious.  It's a good thing I didn't order any sides because those two dishes totally filled me up!

Great place to try and would recommend at least going there once.  It is a bit pricey but I think worth the experience. Next time I go back, I'd like to go back with a whole bunch of people to get their seafood tower.  The table next to us ordered that and it looked really cool.  If not for the food, just to take a picture to post online.  Haha!

It's become a family tradition to dine at Mastro's Ocean Club every New Year's Eve. We're from Los Angeles but spend a lot of time at our home in Las Vegas and this location is by far the best location we've been to. The service is top notch and, of course, the food is absolutely delicious. Every. Single. Time. Highly recommend the vanilla battered shrimp and scallop appetizers. The bone in filet will ruin all other cuts of meat for you. The lobster mashed potatoes will change your life. The Butter Cake will clog your arteries and might send you into cardiac arrest, but hey, at least you will die happy. Silver linings.

I was just there last weekend for dinner hands-down the best lobster mashed potatoes I had that Waggy beef Tomahawk steak butter melts in your mouth I will recommend mastro's to anybody who loves steak the ambience nice just a great service great food and great people

What's not to love? We dined here for Valentines Day and it was lovely. Wonderful service, extensive wine list and stiff drinks as my husband put it. I had the Chilean sea bass and my husband the ribeye. What I love is they offer 4 ways to prepare your fish which gives you more options when choosing a lighter dish. We spilt the enormous sides and didn't have any room left for desert (next time). We'll definitely be back.

Perfection.  I don't know if I could love Mastro's more. Seriously this place is so amazingly good. Love it, love it, love it.

So now that my mouth is watering I'll tell you why.

My boyfriend took me to Mastro's City Hall for my birthday last November so in return I took him to Ocean Club for his birthday. We were feeling more casual (too hot to dress up) so we sat in the bar where you can still get the full menu. The bar was lively with a piano player singing old favorites (Billy Joel, Van Morrison, etc.)

To start the evening off I ordered a Peartini. I was a little surprised at the price $18! But when our waitress brought out the drink with the shaker, $18 didn't seem so bad anymore. I got about 2.5 glassfulls and the drink was really strong. I certainly got my money's worth. Even after I stuffed myself I still felt tipsy. And the drink was really yummy.

On to the food. First thing they bring out is their bread basket. I could seriously just eat that for dinner and be happy. It includes these pretzel rolls that are to die for. SO good! It's worth going to Mastro's for the bread basket alone. No kidding.

The boyfriend loves bacon wrapped scallops. we saw they had scallops on the menu so we asked if they could wrap them in bacon. The waitress said she would ask and came back to say they would. Yay! So we got the appetizer size to share and they blew us away. One, they were huge, two they were served with this fantastic buttery sauce. They were cooked just right, they melted in our mouths.

Next we decided to split a filet and get a side of au gratin potatoes. The steak comes out on a sizzling plate and the potatoes were served in an iron skillet. The steak was great, cooked just right and full of flavor. The potatoes were drowning in cheddar cheese - almost too much but we're from the midwest where there really is no such this as too much cheese.

We were getting full but it was boyfriend's birthday so of course we had to order the butter cake. Wow. This cake is fantastic. We were expecting a slice of cake with butter cream frosting but instead we got a mini cake, kind of like a rum cake without the rum. On top was a scoop of vanilla ice cream and it was surrounded by slices of oranges and strawberries. Oh, and it's served with a huge side of real whipped cream. No Reddi-whip here! This cake is out of this world. One of the best deserts anywhere.

On top of the great food we had a fantastic waitress. She was fun, helpful, didn't rush us, she did everything just right. A good waitress can add so much to the experience and she really helped make our evening special.

I can't wait until I can get back to Mastro's again. By far my favorite steak house in town.
It's a great place to eat - and people watch.  A bit pricey but worth it.  The staff is great and the drinks strong...what more could you want.

Frustrated with gluten free options. I have eaten here twice and frustrated both times. They do not have any gluten free bread, so you will have to watch the rest of your party eat a basket of bread as everyone decides on their appetizers. All of the appetizers are seafood and many gluten free options, but non satisfies an appetitive like bread. They brought me a very nice gluten free menu and I ordered a $140 steak which came with no seasoning and on a soggy plate. The under waiter came and put creamed corn on my plate (not gluten free). I asked for another plate and they brought me a cold plate, which made the soggy steak cold. Scalloped potatoes and sautéed broccoli were perfect, five star. For dessert I had the chocolate sin cake. It was amazing and best gluten free chocolate cake I have ever had. So, don't arrive here hungry if you are gluten free, expect an unseasoned bland soggy steak. Side dishes and dessert were perfect.

Mastro's is one of my favorite restaurants in town. The menu is wonderful and this is a restaurant where every single dish is perfection. The foie gras is an orgasm in your mouth - yes, that's a thing. Rarely happens, but when it does....
The filet is one of my favorite steaks in this city. I judge a restaurant harshly on their bread service. If you're 5 stars you had better have amazing bread & butter, Mastro's does :). A restaurant should pay attention to every detail!
Plus, the restaurant is in a treehouse, which makes for such a fun but elegant setting. Decor & service on point. They're making me a fort for my next visit - a promise is a promise. 
Yup. Acing the dining experience Mastro's. I rarely give 5 stars because to me it equals perfection in every way.

We usually try to make it to Maestros when we are in Scottsdale. It is pricey but oh so delicious. We like to sit in the bar area to hear the live music and watch the people. We started off with oysters in the half shell. The blue point bay oysters were delicious. They serve a variety of breads in a basket, my hands down favorite is the pretzel bread. Be careful, if you eat too many you won't enjoy your dinner. The roasted Brussel sprouts were served sizzling in a saucepan that was put under the broiler for a minute to get that light char flavor. I had the seared ahi sashimi which was served in a light teriyaki type glaze. Although it was a large serving it was a little salty due to the Cajun rub. My husband had the Chilian Sea Bass which was fresh and baked to perfection with a golden crust.  He said it was the best fish he has ever had. The peachtini was a generous 2 glass serving at $18 and delicious served in a chilled glass with a twist of orange. Overall a wonderful dinner with excellent seafood.

Came in here for dinner and all i can say is WoW. First, the service is outstanding. Second the Petite Filet was so well prepared you did not even need a knife. The flavor was amazing, as were the sides we order. You definitely get what you pay for here..worth every penny

Come here for the seafood!! We got the shrimp cocktail and the oysters to share and I cannot stop thinking about the gigantic shrimp! Fresh, juicy, and the size of a mini lobster! The Kumato oysters were fresh, but sandy. I wish we would have tried the crab or lobster instead. 
The steak was good, but had parts that were more heavily seasoned than others. It was still tasty, but I felt Ruth's Chris does a better steak. The mac and cheese was mediocre and could be skipped next time. The asparagus was fresh, but the tips weren't cooked. I did like that they serve the sides for you.
The berry dream cocktail was to die for! It was strong, but didn't have the strong alcohol taste and the server shakes it up table side and leaves you the remains in the shaker. Definite plus!
For dessert, they brought out the chocolate cake for our anniversary celebration. It was overly sweet and a bit dry. I really wanted to try the butter cake so we ordered one of those too. Very decadent and delicious. I enjoyed the slightly crisp edges and soft, warm center with the ice cream. 
Overall, this was a good experience. We would come back the next time and try more of the seafood.

Came here to eat dinner with a couple of out of town friends.  We were greeted nicely and led to our table.  

Given menus and told about the menu options and some of the favorites.  We were also told about the side items (made in large portions meant to be family style) And about the salads (also large and meant for 2 people).  our salads came quickly and cleared as soon as we finished and the entrees and side came soon after.

The service and knowledge is top notch, the food is good and the fish is flown in daily.

Good food good service pricing not bad, will come back!

Let's begin with, this location is in the middle of a mall.. which alot of other reviewers have brought up i know - but it's the main reason for 4 stars instead of 5. It does get a bit loud and the view is of a shopping mall.. a high-end shopping mall, but still. Not my ideal view for a such an awesome spot. It is what it is though!

The room itself is very nice, lots of seating, lively atmosphere, great looking staff. I have been a couple of times now and the service is always great when I have gone and the food spectacular. 

I have ben to Ocean Club a couple of times, but this most recent visit was a dinner of 'Dungeoness Crab Cocktail', 'Ribeye' and '10 oz Ahi Sashimi' . We shared everything with a side of sauteed spinach .. and a few martinis. :) I loved was the personal style serving from the individual pans that the food items were seemingly prepared in. The service staff has always been very pleasant and makes the experience very comfortable. 

The Ahi was fantastic with a really beautiful presentation laid out on a long plate with a finish of a really tasty sauce. The ribeye was prepared expertly, perfect medium rare with still  a beautiful grill flavor. The spinach was .. spinach, sauteed.. but was excellent nonetheless! haha.. I was having such a great time and enjoying the vibe of the place overall. 

There was a piano player in the corner of the room playing standards and old-school vegas tunes.. Sinatra and the like. It gave a beautiful feel to an elegant style dinner. My friends and I aren't the most refined diners, but we know how to have a good time, and Maestro's made us feel welcome within that setting.

Now don't get me wrong... this ain't your downtown steakhouse with a $4.99 steak special.. you WILL drop a pretty penny to have some seriously tasty grub.. but I do believe it's worth it.  At over $150 a head when we dined there last, it was worth the money but definitely be ready for a big bill. It's nearly unavoidable. 

Have a great time, and happy eating!

Jae wore a tank top and they still let him in. The sides were just okay. Gnocchi was the best side we had. Lobster mash potato, asparagus, Mack n cheese, and spinach. We ordered three different steaks and split it for the table medium rare. I like rare medium rare and my restaurant to have a dimmer light.

18 oz bone-in filet was the best and priciest piece of steak I had so far.  

Lobster mashed potatoes were good.  The portion was huge.  It can probably feed 3 to 4 people.

A great bet for a solid meal and good service in Vegas. Our meal was delicious and our server was very friendly and attentive. Eating in the "nest" was neat although it is kinda funny it's the middle of a mall. Would recommend for a good dinner in Vegas.

Management has yet to contact me a week later. This shows how much management cares about their loyal patrons who have dined here many times.  We will take our business over to Eddie Vs where they treat with you with dignity and respect!!  Shame on you management for not reaching out via email or phone!!!  1 star all around
Truly amazing food. My wife and I had the opportunity to dine there this last weekend. Service was excellent as well as the food. Its worth every penny! highly recommend to all!

I brought clients here on a Thursday evening for dinner around 800 pm. I recommend reservations since  the place gets busy. My clients who arrived from Denver around a year ago and never experienced Mastro's previously so I knew they were in for a treat.

We started off with drinks at the table  once we were  seated and were brought the awesome bread basket -  I indulged in the pretzel bread yum! We ordered a few appetizers - scallops, crab cakes and ordered our starter salads. I opted for just the 1/2 salad of the iceberg wedge - it's plenty large and so yummy. For my main entree I went for he rack of lamb and we shared several twice cooked potatoes and cream spinach. Everything was spectacular and the service was stellar! My lamb was cooked to perfection and  my clients were impressed as I expected. The only con was nobody had room for buttercake!

I received a telephone call from Mastrro's the following day thanking me for my business which again is so out of the box. I'm happy to see even with the change of ownership that nothing has changed here!

My family & I came here to have a celebratory meal, and this place did not disappoint! We had a reservation but arrived early, and we were seated right away. We had an excellent waiter who was very informative and friendly. The bread basket arrived, and it had a huge assortment of flavors in there -- pretzel bread, garlic cheese crisps, etc. Just amazing! Between the 3 of us, we ordered 2 cuts of fish, a steak, and 2 sides. They first gave us each sizzling hot plates with some oil on it for eating off of. Nice presentation. The sides are served family style and are meant to be shared. We opted for the creamed corn and steamed asparagus. Both were delicious and cooked to perfection! We had a petit filet, and they had sliced it up for us to share. It was perfectly pink in the center. Their fish is served very simply, with just the cut of fish for presentation, no add-ons. We had their signature Chilean Sea Bass and Alaskan Halibut. Our server said each fish dish can be served 5 different ways (grilled, pan-seared, etc.), but he recommended that for white fish, it be cooked method #5. Can't recall exactly but it involves some herbs and seasoning. Both the sea bass and the halibut were cooked that way, and they came out scrumptious! They had sliced each piece 3 ways for easy sharing for us, which was very nice. And to round off the meal, we had checked-in on yelp so got a free warm butter cake for dessert! It's normally worth $15! I highly recommend this restaurant for fine dining!

Ocean Club is a great place to impress a date (hint, hint). The atmosphere is great, service is fantastic and the food is good. 

The atmosphere and service surpasses the food.  They serve a great basked of bread, but for me, they can skip everything but the pretzel bread. #addicted.

I had a tasty dirty martini, made to perfection.  For food, we started with the Seafood Tower. We picked crab, lobster and a few others.  That was where we could have stopped and been full but didn't.  I had a petite cut and it was cooked to perfection. 

Top shelf experience and good atmosphere for a date night.

Beautiful location in one of the high end malls in the new City Center. Little bit hard to find if you don't normally shop here. And I don't. Civil servant salary :(. But we made it and we made reservations in advance so no problems with our table. 

Once placed at a table I think the floormanager thought it took too long before we got menu's and drinks because after some talking in a little microphone he brought the menu's himself. And bizarre: he really, really resembles Sheldon Cooper (Big Bang Theory). And once you've seen it........

Our waiter showed up explaining the menu and taking the drink orders. To be honoust, we've missed most of the information. A high speed talk with way too much information about the specials.

We decided on half a portion of the salad of the day (spinach, bacon, egg, the promised blue cheese was hard to find), the lobster bisque, a Ahi Tuna Tartare and the Ribeye with bone. For sides just the sauteed mushrooms.

Portions are huge, but had a few dissapointments considering the price. Although we'resure the waitress spoke off different kinds of Preparing the meat (grilled, blackend, etc.) she didn't asked we would like the meat prepared. Looking at the meat of our neigbours we asked which cooking that was. Turned out to be rare. Just a little too pink for us so we asked the meat to be cooked medium. Can tell you, what we got was definitely way beyond medium. Almost welldone. And no,we didn't send it back. I know, we should have.

The mushrooms were perfectly cooked and huge. Like the portion. More than enough to satisfy four. The bisque was oke but both appetizers, the spinach salad and Ahi Tuna Tartare were flat. The salad being nothing special and the Tuna was way to cold  discover any taste at all. I also don't understand the fried things (onions?) on the bottom.

Best experiences were the setting, despite the location, the services and the bread. Especially the latter was excellent. 

Together with a glass of white and red we've paid $163 before tip.

NOTE: excuse any grammar and spelling mistakes. I'm no native speaker and keep having troubles with my Apple device that keeps trying to change the English words into proper Dutch words. Yes, you've guessed right. My first language.
Overpriced, way under seasoned (the mussels and garlic mashed had no salt or unique flavor whatsoever) and the service was incredibly slow. For a $120 meal for two I expected a lot more
The food is great and the service was excellent. We complained the lobster pasta didn't hve enough lobster and they immediately changed it and it was AMAZING

I'm torn between 3 and 4 stars. The location is weird to me. If you're all about s calm and tranquil atmosphere when you eat.....this is not the place. Service is super fast and super efficient. The kind of service I want when I go to Denny's. Not when I'm trying to enjoy a nice dinner. Like I said efficient but very rushed but I guess that is to be expected in Las Vegas! We split a filet and two lobster tails, sautéed asparagus and mushrooms, I had a bowl of lobster bisque. Asparagus was whatever, mushrooms were tasty, steak was perfect , lobster was too salty and not really fresh. Same with the bisque, it had a slight fishy odor. Lots of lobster and the flavor was good just not FRESH. Again, it's the desert so what did I expect? This was my first Mastro's experience, and while I wasn't disappointed, I wasn't too impressed. Satisfied. I would try the Beverly Hills location, but not again in Vegas.
Excellent everything! The prawns were amazing as was Mastro's mustard sauce.  Highly recommend the seabass and filet.

Been going here for years to people watch and have drinks...past three times I have ate there and wasnt impressed. The seabass is extreamly fishy and last night I ordered the Mahi Mahi...it was dark and tasted like chicken.  I had to fill up on pretzel bread because waiter didnt come back for 30mins after serving the food :(

Wow....If it wasn't a bit spendy I'd love to go here more often when in Las Vegas!

Great bar staff with amazing drinks.... Although the martini's are a bit expensive, they give you the shaker w/ the leftover which makes it almost two martini's... And they are awesome...

We also had a great bottle of wine from their nice selection to choose from.

And the food!!! Wow, the steaks are amazing and we also had a shrimp and a crab cocktail appetizer that were to die for. Nice atmosphere - a little dressy, but it is Vegas so you can show up casual.

We had several great bartenders since we sat at the bar and thoroughly enjoyed it.

Great spot in central location on the strip.....

Mastro's is absolutely by far the best fine dining you will find in the US. I have been to all locations except for Chicago. (Yes, I will get there someday.) It is expensive but worth every penny. The crab cakes are crazy delicious. Lobster mashed potatoes. Yeah, you read that correctly. The filet melts in my mouth. The chocolate covered strawberries are amazing even when ordered in the dead of winter! I'm heading there in a few weeks for my 40th birthday followed by Thunder from Down Under. Ahhh, what a fabulous evening that shall be.

Look, it's Mastro's, we all know that it's expensive going in but when you want good oysters you don't want to skimp.

We ordered a dozen assorted that were on special.  4 kumamotos, 4 fanny bay and 4 blue points.

Of the 6 oysters I ate, only 1 was good.  The others were fishy and mealy.  Just not fresh.  Very disappointing for the price.

2 stars for the very nice and accommodating bar tender.

Food was off the charts but our waitress was awful. Amending review.  Let me explain, first of all the restaurant is very nice.  We waited in the bar for our table with a glass of wine.  When we sat down, a fabulous, wonderful happy woman came over to talk to us about wine, some menu items.  We asked if she could be our server and she explained no.  Too bad!!!  After a long wait our waitress came over to take drink order.  She was so blah and it took forever to get.  No mention of appetizers no suggestions, no enthusiasm.   First time here for 2 of us, what are u known for?  The table next door was getting the service of a lifetime from their waiter, by the way.    Food came out very hot and absolutely fantastic.  Had coupon for dessert, waitress would not take ( after spending 450 on dinner) then came back to say she would.  Too late.  My daughter loves this place and was treating parents to dinner first time at ocean club.  Maybe my expectations are too high.  Just disappointed that my daughter spent a lot of money for average.

I'm kind of surprised right now. So if you read my other reviews you pretty much know that it's hard to get 5 stars, but pretty easy to get 4 stars. If you get 3 stars then there must've been something wrong. 
First of all I was really into going to eat here. I thought it was really nice on the inside. I had a very positive attitude without super high expectations. That's the ideal right? 
Well, I was here for my wife's birthday, and my sister in laws belated birthday dinner. I ordered bone in rib eye. My wife ordered bone in filet w lobster tail on the side and my sister in law ordered lamb chops. I ordered mine medium rare. It came out just under well done. My wife ordered hers medium and it came out well done. My sister ordered hers medium and it came out rare. The manager happened to come by and ask how everything was. I really want to avoid complaining at a restaurant, but my wife said his is too done, and my sisters is not done enough. I said hey it's alright we can handle it, but the manager said oh no please let me take care of this. Ok I said no problem thank you so much. So they started another steak for me and started to cook my sisters more. Ok so they brought mine back. It looked right on the outside...nice looking. Alright so it was practically raw. My sisters comes back and it looks like they threw it in the microwave. All the while it's my wife's birthday and her steak is brown. Wtf. 
So I cook a little around the house. Some say my steak is better than most restaurants. I usually say it's ok. Well, in this case I can say I can get the temp on the money 90% of the time without timing it. I really was kind of shocked. I won't go into the meat anymore because it really was a train wreck. 
The appetizers were good. Dungeness crab cocktail, and oysters on a half shell. Drinks were great. We all enjoyed. But the dinner was really one of the worst I have ever had. I am really bummed about that. I can't really rate it a 1 star because the manager was good, appetizers were good, drinks were good, but the dinner...well, never again. I almost want to bump up the 2 stars that I have given on other reviews because this review is really 1 and a half.

My mom and I came to this restaurant because we got a gift card to the shops at Crystals. I got the filet mignon and my mother got sushi. The filet mignon was cooked to perfection and the sushi was excellent. The sushi dish actually came with quite a large amount of sushi. The bread basket was pretty nice also. We also got the asparagus and the mashed potatoes. We actually had a miscommunication with our very very knowledgable waitress and wanted lobster mashed potatoes instead. The manager came up to us and without hesitation brought us a lobster mashed potatoes literally within 3 minutes. The lobster mashed potatoes were also great. For dessert we had the butter cake and it was to die for. I'm not usually a cake person, but this was one of the best desserts I've ever had. Highly recommended - great service, great food. The price tag of the meal is quite high however; with all of our food the total was still about $100 even with a $100 gift card.

OH wow how could I forget to make a review for this place?! LONG overdue this review is for March.... I was celebrating my 21st birthday you know in LAS VEGAS duh! Hahaha, my boyfriend made reservation for my birthday dinner on a Sunday night this was last minute because we wanted to stay in Vegas longer hahaha , we usually go to the one in Orange County because we are from California. 

OH wow this Mastros is GORGEOUS! Make sure to ask for a seat in the bird-nest!! 

Food - BEST BEST BEST Lamb racks ever!!! Ugh I had it medium rare but it came out more rare but I didn't mind. Ever bite taste like butter. Boy friend has the New York Steak - This wasn't so bad, I couldn't stop thinking about how good my lamb racks were that I can't remember if this was super good or not hahaha. We had a side of Mac and Cheese too greasy, would not order this I think we prefer the Lobster Mash potatoes instead. 

Service was wonderful! Better service than we had in Orange County. Everyone was nice, and even the manager came to ask if everything was fine. 

In the end of the meal our server ask if we wanted any dessert but we were super full for any. But he still came out and surprise me with a birthday cake! He even wrote " Happy 21st birthday. " Which I think is very special to me!  

THANK YOU MASTRO'S LAS VEGAS!

Such a great experience! The wait staff were so attentive, and the food was fantastic. The restaurant itself looks very nice and upscale. There's not much else to say because it was such a perfect dinner. I wish I knew the name of my waiter, so I could mention him. He was wonderful though. I'm sure they all are:)

Restaurant is built like a tree house in the middle of the shopping area in the Aria casino.   Very cool concept and views over looking the casino.  The hostess was very nice and recommended a table for us right by the window in the tree house.  The waiter was very polite and super friendly. Besides recommending some of the meals, he had some personal conversations with us and it turned out that he is not too far from where I live.   Now to the important part..... For appetizer we had escargot, which was really good.  For main entree we ordered a lobster special that was recommended by the waiter and the lamb chops.  Both entrees were very tasty and made just right.  Some of the best meals ive ever had.  For dessert we ordered cherry pie which was really good, but very large, we had maybe a 3rd between the 2 of us.  If you get dessert, i recommend you split it. As a matter of fact, both entrees were very generous sizes and we couldn't finish it all.
I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone. The food, the service and the atmosphere are fantastic.

Steak....great!  Seared Ahi Tuna.....great!  Ahi tosatas......great!  Brussels Sprouts....meh!  Butter Cake.....had to change my pants!!!!  Service was phenomenal!!!!!!!!!

Pants.....ruined.
It doesn't get any better than this.  Anytime I have out if town visitors that want a great meal we go to Ocean Club.  This place is what all great restaurants should be like.
Love this place!  Great food and drinks.  Wish they had a location in San Jose or San Francisco.

My boyfriend and I came here to have a celebratory dinner. There was a bit of a mix up with our reservations (I used open table) but they were still able to accomodate us.

Mastro's is located inside the Shops at Crystals on the second floor. My boyfriend loved his Hennessy sidecar cocktail and always talks about going back just for drinks and to try their dessert.

We decided to skip appetizers and just go straight into the main course. We got the 22 ounce bone-in ribeye, the ahi tuna sashimi, lobster mashed potatoes, and sauteed broccoli. Since we were sharing, they offered to plate and serve everything for us. We ordered with the intention that the tuna would be for me, and the steak would be for him but by the end of the meal, I enjoyed the steak so much I ended up eating most of it. I'm a fan of ribeye steaks because i find them to be more flavorful than filets - and the steak here had a nice sear on the outside and perfectly tendor on the inside. The lobster mashed potatoes were yummy but a little bit salty to me (although my boyfriend said it was fine and he loved it). The amount that we ordered was more than enough for two people, we didn't get to dessert because we were so stuffed.
The food was great but the service was nothing special. I expected better, especially for that price...

You know, some close friends of mine introduced me to this place a few years ago. I've yet to find it's equal. 

I highly recommend the Flour de blu (stoli elit), butter cake, Chilean sea bass, and anything else you can wrap your paws around. Truly epic.

I have never had a bad meal at Mastro's. We had a table of 20 people and we all order different items and loved them all immensely. I got crab claws and my husband got steak. We also ordered the bacon appetizer as well as the vanilla shrimp. I truly think I'm addicted to the vanilla shrimp. It is unbelievable and so flavorful. The salads and all of the sides are amazing but I have to tell you that their signature dessert (which is a warm butter cake) is the best dessert you will ever eat. My girls got chocolate covered strawberries with the mound of whip cream and those two were extraordinary. Go eat at this restaurant because you will love it!
The Red Dragonfire drink is oh sooooo delicious.  A smooth martini with a hint of spice. Also try the butter cake. This cake literally melts in your mouth.

We went to Mastros City Hall last year.
This year we came down for spring training and always that one great meal.
This year we tried Mastros Ocean Club.
We were not disappointed.
The food was amazing.
I had salmon that was cooked to perfection.
6 of us shared 3 side dishes and it was more than enough.
Our service was lead by Dave and he like the food did not disappoint.
We are fans and we will be back next year during our annual trip to Arizona.

Bravo!!!
Phenomenal service and food. The seafood tower was fresh and delicious. I had the bone in filet, halibut, along with multiple sides. Everything was perfect.

I am going to be 100% and not waste anyone's time.

Butter cake. Best I have ever had. So sweet buttery, that homemade whip cream adds a nice sugary surprise. That is all I get when I go here and totally worth it.

THE VERDICT: Butter Cake. See YA!

Loses a star because there were 15 empty tables when we walked in at 9:25 for our 9:15 reservation, and they made us wait at the bar for 15 minutes. 

Otherwise, basically a great meal. Slightly poor ambiance because it's in a mall, albeit an ultra fancy mall. The piano guy was pretty good. 

The food was fantastic. Had really good oysters, ask for the grassy ones if they have them. Some sort of california oyster that had a really strong flavor that the waitress recommended. 

The crab cakes and ahi tuna apps were also very good.

For main we got the seabass and the swordfish. The seabass was very good, but not in that cliched and too common sweet glazed seabass/ black cod. 

Swordfish I foolishly ordered a little underdone but was still good. They allow you to choose how to cook the meat, if you don't know much about cooking and different fish, ask the server, he/she seems very likely to know the best way to order each fish. 

For dessert, we got their signature "butter cake" which was obviously ridiculously rich and good. Served with an ENORMOUS tray of whipped cream. Everything at this restaurant appears to be made from scratch, and it tastes that way too. Every dish is enormously portioned as well.

This is one of my favorite restaurants, this location in particular is fantabulous!  The food is always mouth watering, the service and staff are superb from the moment you walk in everything is nothing short of excellent.  My husband and I make it a point to dine here when we are in town, it never disappoints.  Our servers Tanya and Juan were AMAZING and made our dining experience superior this past visit!  They made us feel like we were the only table in the restaurant :)  I would highly recommend everyone dine here and of course order the butter cake.

We were there on Sat evening pre valentines thought we would try it again after a not so good experience a while ago! I ordered  Mahi it was raw inside!!! Ewe!! Sent it back strange for such a high dollar eatery!!! The service not so great either 2 chances their out! on to Dominicks or City hall next time

The crab legs and lobster tail are to die for.  The food was terrific, the service could have been better.  The staff seemed extremely stressed out, but other than that, wonderful food, beautiful building in a great location.  We walked around the complex after dinner, the shops and the scenery in the Kierland complex in Scottsdale are very beautiful.

Was brought here on my birthday and I was blown away. From decor, to food, to service... Everything was top notch. I had the blackened salmon, which was perfect. All my guests also enjoyed their meals, and we had a great time. Will definately be back.
Fabulous dinner at tonight with my man. Lobster dinner and he had the lamb chops it was unreal and our server was fantastic will definitely come back here what a great evening
The food was fantastic. Our waitress was top notch. Pretzel bread and mashed potatoes were excellent. Huge steaks. Noise level was a little loud. Would recommend for a special night out.

This Vegas Mastros location is my absolute favorite compared to the Bev Hills and Malibu one. 
I guess i just like the more airy, modern vibe there. The BH location is kind of old and stuffy, while the Malibu one is cramped and the vibe is weird.
The energy felt so much more free flowing and airy at this vegas location. I'm assuming because it's much newer. But I love it. The other ones seemed to cramp the tables too close together.
As far as the food...amazing. The foie gras was delicious and the portions were generous , seafood platter...yum! The steak was perfect.
Thank you Mastros for another yummy experience!

I'm giving 4.5 stars.

The bone-in rib eye was not as impressive as I had expected. There wasn't as much marbling, and it didn't seem seasoned enough. 

The truffle gnocchi = out of this world. This is a def must-try.
The lobster mashed potatoes- SUPER legit. But I think my cholesterol level shot up double points from the butter. It was swimming in yellow soup-ey juice, and when I asked the waiter, "Excuse me, is that butter." He responded, "Most people think it's a sauce. But yes, that is butter."  I like how he didn't give me a straight answer first. It sure looked like some sauce!

Bread basket- LOVE. 
Seafood appetizer- much more filling than expected. 

Interesting layout and concept of being in a mall. It's a place worth trying out for a nice occasion.

Famous for their seafood, famous for their seafood. Between the salmon, swordfish, steak and chicken I tried last night, the seafood won. Steak was decent, but for the price you can get better elsewhere. 
The sides: mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, green beans. All great, but really nothing that stood out. 
Mastro's is the weird treehouse looking restaurant inside City Center. They have free valet service if you're dining here. Just make sure you park at the right place- NOT Aria, NOT Vdara parking.
Simply incredible dining experience. Would have liked to have been greeted sooner once we were sat; but, other than that, everything was perfect.

Nice place for dinner.  Lots of choices on the menu.  It's just as good as the Mastro's that is focused on steaks.
For this group dinner, we had:
Jalapeno Tuna Sashimi - excellent, and not that spicy even w the jalapenos
Hamachi w crispy onions - excellent, especially with the crispy onions
Heirloom tomatoes - ok, but I would pass on this
Sea Bass - very good, but not spectacular
Vanilla battered sole - very good w massive portion (4 large pieces) and yummy tartar sauce
Lobster mashed potatoes - outstanding and one order enough for 4-5 people easily
Gorgonzola mac n cheese - nice and cheesy (nuff said)
Roasted Brussels sprouts - excellent

Yes, i would come back here!

Over rated and over priced....mash potatoes taste like they are out of a box. Ahi tuna is great but again very over priced. Don't understand why people rave about it.  Restaurants should be based on quality of food versus "trendy".

Since Landry's bought out Mastro's , I have noticed they have really cut back on how much they serve in their Martini drinks which is disappointing. They also cut back on their filets too. The service is great, it's a good thing they kept their staff.
Delicious food and great looking restaurant. Servers were extremely attentive and friendly. Overall, great restaurant. Would definitely go again for a special occasion.

Had a reservation for 8:30 only got sat at 9:15 but the managers said they will take care of us. Hopefully they keep their word. The service is always very well done with multiple servers/busers/backserver anywhere you look. The 8 oz filet was cooked very well to the choice of selection. The sweet potato fries were good but didn't look very appealing. The cream of corn was to die for. The sautéed mushrooms had a nice grill flavor. I would like to come back if there were no "speed bumps" with the reservations. Turns out there was nothing done to the tab like the managers offered. Really disappointed they didn't meet the needs of the customer.

We were in Vegas for a bachelorette party for one of my besties and decided on this place for our fancy dinner night. We had 11 girls and people ordered a variety of things from the sea bass to the bone-in steaks. This is one of those fancy places where you order just the protein and then sides are extra. Here's the breakdown:

Bread basket - GOOD. Normally, I'm not a fan of loading up on carbs, but we were getting bottle service the night and I was already starving, so I had to put something in the stomach. I was pleasantly surprised at the freshness of the bread! So soft and slightly warmed.

Lobster bisque - giant serving (probably enough for 2!). Rich and creamy with actual chunks of lobster!

Seabass - good and buttery. It was a big serving size and I only finished probably half of it.

Bone-in ribeye - good, but slightly under cooked according to my friend's order.

Lobster mashed potatoes - I'm not really a fan of mashed potatoes and these were okay. Small pieces of lobster mixed in.

Sea Salt & Vinegar Fries - pretty good! Nice little break between bites of our main courses.

Creamed corn - pretty good! Nice side dish without being overpowering.

The food was pretty good, but for a place of this caliber, I expected a lot more. They either under cooked or over cooked several steak orders, which had me thinking: What kind of steak house is this?!

The service was top notch at least and our bride-to-be got a special warm butter cake delivered to our table.

Would I return? Probably not.

Now THAT is what I call Fine Dining!!! I was simply WOW'D by the absolutely impeccable service and presentation!! Every other fine dining restaurant in Vegas should emulate EVERYTHING that Mastro's does but they won't so Mastro's shall remain the BEST.

I took my 74 year old mom there for her birthday after reading the glowing reviews and she was in tears over how AMAZING her experience was!  They cater to your every need and anticipate them which is what I look for. Never an empty water glass, dishes cleared immediately, food kept coming!  

And the fooooddd!!!
Appetizer: Mom: Calamari Me: Lobster Bisque=  OH YEAH!

Entree: Mom: Scallops Me: Chilean Sea Bass= Woah Nelly!!!
