One of my all time favorite desserts is their BUTTER CAKE...{Is this becoming a theme here? }  It is slightly sweet, slightly crispy on the outside, 'light' and fluffy on the inside, comes warm with fresh fruit and a giant bowl a fresh whipped cream.  It is to die for!
Start to finish, these folks just get it right.  Came with high expectations and they were met at every turn.

Amazing restaurant! We had oysters Rockefeller and bone marrow for appetizer. Both were superb! Ribeye and rack of lamb for main course were absolutely delicious. The atmosphere was very inviting. The only draw back was the location in the mall. Will come back here every time  were in Vegas.

Sure you pay for it, but this is the real deal. The food is always fresh and perfectly prepared. The staff is trained to serve with knowledge and respect. It's no mystery why they've been in business so long and are expanding. Perfect for special occasions.

Terribly snooty staff.  We made reservations several days in advance only to be set way in back away from the music when there were open tables available. We asked to be set closer to the band and were told we had to wait 45 minutes.   Steaks were overcooked.  Bad attitude from the whole wait staff.  Not worth the price. Won't go back.

Great decor & design 
Good Food 
Good service 
Reservations a must 

Dropped in after a short search with my Yelp Android App, the design of the place by KAA is amazing. I felt like I was eating inside of a piece of art, sculpture that is. 

It's obvious the rich and famous dine here as the presentation of the entrees are really dramatic but very entertaining. Service was good, but could have been better - it was a Monday night. 

If you haven't been, you must give a try!

Great place for a late steak dinner with no reservations usually.
The best meat and chefs plus service is top notch professional.

Well, since we were in LV we visited our usual place for a Sat night dinner. Glad we did as it is always top notch.

The Con's:
* The bathrooms are up stairs. A real bummer when your all cocktailed up and have to navigate carpeted stairs. There is an elevator, but you kind of feel odd waiting for an elevator to go up one floor.

The Pro's:

* Staff is always top notch, from the hostess, to the bus guys, all are great and seem to have been trained very well. Anyone can help you with anything. Never do you hear "I will tell your waiter". They just get things done and do it well.

* Food I always top notch. Never had a better steak on the strip. 

* Great vibe and crowd. Upscale and nice looking crowd. No torn jeans and camo here. It's nice seeing folks get cleaned up and dressed for dinner.

I will keep this review short as I have already reviewed them several times and don't want to repeat comments. If you have not tried this place, you should. Top notch for sure.

Wow! Great food great atmosphere and amazing service. Everything was prepared perfectly and was piping hot. The Chilean Sea bass was light and buttery while the twice baked potato was so savory my mouth is still watering two days later. Wine list was sophisticated and the lobster roll is a must get. Would recommend for anyone who has $100 a person to spend on dinner.
Everything cooked to perfection and delicious. The service and ambiance is unparalleled. This place is expensive but worth every penny.

I guess I had ridiculously high expectations because I love, love, loved Mastro's Steakhouse and a like seafood even more... I thought it would be the perfect combo, but I ended up kind of disappointed in Ocean Club. Maybe I ordered wrong, but my dish (and my date's) were far from outstanding; no great flavors or anything exciting at all about our food. 

The people watching in the bar area was great! I think the man to woman ratio was about 10:1. A perfect place to go if you're a single woman looking for a Tommy Bahama shirt wearing older North Scottsdale man who hangs around expensive restaurants.

A great experience from beginning to end. Excellent customer service, fantastic food, great wine and exceptional company! Highly recommend Mastro's.

Biggest highlight was the rack of lamb, extraordinary!

By far the best restaurants in vegas, I have no words to describe this place was amazing the service was fantastic the waiters are nothing but perfection and professionalism the food is excellent I will definitely go back over and over again little expensive but every penny worth.

Best tasting food ever!! The shrimp cocktail are gigantic and delicious! The Caesar salad is very good. The clam chowder is amazing... But the only complaint I have is that either the waiters or the kitchen staff make a lot of mistakes with the steaks... It's either kinda undercooked or overcooked. I asked for a medium rare plus and they gave me a rare. They comped the steak because it was their error but it was just a shame I couldn't enjoy my steak. The butter cake there is amazing!! It's a must try for all!

DELICIOUS!! The bread basket was warm and fresh out of the oven. I'm not a huge steak person so I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass. It was cooked perfectly. I'm a sucker for sweet potato fries. The mac & cheese was good and the lobster mashed potato was amazing!!! Not only was the food good but the location and being in a treehouse was fun. Service was top notch and I'll definitely come back for more.

I've been to the Mastro's in Costa Mesa several times so I was pretty excited to try this Mastro's. Plus, I've always wanted to dine in the treehouse that they have here! I suggest making a reservation and requesting the treehouse. I guess it's not anything too special, but it is nice being in a different setting that you can't really get anywhere else on the strip. 

The service here was excellent. Janene was our server and provided excellent customer service. She constantly checked up on us, refilling our wines and making sure our meals were to perfection. 

// FOOD & WINE //
Wine- The Prisoner: This wine is a blend of Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Petite Sirah and Charbono. This wine had so many flavor profiles going on. It also went really well with all of the meat that we ordered. The wine was very smooth with plenty of fruity flavors to it. 

Sauteed spinach: Your basic sautéed spinach with garlic. I would rather suggest ordering the sautéed mushrooms.

Scalloped potatoes: It was good, but it wasn't excellent. I would have liked more cheese added to my scalloped potatoes. Also, the potatoes seemed to be slightly undercooked and hard. 

Bone-in ribeye: A great piece of meat with excellent meat to fat ratio and amazing flavor. I would definitely order this again. 

18 oz bone-in filet mignon: Ordered rare plus, this meat was so tender. Unfortunately it wasn't seasoned that well so I had to add salt and pepper to each bite. 

Overall, I enjoyed dining at this Mastro's location, but if I had to choose between this location and the location in Costa Mesa, I would have to choose the Costa Mesa location. The service at both locations were excellent, but I would have to say that I slightly enjoyed the food more at the Costa Mesa location.

One of the many indulgences of La Vegas. Mastro's is a well known stop for those looking to treat themselves. 
Food: We went as a group of 7 girls and all got steak with a variety of shared sides. I split a 16oz filet made medium (almost half the price it would cost to get an 8 oz filet on your own). It was everything I expected from a good steakhouse, well seasoned, tender, and perfectly cooked. Its only dressing was a melting slice of butter on the top. The sides were all generally well made. The lobster mashed potatoes had real chunks of lobster it in, though, between the 7 of us, not everyone got a piece. The brussel sprouts and asparagus were cooked to just the right texture but there was nothing really special about them. The creamed corn was sweet and luxuriously smooth but needed a little more savory to balance it out. 
Service: The service was excellent. The server was very accommodating and attentive. A few of us ordered steaks to split and they plated them separately for us. We also brought in our own cake since we were celebrating a birthday. They served the caked and repacked the leftover cake for us to go. 
Locations: Mastro's unique architecture has made it a near icon among the casinos on the strip. Floating in the middle of Crystals, it makes up a beautiful view and provides one. The decor is subdued in an elegant way and it generally draws a quieter crowd.    
While Mastro's wasn't a life changing dining experience, between the high class menu and eye catching locale, it certainly did not disappoint.

Everything was great, you get what you pay for, etc., etc. but here's what you need to know. If you order a mixed drink, such as a gin and tonic - you will get a gin on the rocks with perhaps a 1/2 inch of room for tonic, which is provided in a separate bottle. Talk about a good pour!

If you don't like your drinks that strong, you might mention it up front.

Mastro's Ocean Club Las Vegas - I think we just had a bad night!  I didn't think it was all that... Good but not oh my gosh good. What really made it bad was our waiter.  When you spend a lot of money at a restaurant you expect great service and our waiter stood around talking and laughing with other waiters and barely paid any attention to us.  Our drinks were empty multiple times for long periods of time.  Took him forever to take our order and acted like he worked at a dinner instead of an upscale restaurant.  I'm sure if we had a different server I would feel better about spending hundreds of dollars on our meal but we got what we got and unfortunately I have to base my experience on that.

This place was very busy on a Thursday night and our party of 4 was seated in the farthest corner of the restaurant. I think they're racist because that corner also had the only Indian group on one table and a Hispanic party on another, with older snowbirds mixed in. The front tables by the entrance had the younger white crowd. 

Server was good and service from everyone was good.

Two filets were cooked a good medium but the ribeye was under. The sides were good as well as the butter cake for dessert and all in all a good meal. 

My complaint is with the sea bass. Every other time I've ordered it, it was about an inch and a half thick but this time it was like a pancake! Seriously not even a half inch thick and it tasted mushy since it was so thin and didn't have any char marks. 

Funny since we went there because of me and I had the worst meal.

After being disappointed at their Scottsdale location we decided to eat at this one and were glad we did. 

Her filet was cooked a perfect medium, mine was a medium when I asked for medium rare. But once I tried it, I didn't care, it was sooo good. 

Creamed spinach and mushrooms were both delicious. 

I wish you could order a split side instead of having to order two separate ones. It's just too much food, but I get it.

The bomb- awesome- just like the Beverly Hills place.
Not only is the food amazing- but they actually used alcohol
in there drinks  (unlike many places in Vegas)
We went on a Thursday night- and the eye candy of "available"
women waiting for clients was mind boggling.  
All the senses my senses were tickled at dinner.

This review is not about foods but about how the servers pushes its patrons to have more foods than what they wish to order. We had to repeat and tell our waiter " No" several times in respond to him asking us "I can just double every order." If we wanted double of all our appetizers orders, we would have requested double. We came here yesterday to celebrate our best friend 40th birthday. We are a tight group of close friends and know each other likes and dislikes. We all love fine dining and enjoy Maestro Ocean club on a regular base. So it's disheartening for me to write this review as the foods and services have always been excellent in the many years we've dined at Maestro's establishment. (not this particular one) This was our first time at this Maestro in Vegas and because of this incident, we may not return here. We were charged 2x for majority of our appetizers dishes. We specifically told our waiter NOT to double as we like varieties and didn't want to fill up so much as our meals are always so filling. The night was fun and We didn't feel the need to check our bill. It wasn't the first time and Maestro have always given us superb service. But the next day, my friends and I all look over our bill, $2,286 for our large group of 16 but to have the waiter took it upon himself to ADD it to our order was a bit of a disappointment. I hope this is not a regular practice of this Maestro with large parties. So if you dine here, please check your bill and make sure to emphasize with the servers what you would like to "Double" or not.

Mastro's NEVER EVER EVER disappoints.  Service was stellar this trip just as it's been every other single time we've ever been here.  The Bone-in Tomahawk Ribeye is for to die, the lobster mashed potatoes are pure heaven, and OMG the Warm Butter Cake makes me weak in the knees.  Love Mastro's!!!

Yummie!  This place was great. There was 9 of us for dinner for a friend's birthday, our table was ready and waiting for us when we arrived, they allowed us to decorate the table, the service was awesome, their menu includes steak & seafood so everyone could order whatever they wanted.  The restaurant was very busy I must say and every table had cocktails on it, both are good signs for me.

They have tons of steaks to choose from, lamb, vanilla fried lobster, scallops, and tons of fish. My only confusion came from how the fish was actually prepared b/c there wasn't really on the menu explaining how you can get your fish cooked. After asking the waitress, she explained the 5 fish preparations.

Here's what we ate:
1) Sashimi tower -white fish, Tuna, lobster rolls all very good [see pix]
2) Heirloom tomatoes and burrata salad-very tasty and tons to share
3) Escargot-my favorite very very good [see pix]
4) Creamed Corn-typically not a fan but I did enjoy this very much
5) Brussels Sprouts-eh they are good for you
6) Mac n blue cheese-yes for sure
7) Halibut Oreganata - almost $50, but was a huge piece of fish, definitely could share this
8) the fried lobster was another one of my favorites
9) tuna tostadas again very good [see pix]

I wanted to try the crab cake but didn't have any room left. We had more leftovers in bags then arms to carry them on.

Other notable notes: waiters were exceptional with their service of our table, my glass of Veuve was never empty and the waiter was calling me by name the whole time :).
Our bill was over a grand after everything was said and done. So it's on the pricer side.

This place is amazing!. The steak here is cooked at a ridiculously hot temperature and makes it taste better than anything in life. I got the 12 oz bone in filet and was not let down by the taste and quality of it. My family got the Chilean sea bass blackened and it is by far the best seabass I have ever had. The sides come out really hot in their own pans and we had the mac n cheese and green beans which were delicious. They have a great wine selection but the butter dessert cake really topped it off with the scoop of ice cream on top you just can't get enough of it. I can't wait to come back here next year because its something I look forward to that much. Service is awesome and Lionel is the best waiter who knows his stuff.

It started a bit off and continued.  We were sat at a table which did not accommodate our kids car seat (even after we specified that in the reservation). After we had to cram into the assigned table the meal and service was adequate.  
One meal both steak and crab was over cooked and presented with a cream sauce that I didn't order.  It took 20 minutes to get it remade and then came out with crab that was served like hash browns since they over cooked it  so much.  
The waiter Jesse was accommodating to his mistake but not once did a manager come over and offer any apology or words of wisdom.  After sending something back twice at a place like this you should not be charged for it.  And a manager should be all over it... not only was there no comp the server then upgraded what he brought me (crab wise) and charged me the difference.  Just overall a classless experience out of that server.  After many times at City Hall and competitor Eddie Vs I do not see what all the "hype" around ocean club is...

Everything is always done perfect at Maestro's. The food, wine selection and a dessert with its own twitter site.
The only weird thing about this one is it's in the middle of a mall with very expensive stores. Steak place in the mall....hmmmm
Other than that, they are always spot-on with the best food and service.
If you never have been to one, you can't truly say you are a foodie. 
Warm butter cake!!!

This place is amazing! My boyfriend and I went here our last night in Vegas. We had made reservations and got seated right away inside of the beautiful architecture. Our server Megan was extremely informative and attentive. She went through the menu and gave us some suggestions.

 We ordered some drinks and they brought out the huge bread basket, which had at least 4-5 types of bread. I really liked the pretzel bread and the cheese crisps. Our server brought out our drinks, The Paloma i ordered was excellent, not over powering but had wonderful refreshing grapefruit flavor.

 I ended up ordering the Oysters Rockefeller, Clear Lobster Roll and the Alaskan King Crab Gnocchi with Black Truffle. My boyfriend got the Chilean Sea Bass, wedge salad and sautéed asparagus. The oysters were juicy and full of flavor and honestly this was the best gnocchi I've ever had. It was rich and was full of crab and truffle. The lobster roll was okay, had good flavor. My boyfriend's fish was cooked perfectly and almost tasted like lobster. It went well with the asparagus and gnocchi.

 Our plates were cleared and Megan brought out a dessert menu, we were way too full for dessert. However, she brought us out a little pair of chocolate covered strawberries with fresh whip cream for a little sweet treat on the house! Service was impeccable, our water glasses were always full and we were definitely catered to. Megan our server made our experience a wonderful one, I highly recommend this place for a special occasion, it's worth every penny!

Tried the famous Mastro's Ocean Seafood Club. Very unique dining facilities. The staff and management are first rate and the food menu is extensive. 

The Bone Marrow was generous, prepared well and tasty but I think the salted butter used on the marrow and toast points made it a little salty to our taste. I just downed more water as it was so good.

We shared a tossed salad with tomatoes, onion and shrimp and was very clean and delicious.

The main course of Chilean Sea Bass was grilled to perfection. The filet was a couple inches thick and not over grilled. It was flaky and very delicious - every bite. You may want to share it - it was so good.

The Bone in Rib Eye lacked the common fat eye. The meat was perfectly cooked med rare but the cut I got was tougher than I expected. Looking back at the experience I should have said something but I soldiered on and finished the meat. It would just be bad ju-ju not to finish it.

The sides were the Lobster Mash and Sautéed Spinach. The Lobster Mash was just ok. I like mash potatoes with a thicker texture and not as soupy as they present it. I'll pass on it next time.

The dessert was the famous butter cake. Oh man, this was great with coffee. However, after the amount of food we already consumed the desert was just too much to finish. It felt like a shame not to finish the dessert. The perfect portion for us would have be to share the dessert between four instead of two. 5,000 calories later

Overall the experience was positively memorable  - 5,000 calories later. A little loud at times. The staff did everything they could to make it a great night. The food was prepared well but in the case of the Rib-Eye was sub par. Chalk it up to sub-par cut of meat. I'll go to Mastro's again.
Always the best! Great service, perfectly prepared food and the best butter cake on the planet!

Tried Mastro's for the first time on Saturday while staying in Vegas. Made a reservation on Yelp (super convenient and easy) for 5:15pm. Ended up coming 15 mins late because of traffic but was still seated right away after we arrived. If you do plan on coming here, leave about 30-40 mins (depends on traffic also) early since you do have to park/valet then walk into Crystals Mall located at Aria.

Appetizer - Tried the calamari and I would have to say I have had better. The calamari was reallllllly chewy. Some might prefer that but I don't believe calamari should be chewy. The only reason why it was enjoyable was the creamy sauce that came with it. I could eat the sauce by itself. It was THAT delicious. As a high-end restaurant, I was expecting better calamari, but Flemings and Ruth Chris both win on that dish.

Entree - Bone-in Filet and Bone-in Ribeye. The Filet was amazing! It was tender, juicy, and perfectly cooked. I usually get filet without the bone but decided to try something different and it did not do me wrong. The bone-in ribeye was good but not as good as the filet. It was soft in the center but the outside was too blacken for my taste. It was over-charred and slightly burnt in corners. Probably wouldn't get that again.

Sides- Lobster mashed potatoes.... WOW! Such a genius idea. $39 side... so you will expect something amazing and it was! So flavorful with lobster pieces in each bite. I will definitely get this again. Cream corn - nothing that stands out from other cream corn I have tried before. Though, I could tell the corn was cut from fresh corn, rather than using canned corn - which was a plus. 

Complimentary bread - variety... probably 4-5 different types.

Service - from a 1-10, I'd give about 7.5. Server wasn't as personable or attentive.

1 appetizer, 2 sides and 2 steaks came out to be $188.
Truly the best steak house in the country. Do not pass on the Butter cake it's unreal

Best food EVER. Steak is perfectly cooked and lobster mash is to die for. Didn't really like the creamed spinach but the BUTTER CAKE YUMMY!!!!!! If you make a reservation ask to sit in Linus section. He is one of the best waiters EVER!!!!!

I've been to Maestro's Ocean Club 6-7 times, and each time it does not disappoint - It . Is . Fabulous .  

This past weekend we ordered the Oyster's Rockefeller to start with and they were as delicious as always. For our entrees, I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass and my boyfriend ordered the Filet Oscar Style - both dishes were amazing. Spinach and mushroom sides were also very good - this place is exceptional. For dessert we shared the key lime pie, and it was surprisingly a large slice - loved it! Usually we get the signature warm butter cake for dessert and it is heavenly. 

Overall, we love Maestros' Ocean Club. The service is always impeccable and then food outstanding. The bar area has live music and is a perfect place to people watch. The dining room on the other side is also very nice and a bit quieter. I would recommend Maestro's Ocean Club to anyone for any occasion or just a regular day.

RESOLUTION CAME TO AN END - Out of respect for the restaurant and reputation (prior to being sold) I was hoping to update my review to something more positive however unfortunately I'm not able!  The ambience hasn't changed, it's an AWESOME hot spot and I'd give it 5 Stars IF after they would have simply demonstrated good management skills by at least talking to me.  2 of our 4 party ordered the same dinner and both had the same issue for which we sincerely attempted to get the GM to know, affording him the opportunity to do something, anything - but instead in spite of him telling me he'd call me back in a day or two ( he wanted to discuss it with his chef), he never did.  A week later I called again and had to leave a message.  Oddly enough someone from the establishment reached out after seeing my pre-review "PENDING RESOLUTION" on Yelp and asked for details; I provided them and told her I had already spoken to the GM.  She too said she'd get back to be - I never heard back from her either.  So, in light  of this disappointing resolution, I would say........
GO, have fun, you'll love it.  It's not inexpensive and that's totally fine when it meets the minimum quality expectations.  I believe  they're still in a transition so I'm confident I'll be back - have dined here many times and always been pleased.

Before heading out for a night of partying at XS, my buddy and I found ourselves wandering around the Cosmopolitan looking for a good restaurant to try.  While the rest of our friends were grabbing dinner at the literal hole-in-the-wall pizza counter upstairs, we wanted to take advantage of the opportunity of trying something a little more unique.  Well, that is, assuming we could find somewhere that didn't have a crowd; each of our first few tries were met with wait times of 45 mins or longer.  Hoping for better luck at the mall at City Center next door, we eventually worked our way over to Mastro's Ocean Club to check things out there.  Greeted by a friendly hostess and the opportunity for immediate seating, our search came to an end.  Score for table seating by the bar!

For a while now, I've heard a number of good things about Mastro's from friends in LA.  From the service to the food, they've all mentioned how great their experiences were.  At the end of my meal, I could certainly see what they mean.  After perusing through the menu of seafood and steaks, I ended up going with the grilled Chilean Sea Bass with a side order of the Garlic Mashed Potatoes for my friend and I to split (rather, I wanted it for myself, but needed to "share" it to justify getting it).  Now, I know...ordering a fish dish on my first ever trip to Mastro's is pretty counter-intuitive considering their reputation as a steakhouse.  However, given that it's one of their two Ocean Club spots, I figured that maybe I should give the seafood a shot since I don't know if it'll be as readily offered at their pure steakhouse spots.

When our orders were brought to our table, I have to admit that it wasn't stunning at first glance.  Although the cut was larger than I had anticipated (which is never a bad thing), there wasn't much in terms of frills and dressing.  Since everything is a la carte, you literally get just the fish on the plate, with half a lemon on the side of seasoning.  Despite how lonely it may have looked though, there's no questioning the quality.  Although Chilean sea bass is generally more forgiving when it comes to cooking because of its fatty nature, this one was done perfectly regardless.  The meat was soft and tender, and it was moist throughout.  Flavor-wise, you couldn't ask for much more - modest seasoning to it, with a great buttery and velvety sort of flavor from the fish.  Excellent.

As for our sides, the Garlic Mashed was pretty good.  I liked the consistency (thick, but not gloppy or too thin), and the flavor wasn't too potent.  While I would generally prefer a stronger punch to it, it worked well to not overpower the sea bass.  In addition, my friend also slipped in an order of the skinny fries, and let me tell you - a "basket" of fries here really is a basket of fries.  The order was this huge mound of fried potato goodness, and even after chipping away at it throughout our meal, there was still plenty left for our other friend to snack on when he joined us.  Oh, and I can't forget to mention their bread basket either - all served hot and soft with salted butter.  All of the ones I tried were good, but my favorite was the toast-like bread with cheese...so good.

As for the rest of the experience, everything else was spot on.  Our server Sarah was awesome - really attentive, friendly, and pretty damn cute.  Now, I'm sure that last part MIGHT have had something to do with it, but seriously, really cute.  While it's kind of odd that it's located in a mall, I really liked the vibe of the place.  The main dining area is on a sort of a semi-open balcony (check out the pictures...quite a distinctive look), while they have a piano and singer by the bar.  While the music can make conversations a little tough, it's no worse than if you were sitting with a large group.
 
While I do somewhat regret not having ordered beef instead of fish, I have no complaints about what I had either (plus, was still under that damn zero/reduced beef pledge).  That said, I know I'll be back to try more of their menu anyways (saw several tables with the seafood tower), as well as to get a table in their "tree house" section.  Great ambiance for a date as well, and while not a cheap meal, it's certainly worth the price.  But then, that could just be my waitress-induced bias doing the talking too..

**This review is for the bar area only**

I've heard many great things about this restaurant, and after reading other Yelp reviews I decided what better time to try this place out than my birthday? And what better way than sitting at the bar, and partaking of some artistically created adult beverages?

For starters this place is located smack in the middle of the Crystals Mall, you can't miss it. It's the big wooden orb shaped thing that seams to be floating in the center of all the action. It's pretty neat, but as other reviews mentioned, I'm not sure I'd want to spend $200+ on a dinner with a mall atmosphere. None the less it's quite a unique experience and they did a great job (at least in the bar area) of making sure their music drowned out most of the mall sounds.

I knew the drinks here would be pricey so I was prepared for it, but for others it may be a shocker. They have an extensive list of specialty drinks starting at $16, but most are $18. I was told their in-house specialty was a lemon drop which came over dry ice, I didn't actually try it though. I did try the Chocolate Martini ($18)- which won me over because of the giant chocolate covered strawberry on the side of the glass. It truly was dessert in a martini glass! Other views were correct, when you order a martini they give you the shaker along with your drink so you can refill your glass, it's almost like 2 drinks in 1. I also tried the Banana Foster ($18), it was delicious but not what I expected. It has whipped cream, I expected it on top but it was shaken inside and gave the drink a bit of a lumpy texture.

The bf tried the Mastro's Mojito (also $18) and it honestly was not very good, it  came served in a tall glass so there was no shaker on the side. I wouldn't recommend ordering this one. His mom tried the Dragon Fire ($18), which as very tasty, but yes it was hot/spicy - not something to quench your thirst. She rounded off her evening with the Flur de Blu ($18), one I was considering as well. She liked it, but after I tried it I was glad I went with the dessert-style drinks instead.

The service was good. The bar wasn't busy so we had as much attention as we wanted. We were able to watch them make our drinks and that was a fun part of the experience. We saw all kinds of great food coming out of the kitchen so we asked for a food menu, we elected not to order anything since we'd already been there a while and run up a tab of $100. However one bar tender offered to bring us a bread basket. The bread was great and the basket came with several different types of bread, and super soft butter. Note to self for next time: ask for the bread basket when you arrive, it's free.

I think I'll drop in some time again, when I'm in the mood for a dessert martini and can afford the $18 drinks.

Every single time we go to Las Vegas, we make sure to make reservation with Mastro's right after hotel reservation... I love to eat at bird cage... Service is EXCELLENT!!!  They do everything possible to make me feel welcome all the time.

Mastros always has a special place in my heart, I can't come to Vegas without making a stop here for dinner one night. 

The service is always great along with the food. I always get the following:

Burrata salad
Bone in filet
Grilled asparagus 
Scalloped potatoes
Moscow mule

I've also tried the Truffle gnocchi (on the salty side just FYI)

You can't leave here without having their amazing buttercake! It's the great ending to the meal.

Ahhhh feel the privilege! This where the geriatrics go to feel socially accepted. Be aware, you will most likely run into Raven, she's everywhere the 50+ crowd congregates. 

The old piano and singer duo covers such modern day hits as Sublime and anything that was popular at least 10 years ago.

My $15 salad was in reality about $3 worth of food. I guess they need to pay for the elaborate bread bowl you can gorge yourself on prior. 

The bowtie man is very aggressive at identifying plates as to fulfill his life's mission of collecting dirty plates and continues hovering over my table as I attempt to enjoy my meal.

The upside is well there is none but hey you spent the day screwing over the American people in some form or fashion why not take a write off and bring joe from the office to have dinner with the family? You can afford to throw away $75 on a cheap corn fed steak disguised as quality meat, because you're rich, so who cares? Let loose and partay like it's 1944!

Great food!! 
Love their lobster mashed potatoes. Great service and very friendly. Unfortunately, our check took forevaaaa to come! LOL. Other than that, def would recommend.  

Can be a quite busy so make sure to plan for your reservation.

Anniversary dinner was fabulous! I forgot to take pictures:( bc food was so delicious!! Started off with Calamari for appetizer, comes with a sweet and sour sauce. I ordered the Chilean Sea bass, lobsters mashed potatoes- to die for! Servers were very attentive and friendly. Our bill was pretty high but th e manager was kind enough to waive our anniversary dessert,  choc cake, fresh raspberries & homemade whipped cream.

Located in the Crystals at City Center, you can't miss this place as part of it sits in something that's supposed to be a sculpture called "the tree".  The sculpture itself is lost on most.  At any rate, my girl and I were in to celebrate a special occasion and Mastro's just happened to fit the bill for what we were looking for.

We started with Oysters on the half shell along with a Lobster Bisque.  The oysters were a good size, not too briny and of the east coast variety.  The Lobster Bisque was excellent.  Chunks of lobster and the soup itself was neither watery nor too thick but with proper consistency and the temperature just perfect.  Main courses consisted of Chilean Sea Bass for her and the Scottish Salmon Filet.  I put my trust in the chef and opted to be surprised in the preparation of my salmon, and I was not disappointed as everything was prepared exactly as requested.  Sides to accompany the entrees were the Lobster Mashed Potatoes and some sauteed Asparagus.  Drinks to accompany the meal was a nice Sauvignon Blanc (the name escapes me) which went with everything as per recommended by our server.

Service-wise:  very attentive.  Our server ran through all of the specials for the night and answered any questions we may have had including selecting the wine to go with our entire meal start to finish on top of being entertaining.  If a course was complete, someone was present to take the item away.  Our glasses were never empty and staff (including the manager) made it a point to be sure that our needs were met and that everything was fine.  Bonus points for giving us a table right along the edge inside of the "tree" sculpture.  

Word of warning:  portions are quite generous so either be prepared to share or come hungry.  

In short:  Top-notch service, good food, quality that pairs equally with the price.  You will not be disappointed.

I LOVE Mastro's in Beverly Hills so I did not expect this one to meet the same high standard but boy was I wrong!  The service here was excellent!  We had a large party and they accommodated us with ease and the food was delectable!  Definitely one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas now.

The ambiance was pretty rad. It's not you're usual dimly lit steakhouse. It's right in the middle of Crystal and very bright. I liked the modern decor and the live music was a nice touch. The service was great. The bathroom attendant made me feel like I was a a club. 

My bone-in filet (12ox) was tasty, but I personally miss the crisp edges and extra butter on the Ruth Chris' steak. The Mastro side dishes though, definitely beat Ruth Chris'. I loved the Truffled Gnocchi, Lobster Mash Potatoes, Sweet Potato Fries, and Oysters Rockefeller. 

My highlight of the night was the butter cake! Yummy!

Well, I did a poor job of keeping up with the reviews to become Elite but hey Yelp gave it to me anyways since Im so hilarious. So, I'm back!

Mastros is one of the few steakhouse chains that I would say can compete with the best steakhouses around. Ive been to a few in California and all are great. The one in Vegas keeps the tradition alive and well. Crystals is a swanky shopping area in the Strip so this is definitely a place you'd expect to drop some serious coin. And this is Vegas so if you aren't planning on it then you can leave.

Chopped Salad- well it was salady. Standard dish and easy to split.

Bone in Filet 12 oz- Probably the best filet I've had in Vegas. Cooked perfect medium rare.

Lobster Mash- obvi delicious but probably an unnecessary 30 dollar side.

Roasted Brussel sprouts- Idk how they cooked these but they were the best brussel sprouts Ive had period. Even my father who hates them couldn't deny that they were great.

Warm Butter Cake- Ah yes the buttery goodness. One of my favorite desserts whenever it's on a menu no matter the restaurant. Mastro's does it right.

The reason Mastro's is legit is that it keeps the traditional steakhouse vibe of olden times and perfects it. None of menu items are crazy out there or artistic concoctions like at GR Steak but the quality of the food is not debatable. There is no chain steakhouse as good as Mastro's let me tell you.

Honestly - one of the best new York strips I've had... just amazing.

Martinis are easily 3 drinks and well worth the $19 price tag.

The best meal I've ever had in Vegas.

My friend and I were looking for a simple sushi restaurant near our hotel, Aria but the one inside the hotel was booked.  So we walked over to the next building and finally decided on Mastro's since I loved the one in Beverly Hills.  

It didn't disappoint..the service was A+..our waitress kept a close eye on us to refill any drinks and was very knowledgable about the menu.  The Maine lobster was exquisite and the asparagus crisp and seasoned.  My poor friend ordered sushi which she didn't like because there was chocolate in the sauce.  Chocolate?!?  The lemon drop martini was awesome.  It came to the table smoking and kept on smoking for awhile. . We shared a delicious dessert.  $250 dinner for two..well worth it.

Ambiance was superb in the treehouse..
Service was respectful, reliable and solid..
Food was delish..

Who eats seafood in Arizona?!? 
Well,... i did. Last week, and it was excellent. Great atmosphere, although to me it felt more like a date night kinda atmosphere. I was there with some colleagues from work. The ambiance and service was super. Those in our party who tried the steak said it was very good (the steaks were brought out on searing hot plates). Definitely expensive.

This was out second trip to a Mastros steakhouse and it would be hard to top the experience in Scottsdale. The food was excellent and the service was attentive and friendly. The waiter had just a little trouble pouring the wine, but other than that he did an outstanding job and was very efficient. I prefer a darker feel to a steakhouse and with the Ocean club being in the mall that was hard to achieve. Overall I would definitely go again. Bone in rib eye was a little undercooked but excellent. And the butter cake dessert off the hook good.

Who wouldn't love a restaurant that's positioned right next to Tiffany's??  Seriously.......

I went for a company dinner so cannot attest to the price (although based on other Yelpers, the cost is quite steep!)  Started with a lovely bread basket with a wide variety of different breads, including "pretzel bread" which is quite similar to Joe's Stone Crab bread.  The bruschetta appetizer came next which was VERY oniony, but it's a good thing I'm a big fan of onions because I absolutely loved it.  Caesar salad was just so-so.

Then the main course....I got the mahi mahi in this fancy butter sauce which was excellent, but not as good as my husband's salmon (I almost stole his plate it WAS THAT GOOD).  The fish portions were very large and filling.  Sides for the table included creamy mashed potatoes and creamed spinach.  The spinach was a little salty for my taste, but not grainy at all.

Dessert was cheesecake with whipped cream and berries which was creamy and decadent...A+ even though I was completely full I ate the whole thing.

Would I return to Mastros?  Absolutely.  Wonderful ambience and GREAT salmon.....after all it is an "ocean club" so the fish has to be good right?  Cheers!
One of my favorite places in Vegas.  Great seafood.  Make sure to get the Seafood tower

Out in Las Vegas for a week and this restaurant is my new favorite on the strip. We were late for our reservation and the hostess was very nice and very accomadating. The fish and seafood were some of the best I have had. I have seen on the food network how the desert flies in the best seafood, but this restaurant really proved it. to top it off the restaurant called the next day and made sure everything was great. 5 stars for this place and can't wait to go back.

Definitely one of the best meals I have had in a long time.  Everything at Mastro's is great-- from the service to the ambiance to the food, the whole evening was really enjoyable.  

I don't even usually like shrimp cocktail, but it is really exceptional at Mastro's.  The jumbo shrimp is delicious and the over the top "smoking" presentation is pretty amazing.  

The steak is obviously great, but I could have eaten just sides all night.  The creamed spinach, mashed potatoes, and roasted Brussels sprouts were all delicious.

Since I was there with a big group we also sampled several desserts.  I know a steak meal can be filling, but try to save room.  Highlights included the chocolate pudding cake and the key lime pie.

A great restaurant for a special occasion.

We enjoyed our first visit to Mastro's on New Year's Eve....and had the most fabulous fine dining experience! The food and drinks were fantastic, the atmosphere wonderful and our server Sam (Samantha) was absolutely made our dining experience one to remember....in fact, we went back just this past weekend for my husband's birthday....and Sam greeted us, welcomed us back although she wasn't our server, she was checking that our dining experience was good. Nice touch, for a server to remember a couple in the midst of the hundreds that she assists (that's attention to detail if you ask me). 

Our first visit we enjoyed their delicious bread basket (pretzel bread my fav), Lobster Bisque (dare I say, the best ever tasted...and that's coming from someone that grew up in Monterey with some of the best seafood anywhere), lamb (again, the best ever tasted), filet, sautéed green beans....and topped off with their signature warm butter cake! And can't forget the smoothest and delicious Lemon Drop cocktail....love the dry ice effect! 

We had another fabulous dining experience that evening for my husband's birthday just this past weekend with Craig as our server. This time we started we took it lighter and slower to enjoy.....starting with their spinach salad and decided to split the 22oz Ribeye that I had read about and recommended...they kindly split it up on 2 separate plates for us (without us asking), sautéed asparagus.....and was topped off with a birthday crème brulee (my hubby's fav dessert)....I wasn't much of a brulee fan....until I tried theirs....smooth, creamy, delicious vanilla bean custard!

We won't miss a visit on our future Vegas visits...even if just to sit at the bar for appetizers, bisque, drinks and dessert!

LOVE Mastros!  Dinner was perfect - atmosphere even better!  The tree house is so fun and innovative!  The piano bar was a great way to start our dinner.  The singer was perfect!  Our cocktail waitress was too cute for words and made the night even better!

The food at Mastros speaks for itself!  Among our favorites:
*Filet - I like the petite my husband the bone in
*Creamed Corn - a MUST
*Potatoes - all of them are good - if I could I would do one of each :)

All in all - GREAT doesn't even begin to say how much we love Mastros!  A must for everyone!

Mastro's is AMAZING! Every single thing I have tried at this restaurant is DELICIOUS. Their dining room is very unique yet has a classy fine dining feel to it. My favorite tables are located within the "tree house" because who doesn't want to be in a tree house? =)

I've been there a bunch of times and below are some of my favorite food items:
- Alaskan King Crab Legs - (Available by the pound) Comes out warm and ready to eat with the shells already cracked open. They serve it with melted butter but I prefer their cocktail sauce instead.
- Cocktail Sauce - Yes, I put this in it's own category LOL. It's AMAZING. This is the best cocktail sauce I have ever had. It has the perfect amount of kick.
- Shrimp Cocktail - huge, plump, and delicious! One order includes 3 shrimps. It comes out in an entertaining presentation because of the dry ice below the bed of ice.
- Dungeness Crab Cocktail - This is probably the best value for the seafood tower appetizers. You get a bunch of crab meat with a few different sauces: cocktail (again, its the best!), Mastro's mustard, and extra horse radish (super strong). 
- Bone-In Rib Eye - They seem to cook a little more on the rare side. Possibly because the plate comes out at 400 degrees. (Be careful!) The meat tastes fabulous alone but they do offer Bearnaise and Peppercorn sauce as an option.
- Sea Scallops - Perfectly cooked and savory (Appetizer portion has 3, Entree portion has 5.)
- Signature Warm Butter Cake - THIS IS THE BEST DESSERT EVER!!!! Warm butter cake topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and served with a huge side of whipped cream. It is quite large and well worth the price! Serves 3-4 people easily. 

The service is genuine and attentive. If you put any notes in your reservation such as a special celebration, they pay close attention to it. It was so nice to not worry about telling the server it was my boyfriend's birthday.

I know I listed a bunch of my favorites, but if you could take away anything from this review, TRY THE BUTTER CAKE! =)

Drooling to return!!!

Wow...wow...and I mean wow! Far beyond any expectations! Since we were here for a birthday celebration we decided to go all out and order close to everything -can't finish? no prob, mini fridge in hotel room was waiting :) ...and every single dish was pure perfection. The lobster mash was humongous and delish with lots of lobster pieces, meats were tender, fish buttery, service sublime (checked on us without disturbing & smiled when serving), ended with desert to die for. DO NOT skip the warm butter cake, unless you're diabetic or out of your mind. 

A rare find of friendly attentive service and food that's worth every dollar! Bravo! I'll be sending everyone I know. Seriously can't wait to return!

ps,
You can't miss this place. Swing by if only for a peak at the unusual design. Center of the Crystals shopping center in a spiral treehouse looking architecture.

I love Mastro's!  We went for our first anniversary dinner after having gone on our honeymoon last year. The food was so amazing we had to come back.  We were greeted at our table with 2 glasses of champagne to celebrate. We spilt the most delicious wedge salad and it was good. Last year we had apps and the lobster mashed potatoes as a side. Those were so good they'll make you wanna slap your momma!  We were so full I am embarrassed to say we didn't even finish our steaks. This year we switched to Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese...epic!  I had the bone-in ribeye and my wife ordered the 12oz filet mignon.  Both were the finest steaks we've ever had. You will never appreciate any other steak after that. Mastros ruined steak for me, talk about melt in your mouth. Our server Mark was phenomenal and super attentive. A really nice guy. For desert they brought out the warm butter cake...wonderful!  Mastros is the only place I would eat in my life if I had the choice. Thank you  for a wonderful first anniversary dinner. GO THERE!!!!

My hubby and I celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary here with my daughter and parents. We started off with Mastro's Seafood Tower. You can create your own seafood tower to your liking and size. Our seafood tower had shrimp, snow crab claws and oysters. We all enjoyed especially my daughter; the cool dry ice effect and seafood tower presentation. The seafood was fresh and the oysters tasted amazing. My hubby had the lemon sole, my mom had the Chilean sea bass, my Dad had the herb roasted chicken, I had sauteed sea scallops and my daughter got to sample a little bit of everything. We shared two sides family style of their signature lobster mashed potatoes (love this combo) and the other side dish of roasted brussels sprouts. The seafood and chicken entrees and sides were served hot, fresh and perfectly seasoned. At the end, they complimentary served us their yummy signature warm butter cake dessert with vanilla ice cream and added Happy Anniversary wish which was a nice added personal touch. We had a wonderful time and food experience on our first visit here, and the service was friendly and excellent.

I've been here a few times to celebrate special occasions and loved it. From the Main lobster tail that's always so juicy to the steaks, I've tried a few but recently my husband got the tomahawk steak, they cut like butter and is always cooked to perfection. The lobster mash potatoes are phenomenal not to mention the world famous butter cake. This location is a little bit brighter and more of an open space. I've been to one other location that had more of an dark intimate feel.

One of my all-time favorite restaurants! If you have never tried the lobster mashed potatoes, you are missing out! Other items I would recommend are the shrimp cocktail, ahi tuna, and the cosmopolitan which is served with dry ice giving it an appealing presentation. The service here is the best and the food is amazing! I wish we had one of these in the 405, but until then, I will hit them up whenever I'm in Vegas or DC. If you visit the Vegas location, it is located in the Crystal Mall in its very own treehouse, which is very unique. There's no other place like it!

1.) The wait staff was inattentive. 
2.) Sommelier (via waitress) brought out the wrong bottle of wine.
3.) Lamb was medium well when asked for medium rare.
4.) Swordfish was raw and under seasoned.

Front and back of the house need help.

We've been here several times and we were disappointed this week. Our heirloom tomatoes are soft and near rotten. The grouper had an ammonia taste to it. My grilled salmon was very bland. The best item was the dessert butter cake and whip cream. To summarize, disappointed and expensive.

We couldn't make our initial reservation and was disappointed but when we checked in to the Aria and noticed it was located in the Crystal shops, we decided to have a late dinner after shopping. 

The ambiance was unique, in a good way. Our server Daniel gave us exceptional service - he was very attentive and accommodating. We ordered the Rack of Lamb, Scallops and the Gorgonzola Mac n Cheese! Everything was cooked to perfection and well seasoned aka tasty. 

We were not disappointed and happy we were able to experience Mastro's Ocean Club before leaving Vegas.

Oh my gosh, this was the best and most indulgent meal I have ever had in my life!  My husband and I had the seafood tower appy, a bottle of fabulous wine, and split the Wagyu beef and a HUMONGOUS lobster.  Everything was completely amazing.  The cost of the meal made my heart stop for a few minutes ($750 with tip)...but it was a once-in-a-lifetime kind of thing.  Bucket list stuff.

We really enjoy dropping in to Mastro's Ocean Club for a drink or a nice meal at the bar. Charelle is great. She will take care of you guys for sure. Mastro's is located inside Crystals mall in the City Center. We were there on a Sunday night and just had the most pleasant time. 

We had just an appetizer with our drinks. We got the calamari. It was good. It was all calamari rings in a seasoned breading. Delicious... You can never go wrong with calamari and theirs is one of the better ones. We also had the famous signature warm butter cake. DAMN... That really is a delicious dessert. It is like the most perfect butter pound cake topped with a tasty vanilla ice cream, surrounded with strawberry & baby orange slices and drizzled with strawberry sauce. It's so good. It's so rich but worth it if you share it. The bottom of the butter cake has a caramelized crust so when you get to that bite, you're in for a flavor kick. So good. You have to get it... I'm glad we finally tried it. 

Service at the bar was exceptional. Charelle, the bartender, made a perfect dirty ketel martini and was such a pleasant person to conversate with. Mastro's is lucky to have her. We enjoyed our time at the bar with her and appreciated her suggestions & customer service. Make sure you look for her. Thank you Mastro's Ocean Club and Charelle! We'll  be back soon... In a few weeks, in fact!

So, I think I just found my new favorite seafood place, and its only 10 minutes from work. SCORE.
Lobster mashed potatoes, Lobster mashed potatoes, Lobster mashed potatoes. The best thing you can order, I swear. You have to order this if you are a fan of mashed potatoes.
 If you like a little spice.. the jalepeno tuna sashimi. Its the highest quality fish I've had and its got a mild spice to it. delicious. 

They also have a great wine list. 
I loved the live music and the song choices are amazing. Oh, third eye blind, john mayer, and dave matthews band? I think I'm in love.

Staying at the Aria and a small group of us went to Mastros for dinner. No reservation so sat at high top in bar area. I had the griller red snapper which was well prepared. A couple split a filet and other had chop salad and all said great. The cocktails were friendly and plentiful with quick service. I split Mac and cheese with a buddy but we only ate half despite great flavor. A little expensive but would definately do again.

Unfortunately the hostess was very rude when I tried to make a reservation.  Her name is Bianca.  She said we could only make our reservation at 5:30pm or 8 pm.  If we chose the 5:30pm time we would have to leave by 7:45pm and that she would make a note to the server that we would leave by 7:45pm.  
We have dined here numerous times, spending $275 on average for 2 people.  I don't want to be on time constraints when enjoying a night out for dinner.  You just lost a loyal customer Ocean Club!

I am a mastro fan and I have been to a few different ones. Pros for this particular place: staff is extremely friendly (some other places like LA they were stiff and kinda annoying), food is delicious (the butter cake is a must), spacious. The only con is that it's in a mall setting which was a little weird. But I still enjoyed the meal and I am looking forward to the next meal here.
Amazing food, drinks, service, and atmosphere.  Make sure to get the lobster mashed potatoes and request to sit in the "tree house"!

Stellar experience. 
Hideously expensive but expected on the strip. 
Huge selection of wines
Amazing food. 
   - good bread
   - first rate seafood
   - delicious steaks
   - fabulous sides
   - decadent desserts
First class service. 

As long as I am not footing the bill, I would return here anytime.   Las Vegas Strip signature restaurants are known as much for the huge price tag as well as quality food/service.

I searched, for the perfect Vegas restaurant, for our anniversary dinner, by checking the internet, asking friends, and tallying #YELP, Open Table, and Trip Advisor scored. I started with a long list and ended up, with Mastro's. And, it was the perfect setting, to celebrate our anniversary. 
We travelled all morning. Checked in our hotel and walked all over the strip, during the day. So, we were a little tired, by dinner, but were up, for celebrating, with delicious food and wine.  
We had a table, in the "treehouse".
We ordered a bottle of The Prisoner wine, because we were splurging. It was delicious, and went well with our meal.
The bread basket they brought out was this bread lovers dream; huge, wide assortment of yummy goodness, with butter. 
We had the crab cake appetizer. The crab cakes were very large, and scrumptious, with not much filling, just lots of crabmeat. 
The Lobster Bisque was very nice. 
We shared Blackened Scotch Salmon, which was delicious, but thankfully, not huge, cut in half. The lobster Mac 'n Cheese side is sinful. 
They brought us a complimentary dessert, for our anniversary. We were able to squeeze in a few bites. 
The service was as you would expect, in a higher end, very nice restaurant. Our waiter and all the staff were courteous and helpful. 
Without the $100 bottle of wine, the meal was still pricey, but it was worth it. This is a great place to celebrate something/anything!
HIgh quality up market steak house. I like the location in Vegas you are seated in this amazing hardwood balcony/nest in the middle of an expensive mall. Great service and great food.

22oz Ribeye is outstanding!
Warm butter cake is the perfect desert!

Great service! Went for my brothers 26th birthday, there was consistent service and great quality food. The petite filet was cooked medium rare plus and it went perfect with the creamed, macaroni and cheese and two bottles of wine. The butter cake was a perfect ending to our mouth watering meal. My family and I will definitely be returning again

By far the ugliest mastros I've ever been to. Honestly the restaurant was just sad. Went there for my bday dinner and I was very underwhelmed. It's located inside the crystal shopping center. Literally looks like the Starbucks located across from the restaurant. The food was not great. The service was ok and the drinks were filled with cheap vodka. It was basically eating at sizzer

Another bookmark that took us a while to check off, Mastro's Ocean Club is located at the Crystals Shops.  We celebrated Valentine's Day two days early to avoid all the crowds on the actual day.  We arrived at the appointed reservation time and were seated promptly in the "birds' nest" area of the restaurant.  All I've heard from friends about Mastro's centers around the Signature Warm Butter Cake dessert and we did have that, but first, dinner.  After perusing the menu and hearing the options available, I settled on surf and turf with the petite filet mignon (6 oz.) Oscar-style with crab meat and Bearnaise sauce.  According to our waiter, the meat of two large crab legs comes with the filet and when it was served, this did actually seem to be the case.  The dish was just the perfect size for me, plus we shared a large twice-baked potato.  Service throughout our meal was attentive, but not cloyingly so:  our glasses were never empty for long.  Oh, I forgot to mention the bread basket that came to the table first:  a carb lover's dream! We counted three different kinds of bread:  pretzel bread, garlic bread, and sourdough with the pretzel bread being my definite favorite.  
As I mentioned, we finally got to try the famous butter cake served with a big scoop of vanilla ice cream and whipped cream on the side:  heavenly!  
Mastro's is definitely a wonderful choice for a special occasion when you want to spoil yourselves.
Sea bass is a must! The fillet mignon is superb too. Unfortunately, my warm butter cake was way too hard and dry. Even the ice cream didn't help the dryness.

We live in LV, and eat all the time at the high end strip restaurants.  This is probably the easiest 5 star rating I have ever given.  Everything was fantastic, and I went in with very high expectations.  A friend recommended, and said it was one of the best steaks in LV.  I was not disappointed. Steak had terrific flavor, and melted in your mouth.  Drinks, appetizers, main courses, sides, and desserts - all were simply fantastic.  We also loved the atmosphere, and our waiter was excellent.  We will certainly return.

There's really nothing negative to say about this place. The petite filet was amazing, it was cooked to perfection. The sides were delicious. We had the cream of corn, sauteed spinach, mac & cheese and mushrooms. Service was great and the atmosphere was lovely. 

I'm just disappointed I wasn't able to try everything on the menu but the next time I'm in Vegas, I will definitely return.

A solid 4 stars. First timer here. Regular at City Hall so a gal pal of mine wanted to do ocean club, why the hell not? Needed to try it. 

Neither her or I do seafood but steaks all the way. 

Got the 8oz filet, medium. It came out pretty rare but luckily the plate is hotter than an oven so I cut it open all over and pushed it around the plate. Became perfect. 

Got a 4 stars cuz the filet had some grizzle on it and the buttercake seemed like it was sitting out for a bit, not hot like usual. 

Still a very good meal but ill stick to city hall

So painful to give Mastro's a 3 star rating. I live in AZ and we have three separate mastros that are all great - eat there all the time. 

We were in town for the weekend and we came here with a party of 4. I always get my filet medium at mastros and it usually comes out at about medium rare to medium because of the plate being hotter than the oven. I got my 8oz filet and about 1/3 was a little too cooked. The meat was great but unfortunately a little over cooked. 

Now is the time for BUTTERCAKE. If you look back at my reviews of all the Mastros around the country, I highlight the buttercake every time. Greatest dessert ever. Our other guests never had it, so of course I was hyping it up big time. Our first buttercake was very burnt - inside was completely hard and 2/3s was not edible at all. So we waved down our waiter and he runs back to get another. Second one comes out and unfortunately its the same burntness. By that time, we were over it and just said take it back and take it off our bill. Very disappointed in this - first time ever this has ever happened.

I thought this place was pretty cool.  Very, very nice and classy inside.  However,  service left something to be desired and it smelled like fish.  There were three of us at the bar and the waitress charged me for my friend's tab- which was about 50 dollars more than mine.  Still waiting for the bank to sort it out.  We had to wait a long time to get drinks.  I did like the band.  Apparently they play Wed-Sat, or maybe to Sunday.  Not sure.  But they were good.  Next time I will just get my own drinks at the bar and pay in cash.

This is my hubby and my favorite restaurant. We happen to live part time in Scottsdale and travel extensively and it's still or fav. Our only complaint is why did they move the high top tables and chairs so close to the bar a couple of months ago? Typically if we don't get there soon enough to find a seat at the bar we will politely wait for 2 seats to open up. They lack of space behind the bar stools makes it virtually impossible to wait in this area. Very awkward and uncomfortable now.

We are Loyal Mastro's customers and visit the SoCal locations often, so we were pretty devastated after tonight's experience. Never have we felt so terrible paying the bill. 

He ordered the bone-in ribeye and I ordered the "Chilean sea bass," which our waitress said was their most popular fish dish. The ribeye was great, flavorful, and juicy. Pretty in line with the quality of steak we've had in the past. 

The sea bass, however, was an entirely different story. I am 99% sure we were served the wrong dish. I've had Chilean sea bass countless times, and my fish tasted nothing like it. The shape was long and narrow. The texture was extremely dry and almost chalky. I ordered it with the parm crust and literally the only thing that gave it flavor was the lemon I squeezed on it. The fish was extremely bland and it was actually hard to eat. I should have sent it back but didn't want to be that person. I'm not a picky eater, so this was particularly bad.

Even the bread didn't taste as piping hot and magical as the bread we're used to. 

The service was fine though. 

Absolutely the saddest dining experience during our Vegas trip ever.

In short, our meal was absolutely phenomenal-- perhaps one of the best we've ever had in Vegas. With every element of the meal nearly flawless, I could not keep marveling over each little detail of our experience. Yelp here has Mastro's at a 4.5+ average on 250+ reviews..this is no fluke! 
We came here for my mom's birthday dinner and my expectations were MORE than exceeded.

We were promptly seated for our 9:30 reservation within the "Tree House," as the hostess called it; it had a very loft feel to it yet was very quaint had a warm, welcoming atmosphere. I'll definitely ask to be sat in this area again. 
As we passed by the bar area, we were greeted by spectacular live music, consisting of a woman singing accompanied by a fantastic piano player (who also added in some vocals). Big plus for this. 
After immediately seating us, the hostess hurried to bring us black napkins to avoid the lint of white napkins attaching itself to our dark clothing. We didn't even ask. Nice touch. 

Rob, our waiter, and the rest of the waitstaff that took care of our table were nothing but spectacular. I was a bit worried at first as my water glass remained empty for a good 15 minutes, but this was the sole flaw of the entire evening (and a minor one at that). Rob was extremely congenial, professional, yet very personable and extremely accommodating of our wishes. 

We like to split things a lot when we go out to dinner so that we get our own little smorgasbord of items to try...and a smorgasbord we got! Not only this, but the chefs made sure to split nearly everything that came to the table (even the bone-in steak we ordered!) Now, where do I even begin...

--Vanilla Battered Shrimp: Caution: Oxymoron... MASSIVE shrimp. The biggest shrimp I've seen in recent memory. The batter wasn't really too vanilla-tasting in my opinion, but this was a delicious starter regardless. Three to an order! 

--Burrata & Heirloom Tomato Salad: Mmm, burrata cheese is one of my favorites! Yes, this was a typical salad, but the tomatoes were so fresh and the balsamic reduction was so tasty. We asked for a little bit more of this said reduction and they brought out an entire cup of it..whoops.

--Clam Chowder: Hands down the best I've ever had. Not overly thick and creamy, yet perfect proportions of ingredients. Piping hot when it arrived which I really appreciate with soups. 

--Mac & Cheese: Ugh my mouth just waters at the thought of this. Served in a skillet, the mac and cheese was perfect consistency: it wasn't drowning in sauce but it wasn't just a bowl of plain noodles with an ounce of cheese mixed in...perfect proportions (once again). On top was a layer of melted cheese that was just fantastic...I think that there were four cheeses or so just in this topper! 

--Bone-in Filet Mignon: I really don't like throwing out the "best I've ever had" card very often. Because, honestly, how many things can take that title? Well, this definitely takes the "best filet I've ever had" title. Join the club, clam chowder. It had the taste of a NY Strip, but was tender as a filet should be. And, to top it off, it is served on a 400 degree hot plate. I like my steak kept hot and this obviously got the job done. 

--Warm Butter Cake: Okay, now this piece of heaven really takes the cake (ha, horrible pun intended). My mom and sister are suckers for butter cake (who isn't..?) and we figured what better time to order it than for a birthday? Out comes this large, circular cake and a BEHEMOTH side of whipped cream. Really. View my picture to see how much there was. Think of a frozen skillet just bombarded with thick, heavy whipped cream. Fantastic dessert. And what's even better? Rob comped this $16 dessert with the simple message of "happy birthday, we're so happy you came in to dine with us tonight." Winnnnnnn.


From now on, every time I'm asked for a restaurant recommendation, Mastro's will be the first word to escape my mouth. I cannot wait to go there again next time I've got a few bucks to blow.
The meal I had was pretty good but it definitely wasn't mind blowing. I had the Pacific Swordfish cook perfectly but the taste wasn't making my tastebuds swoon.

The place is really cool.  Although it opens up to an enclosed high end retail, they do an excellent job of making the place very interesting. 

We did that surf and turf for 2 and it was delicious!

This is the kind of over the top dining that I like to treat myself to once in a while. Gorgeous white tablecloth service, servers in white sportscoats, beautiful bar. I wish I could have spent 3 hours drinking my way through the meal and probably will allow myself that much time next visit. 

I had the 12oz bone in filet, it was excellent. Our table ordered the gnocchi & crab as a side dish. Delicious even for $26.  

It's a tiny bit awkward that it's in the middle of a massive shopping mall, for this kind of evening I wish I could just put on a nice dress and heels, take a cab and have a doorman open the restaurant door for me instead of trekking through a gi-normous mall up and down escalators to get there. However they make up for it with a cool bar and outstanding service.

OK experience.  Not likely to go back given all the other options in Vegas.  Surprised at how strong many of the reviews are.  I feel misled by Yelp on this one.

Service was great.  Ambiance not great.  You are in a shopping mall and you will be starting across the mall at retail stores and shoppers.

Food quality was good, but expensive for ambiance.  Good balance of seafood and steak house.

Food:
- special bacon appetizer (delicious)
- crab cocktail (AMAZING!)
- sea scallops (too salty)
- sea bass (great texture, too salty)
- brussel sprouts (too salty)
- butter cake (very strong butter flavor)

In general, I was underwhelmed by this place. Everything was too salty and this butter cake everyone raved about was not my cup of tea. I guess I don't like butter flavor. I'd rather have a chocolate cake or key lime pie. 

Service: top notch as expected. 

Location: inside the mall so the ambiance is not what I'd want for the price paid. Awkward to be staring at a store from your seat. 

So many other high end options available, I'd rather go to a restaurant that is not in the mall.

Unexpectedly great experience. We Spent our day at the pool and worked up quite an appetite. Always wanted to try Mastros but weren't sure if we would be welcome in our casual pool attire. Amazingly enough our server Shauna (not sure what her last name is) treated us as if we were dressed to the nines. We felt very comfortable and had a great meal. The food was excellent especially the escargot and lobster soup. Definitely coming back next time we are in town

Friday night team dinner with my coworkers at Mastro's. We'd been planning for a while but schedules kept getting in the way. I'm glad we finally made reservations and went because wow. Just wow. 

Made our reservation for 5 on OpenTable and when we arrived, we were instantly seated. Our server got us waters while we waited for the rest of our group to arrive, then he went through menu and drinks with us. We ordered drinks and appetizers. While waiting for appetizers, they brought out baskets of bread (the pretzel bread was yummy!). We ordered Shrimp Cocktail and Seared Ahi Tuna for appetizers. I ate some of the tuna, which was amazing.

For main course, we each ordered a meat then a bunch of sides to share. I got the filet mignon. For sides, we got Mac & cheese, black truffle gnocchi, broccoli, asparagus, and mashed potatoes. I couldn't eat the gnocchi, but everything else was flavorful and delicious. Even the veggies had a unique flavor to them! We had leftovers, which we split up (somehow I ended up with a coworker's lamb, which I ate the next day and OH MY GOD I should have ordered lamb...). They bagged everything up for us and then we ordered desserts to share. We got the butter cake, flourless chocolate cake, and one other dessert (I forget!). The butter cake was good, but not my favorite. I loved the chocolate cake, though it was super rich. So yummy.

As far as service, our server was fantastic and attentive. When we first were seated and only ordered waters to start, I think he was a little "eh" that we might not be big spenders (and therefore big tippers...), but as we ordered more and more he seemed to friendly up a bit. He also had an assistant who helped quite a bit and constantly refilled our waters and cleared plates as needed. 

The ambiance is nice, but it is in a mall (though a pretty nice mall). The main seating areas kind of overlook the mall, so it's a bit "meh" but don't let that take away from your experience. The food was great, the service was great... the price was definitely expensive. I'm sure you can eat here without it being as pricey as we made it, but we ordered a LOT of food and drinks. 

Really enjoyed Mastro's. Definitely recommend it!!

This place is amazing!! It offers a wonderful dining atmosphere and the service was professional and polite. I ordered the lobster mashed potatoes, sauteed asparagus, raw oysters, and sea bass, and will definitely be returning.

Gr8 steak and seafood in this elegant and classy restaurant.  The wine list and bar menu are top shelf.  Desserts are other-worldly.  Service and ambience make me want to say "shut up and just take my money."  Just as good as the one in Newport Beach sans the ocean view.
Outstanding seafood and service. Would definitely come back. It's in the Crystals shopping mall.

Mastro's in las Vegas is wonderful.  Ate there for ten year anniversary.  Service is wonderful.  Food is delicious.  Warm butter cake for dessert(on the house for special occasion) will make you jump back flips.  Lobster mash is incredible. Steaks were fab.  Waiter mike r, was great.  Go and enjoy.

Great service. Food was very good. 
Blackened salmon and the Big Eye Tuna were terrific. Brussels sprouts were too large and undercooked. Mac and cheese was very good. Chopped salad as just average. 

Looking for a big Pinot Noir?  Belle Glos from
the Clark & Telephone vineyard will rock your world!

This restaurant put two surprise charges on my bill. My wife and I came here for our 22nd anniversary.  When the meal was over they surprised us with a special anniversary cake. It was beautiful and a nice touch. Then we got the check they charged us $6 for this item, which we didn't order. The other surprise was a $5.88 "surcharge," which a helpful footnote on the receipt explained as: "Due to the rising costs of doing business in this location, including higher wage costs associated with higher minimum wage rates, a 3% surcharge has been added to your total bill."  OK, a total of $11.88 hidden fees on a bill just over $200 doesn't seem like much, but the underhandedness of it shows an inexcusable disrespect for the customer. McDonald's doesn't sneak in a surcharge to cover its minimum wage force--so why would someone charging more than $100 per person? And you're going to "give" us an anniversary cake and then ask us to pay for it without even pointing it out? Disgraceful!

Best restaurant in the entire world! Its a hidden gem because its in a mall and less crowded than restaurants in casinos but dont let the crowd size fool you. Ive been there probably 20 times and ive never had a bad anything. Ive had everything on the menu because we often go to dinner with about 20 people so we order everything. Great wines, really fresh seafood, but the side dishes and desserts is what really sets them apart from others. My fav sides are brussels sprouts, scalloped potatoes, creamed corn, gorgonzola mac n cheese and mushrooms. For desserts nothing is better than the butter cake and pecan pie. If youre not a fan of raspberry sauce like myself you can order the butter cake without the raspberry and its heavenly! Its romantic enough for a date and trendy enough for dinner before going out with friends- like i said best restaurant in the entire world!

First off let'a start out with the fact that we sat in the tree house!!!!! Great atmosphere and impeccable service not a second went by that our table was not being tended to refreshed or checked on to make sure everything was to our standards. From the Siberian caviar, west coast, and east coat oysters to the lobster and plentiful sides. Each bite was flavorful and delectable. The mouth watering lobster hardly needed anything added not even melted butter due to it melting already on your mouth from tenderness. The creamed spinach was packed full of flavor all the way down to the shuttle hint of garlic and don't forget the creamed corn. And you can't end your night without having the butter cake. Let's just say I died and went to heaven with each bite. Mouth watering melting you mouth warm butter cake topped with vanilla iced cream and fresh berries!! Need I even say more. Hands down fully impressed and satisfied.

Landed in Vegas and went on a mad hunt for a place to eat with the boyfriend. Wandered into Aria and found this swanky little place. Went to see if they had any tables open. About a 30 minute wait so we decided to do open seating at the bar. We ordered the mussels for appetizer, scallops for the main dish (for me) and steak for the mr. The mussels and the scallops were a little too salty for me, but the texture of the scallops was cooked perfectly. I also felt like I was eating the same thing with my main dish because the scallops came on slices of bread which was the same type of bread that was served to us for appetizer. The portion was quite generous though. The bf and I were trying to guess how many I'd get. I thought maybe 2 big pieces, and he thought maybe 3 moderately sized pieces. The dish came with 5 moderately sized pieces. The boyfriend's 12oz filet, however, was on a whole different level, and I couldn't stop eating his food. Juicy, tender, not overcooked (he got medium rare). It was the best steak the both of us have ever had. Seriously, TRY THE STEAK!
Great experience. The service the food...wow . I can go on and on but you must experience it yourself. The steak, the Gouda mac and cheese, lobster mash....

If you enjoy a good steak there is no better place than this.

I do consider myself a foodie and have dined at some of the best restaurants in North America and Ocean Club ( Scottsdale ) remains my favourite.

I have been dinning here for approximately 8 years now and they have never disappointed me. 

Some of my favourites are :
