The filet mignon
The clear lobster roll
Lobster mashed potatoes 

The service 

The live music 

If you have been to any of Mastro's restaurants in other cities do not let that 
be your deciding factor. I have been to most and there is no other like Scottsdale.

I cannot say enough about this restaurant.
Absolutely the best steakhouse and sea food restaurant 

This is a true 5 star

Located inside the upscale Shops at Crystal, Mastro's has an amazing wooden lattice structure that you can choose to dine in rather than inside. But hey we're here for the food right? 

The seafood here is top notch and as fresh as it gets. 

Everything from the amazing crab cakes, to the scallops, and outrageously fresh king crab legs were any seafood diners dream come true. The Chilean Sea Bass was perfectly cooked and super flaky and buttery.

Warm Butter Cake, their signature dessert, is worth saving room for. 

On top of that, service was one of the best I've ever had in any restaurant. Super attentive but not overly fawning - they were always there at the right time.
Excellent meal and service. I enjoyed the bone in filet that was so flavorful. Paired it with a bottle of Silveroak Cabernet.

The appetizing cuisine offerings at this restaurant were absolutely wonderful. Enjoyed a delectable steak, calamari , crab legs, and the strawberry shortcake brought out for my husband's birthday was to die for. Had a wonderful outing  catching up with friends and enjoyed the cuisine and exciting atmosphere. Service was great, was kind of surprised when asked if we all wanted butter on our steak ended up coating 60.00. Be aware of thia when asked, as it was not disclosed. Not a huge deal, but come on butter for 60.00,  really? Other than that, enjoyed our dinner, pleasant ambiance, and hanging out with friends.

My husband and I stopped at Maestro's several weeks ago on a Friday. Although we didn't have a reservation, we were seated fairly quickly and at a nice table. The service was spot on throughout our meal. My husband ordered the larger lobster and said it was amazing. Unfortunately my meal was deplorable. I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass. I've had this fish enough to know that I was served something else. Chilean Sea Bass is a white flakey fish. This was more like a tilapia at the Sea bass price. Furthermore it was under cooked. We ordered a side of Brussel Sprouts which were basically burnt.  I basically left my meal. I should have sent it back especially for the price. I would have given a lesser rating except for the exceptional service and my husband's lobster meal. We will not be back. I had higher expectations.
Awesome food! Awesome service. Came back here twice on our Vegas visit! Will be visiting again!

We came here just for the butter cake. It was heavenly. The cake was soft and crunchy, the ice cream was melting with the warm cake and was lovely. The whipped cream was fresh and had thick- butter like texture but was amazing. The only thing wrong with my visit was that Aria was testing the fire alarms. There was not sound, but the fire alarms were flashing. You couldn't notice the lights outside of mastros because the surrounding area was bright, but inside of mastros the lights were very dim and it was dark. The flashing lights stood out and gave me a headache. Other than that, the cake was great.
Wonderful food, don't miss the pretzel rolls & not that expensive for lunch.

Where to start, we have been here a couple of times now drinks and dinner and every time it just impresses me even more. My first introduction was on a friday night "date night"  with the hubby about two months ago we had already eatin dinner but wanted a night cap and we heard there was live music in the bar area, so we thought we would give it a try...We arrived about 9:30 pm and this place was packed!

So we looked around for a table to sit and saw one that was about to open and one of the girls that was working there welcomed us and said she would get that table set for us and she would be right over to get us started :)

With a couple of suggestions from Brittany K. our server we decided it would be a blueberry martini and a great glass of wine. Okay here is the greatest part the whole night, the bar is suddenly watching us when my drink arrives because this martini is served with dry ice in it and it is all misty and mysteroius and every one is like what is that.... my response is one of the best damm martini's and prersentation I have ever seen! So with that said this was the perfect way to end date night, great drinks, great service from brittany K, and oh yeah some great music from a live band... We loved it so much we have made it a point to go back and have dinner and of course for more cocktails...Dinner review below!

Okay so obvoiusly this place is renowned for its food and after having dinner I know why, from the start of our evening to the end of our dinner this place does not miss a beat and our server Chris Frazier like "smokiing joe" he said is a professional at what he does.

His suggestions for appetizers down to the main course to the heavenly butter cake at the end( which is to die for) were spot on....

We started with the shrimp cocktail and the presentataion and taste of this south of the border creation was truly the best we have had. For dinner my husband of course did the filet, like he always does when we go ut for dinner and I decided on the Vanilla Battered Twin Lobster Tails...OMG these must of been the biggest tails I have ever seen, and they were amazing...Oh yeah the hubby said his filet was one of the bttere ones he has had which is saying a lot because he has had a ton of filets in his life, like I said that is all he ever orders :)

So we couldn't make up our mind of whether or not to have dessert but Chris our server said they have this butter cake dessert that will make you want to come back in just for that, and he was not kidding this is truely something every one should mark of their bucket list..AMAZING

Either way way we have been back in for cocktails and yes the butter cake and every time has been great...this place is on our radar and in our regular rotaion, what took us so long to go here, is the only question I keep asking myself?
 
So kudos to the staff at Ocean's Club and especially Chris and Brittany who we have seen again and to the Manger Frank who has come by and welcomed us back, you all do a fantastic Job...We will so you soon!

I died, went heavenward, then came back and ate more butter cake & its accompanying cloud of fresh whipped cream. This place is exceptional. Clean, chilled Belvedere martini. Spicy Mambo salad (chilled chopped romaine hearts with grated parmesan; a horseradishy/wasabied Caesar of sorts) to start & bone-in 22 oz ribeye for my beauhunk & seabass for me. Ambiance is stellar. A terrific experience from start to finish. Thank you Mastro's!

I really enjoyed the food - esp the bone marrow dish.

I want to give them a five but they didn't not earn it due to service.

It is a good place but the service was a bit "elite" feeling.  I felt they could have accommodated our party better than they did.

Good however is excellent.

The scene:   Viagra central.  Aging men with hair plugs and untucked dress shirts sipping house merlot.  Nieces and third wives clinging to hope.  Lurkers awaiting a free bar stool.

The food at Mastro's is actually pretty good.  Steak is excellent.  Side dishes of vegetables are well portioned and good.  Wine list is over priced.  Great bread service.   Very attentive service.  

However, on a Friday the bar area is a cesspool of Alpha-males and their prey.  It is a bizarre scene.  Maybe that's why we went in the first place.

The food here is pricey, but well worth it. The sides are served family style so you may only need two or three for the whole table. The steaks are perfectly cooked and the cuts of meat are the best of quality.

This particular location offers a cool area to sit in if you are fortunate enough to be seated there. It is a pod-like structure that is in the middle of the hotel atrium. It feels very cool and adds to the experience.

If you are looking to go big, this is a great place to do it!

Possibly the best meal we have ever had. Ahi Tuna Tostada was flawless. Also had the Sea Bass and Alaskan Halibut. Oysters Rockefeller came out with a strange smell but I think it was the shells on the 400 degree salt. Once it cooled off smell went away and the oysters were as fresh as I have ever enjoyed. Outstanding Restaurant.

Our most recent dining experience at Mastros was 3/29/15. We were a party of 4. We were seated promptly upon arrival under "the cage". That is an open covering cavelike to soften the views of the Mall as it is located in the Crystal Mall in City Center. Crazy. Most of us ordered steaks and Calamari for an appetizer. The appetizer took FOREVER to appear! Ok, forgiven because it was excellent. Moving on. The steaks, for the most part, were fine except for one which needed less raw. Yes, I said raw! All side dishes are a la carte, so sharing is a must. The dinners are served on near bare plates with no presentation at all, so whatever. 
All in all, not bad, but for the price a little bit more effort is in order. I will say our server did her best to cover up the mis-steps and I appreciate that effort. Unfortunately, she should not have to.

Enjoyed our anniversary dinner here recently and the only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that I think it's too high for what you receive.  Yes, it's in the Kierland area alongside Dominicks, Mortons Eddy V's, etc., but overall I think it's high for seafood.  We have enjoyed all of the other Maestro steak houses but hadn't yet tried Ocean Club. We were there on a Monday night and it was still a busy place for a weekday.  Bar  area is gorgeous, and they have live music every night of the week.  We sat at a table in the bar so we could listen to the music and it was not too loud so that we could still talk and enjoy ourselves.  Service was stellar, Nick was our waiter and he did a great job. The menu is seafood primarlly and steaks which are prepared the same at any of the Maestro properties (City Hall and Mastro's Steakhouse)..The seabass was outstanding and hubby had the ahi tuna...we shared a salad and lobster mashed potatoe as a side (everything is big enough to share) and a great bottle of wine...Butter cake is to die for so don't miss that.

Amazing all around! Food was extraordinary and the staff was friendly.

Had an issue with our leftovers getting lost, so they made us a whole new meal to take home and were extremely apologetic.

5 star class all the way. Not only was the food amazing and the design of the restaurant but service was superb too. All portions were very big. My lamb was to die for. Ambiance out of this world. I normally do not eat bread but I just had to here.
We went for dinner last night and the food and service was excellent. Would definatly reccomend. They went overboard for our special occasion. Great dinner.

Outstanding food and service.  Even the bread basket was delicious!  I was wary of eating at a restaurant in the middle of a mall, no matter how fascinating it looks.  But everything was delicious!  I ordered a Lemon Drop, and they put a little dry ice on the bottom of the glass and serve it table side.  The drink starts to bubble and smoke.  It tasted refreshingly yummy!  There were 4 of us.  We ordered The Lobster Bisque, Mussels, Tuna Tartar, and a Cesar salad for appz.  OMG.  Delicious!  As another reviewer pointed out, if you order a main dish, like the Sea Bass, it will come all by itself on a plate.  So order some side dishes.  The waiter will plate it up for you at your table.  We were so stuffed that we didn't have room for dessert.  Bummer, because I'm sure it would have been yummy.  Our bill was around $475 with tip.  So not too bad with all that we had, including cocktails and wine.

We love it here.  Food is amazing and the service is some of the best we've experienced.  Both times that we've been here the ambiance was enhanced with live music - which was great.  My only complaint is that it's a 'place to be seen' in the bar area - so it's tough to grab a drink and chat before dinner because it is SO crowded.  If you want a popular place to meet singles or go for a 'night out', hit the bar here.  We usually stick to the restaurant area and we love the food and service.  Just be prepared for the party crowd in the bar!

I really wish I could give this place 5 stars because the food was very good and it is in a convenient location.  I would definitely recommend coming here, but our party made reservations well in advance and we still had to wait over an hour for our table to open up.  We weren't apologized to and everything seemed a bit frantic. Our party had an eventful day in Vegas, so we had a lot to talk about in our extended wait, but it still shouldn't happen to people that made reservations. Upside: BUTTER CAKE

Kind of seems like corporate poaching or corporate synergy that fuels this establishment next to the large Westin Kierland corporate hotel.  The experience kind of feels like a sales push where each separate item is a separate cost, and each customization is extra, and the message conveyed by the staff is hard to follow, because it's loud and they go quick assuming you know the options and don't care about the cost!! 

The pace was good and service good enough, and I'm optimistic I can upgrade to 4 starts after trying this place again with some experience with this kind of corporate steakhouse under my belt.

Bread and lobster gnocchi were hits. Sea bass was okay but with other strong flavors on the table i couldn't appreciate it. Maybe it's better if you cover it in cheese or something with the added customization..

The food is absolutely amazing and we always request a professional, personable server by the name of Shawn Feeny.  He is a great guy that makes the experience all that better.  Highly recommend this establishment.  Their Filet and Crab legs are wonderful and cooked to perfection.  The ambiance gives a sense of relaxation, yet it is a fine dining restaurant which I find appealing.

Was here exactly one week ago with a group- about 10 of us, girls and guys (what was left over from a combined bachelor/bachelorette weekend). My husband and I are from Chicago and the Mastros here is my FAVORITE restaurant in the world (see review)- so I came to this one with really high expectations. First off our server, Tim, was phenomenal! So friendly, quick, and informative with every question we had. Next was the food, which was just as I expected- amazing. Husband had the bone in filet, and I did the halibut. Both delicious! I tried my girlfriends sea bass and that was awesome too. We all split a ton of apps and sides, and finished off with butter cakes for the table. Food coma heaven! 
The only thing lacking was the atmosphere. (Why I knocked off 1 star) we were expecting a loud, energetic "Vegas" style restaurant (much like the one back home here in Chicago) But it was very quiet, bright, and just low energy. More suitable for a quiet dinner with your significant other, not a crazy group of 8 guys and 2 girls lol. But hey maybe that's the feel this Mastros is going for, which I can totally appreciate.

Perfect first experience at Mastro's! Went there to celebrate our anniversary and they really did make it feel like a special occasion. We were seated in the treehouse - beautiful and romantic, great date spot. 
Really unique cocktail list -definitely not the usual boring drinks. I tried the blueberry martini, didn't really care for the taste since I prefer sweet drinks, but it was strong and something different. Cocktails were a little pricey at about $18 each, but you pay for the ambiance. 
Started w escargot, I've never had it served in the shell before. Very pretty and delish - served w clarified butter and garlic. Great selection of yummy breads too. 
We shared the 18oz bone in Kansas city strip w twin lobster tails (1 butter poached, 1 vanilla tempura fried). Sides - twice baked potato and brussel sprouts w bacon. Steak was cooked perfectly medium, tender, juicy and flavorful. They knew we were sharing so everything was split for us. Poached lobster was good, cooked perfectly. The tempura lobster... mmm I'm not a huge fan. It was good, but a LOT of batter and I didn't really get even a hint of vanilla. Glad we decided to try it both ways. 
Twice baked potato was good, but I've had better. They didn't bring it out till about 10min after the rest of the food because the chef didn't like how the first one looked, so he made a new one. They took it off the bill w out us asking. Nice that the chef has attn to detail vs just cranking out the orders. Brussel sprouts used to be fried w pancetta but they recently changed the menu, so no more pancetta. They did accommodate by doing it w bacon instead, but not really the same - thin sliced bacon just can't compare to chunks of pancetta.
We got the butter cake comp since it was an anniversary. Super cute of them to do a candle. The cake is enough for 3 or 4 to share, served w vanilla ice cream and a huge bowl of fresh whipped cream. So bad, but soooo good! 
Service was excellent, our server Mike was friendly and knowledgeable. The rest of the wait staff were great too. I checked out our neighbors food, I'm looking forward to trying the seabass, seared tuna, or crab salad next time. 
In the end there's not a huge difference w steak joints - they generally serve the same cuts, appetizers and sides. But Mastro's stands apart with its service and intimate classy ambiance.

The overall design is impressive.  It was busy on a Friday night, and the staff was very attentive.  They are busting their ass all night long.  We had the seafood tower which was good.  The horseradish sauce that came with it was tasty.  I had the pan seared Chilean sea bass which was divine.  Every bite melted in my mouth like butter.  The seasoning was perfect.  The lobster mash was good, but the lobster was over cooked and a bit rubbery.  Overall It was good.

I came here with a part of 7 this evening. The service is excellent the food is great lots if attention to detail how everything is delivered in a timely manner. Our waiter was excellent and took good care of my table. Keep on going guys. I sure to come back soon. Cheers

This place is phenomenal.

Breathtaking when you walk in... just like then 1st time i walked in to XS the nightclub. Absolutely breathtaking.

I had the bone in filet mignon. It was cooked perfectly!!! but honestly it really needs sauce. not the type of steak you can eat by itself. maybe next time ill try ribeye. But with sauce its good.

SEAFOOD TOWER WAS INCREDIBLE!!!! Lobster Cocktail & Oysters were great. They use blue point oysters.

Lobster Mash was good.

For Dessert, the CHOCOLATE PUDDING CAKE WAS THE BEST!!!! Very similar to a Chocolate Lava Cake. Outstanding.

I love this place. Its so beautiful and it really represents living the good life!!! 

Service is great. They have like 5 people waiting on your table, bread person, server, drink person. everything. Great great service.

Seating was quick. Probably because City Center is new. I am enjoying it though & i am not looking forward to when this place gets packed. LOVE IT!!! GOTTA TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE EXCLUSIVITY WHILE IT LASTS!!!!!!!!!!!!

Keep in mind this is the first steakhouse I've ever been to that was more than $50 per person so I'm easily impressed.
Off the bat I felt out of place in my "los pollos hermanos" graphic t-shirt, basketball shorts, and flip flops, but they made me feel welcome anyways.
The service was nuts, by the time I entered and had my plate of food, I was probably introduced to like 8 different people, all of them friendly and accomodating. They work super fast and efficient too, the lady swooped around behind me and refilled my water without me even noticing. When they brought out our food, they had a person for each plate, and put it all on our table within a few seconds. I was like daaaayuuummm sooonnnn. food was great too.

We had some wine, a cocktail, Escargot, Shrimp Sushi, NY steak with truffle butter,  Mushrooms and Casserole potatoes.  We did have 2 cups of coffee at the end as well.  Bill was $227 and $45 tip.  Was well worth it.  One of the best dinners we have had in a long time.  The service was beyond, over the top, amazing; just friendly as hell.  The atmosphere is nice, not the nicest, but it is an upper-class mall.

Our Server was Matt, we do not remember the chef that night.

It's tough to find a more elegant place with better food than this. From the incredible service and attention to detail to the wonderful selection of meats and seafood.

We started with several appetizers, all that were amazing. The steak I ordered was prepared to perfection and the sides were impecable. The lamb dish was the best I have ever eaten and everything was perfect. It's hard to leave room for desert but you absolutely have to because the deserts are as incredible as the meals.
Great place for excellent steaks and seafood. Similar to Capital Grille Flemings or Ruth Chris. Excellent quality food service drinks and atmosphere. Can't go wrong.

I'm not sure where their high ratings come from. At the price they sell main courses ($35-$60) which includes no sides at all but just a piece of fish or meat is ridiculous as even then it's just a piece of meat - no interesting garnish or sauce even on the plate. 

The quality of the fish was ok but we too don't live on the coast and the fish at our local Whole Foods is as good or better than here. Also their beef was just that - ok but I know our local store sells as high of quality. 

Was pissed that this place charged $20 for an heirloom tomato salad and served it with the tomatoes cold as if straight from a fridge. Who the hell does that? The tomatoes should be stored at room temperature anyway and I certainly don't want a cold tomato salad. Weak and almost embarrassing for the restaurant. 

The vegetable sides are about as generic as you can get and available almost anywhere. Brussels sprouts, green beans, garlic mashed potatoes -  not interesting nor were they very good. 

Not sure if their high ratings come from people that live way outside a major city or maybe in live the middle of the country where chain restaurants are the only option but this place was downright shameful for the price and for the generic food preparation. Almost like they have no head chef running things but just an expediter slinging out the same old stuff every day and never thinking to change or improve things. 

Bill was around $120/person. No problem if it was an amazing meal (or even above average) but again I could've cooked it better at home for 1/3 the price. 

I guess this restaurant will keep cashing in on people don't who know any better or want the most simple uninspiring food on the planet.

Wow!!  Ashley and Mario were the best!!  They took very good care of us on my wife's birthday. It was a great evening!!  Not for those who are not up for spending a ridiculous amount of money for one meal. ... but Ashley and Mario made it worth it.
This is my favorite restaurant in las vegas..the staff is perfect and managers are the best
Excellent service and food prep as expected from this top shelf eatery. Best Steaks and Seafood. Extensive wine list.

Hubby took me here for velentines day. Must say, he got a big wet kiss for picking this place. Very fancy & romantic with it's dim lighting. We sat by the piano bar where a live band was playing that evening. Made me reminisce of restaurants in NYC. Service was top notch, even on a busy evening. Great wine selection. We decided on a bottle of Cabernet which was excellent! Sorry, forgot the name. Hubby had rib eye steak while I had the Chilean Seabass. We shared two sides of gorgonzola Mac n Cheese and wasabi mashed potatoes. I was expecting a dime size meal but I was mistaken. Portions are very reasonable! I am not a meat neater but holy mother of god...that steak was ammmaazziing! Perfectly cooked medium rare and it just felt so good in my mouth! So tender and well seasoned. My seabass was also good but I prefer Eddie Vs version. Don't get me wrong, I still enjoyed this. Tasty & just kinda melted in my mouth like butter. However, the sides didn't do too much for me. Too much melted cheese on top. All I got was a big chunk of cheese with every bite which tastes like rubber band especially when it cools down. I was also expecting to taste some wasabi in the mashed potato but didn't taste a hint of it whatsoever. Regardless, we had a great experience & would definitely come back to try the other dishes this fine restaurant has to offer.

Place is busy as hell but they set us up at the bar and the service was unreal.  They did not miss a step.   
Unfortunately we ordered a 3 pound lobster  tail and it came out like cooked leather, but without question they replaced it with 2 smaller but perfect tails.  Thanks for a good birthday dinner.
Some restaurants get it, make the customer happy with no excuses. We will be back for sure!!!!

Exceptional service. Open past 10pm for late dinner.
I was in Las Vegas for my birthday weekend and my friend and I were looking for a nice dinner at 10pm. It is hard to find a steakhouse open past 10pm but we found Mastro's and I am so thankful. 

We started with the lobster cocktail and it is huge. The lobster claws went past my expectations. And mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts with our 22 oz ribeye. 

The only bad thing is the location, it is right in the mall which I am not a fan of, but it is conveniently located on the strip. And the architecture is beautiful and modern.

My favorite place to dine in Las Vegas!

(1) Service - I forgot his name but awesome, awesome server! Best service ever. He was hot too! Drools! 5 stars for amazing service and seating me with a hot server.

(2) Seafood Tower - massive shrimp, king crab, lobster, three types of oysters, and massive mouth jizzy. 

(3) Bone-In Ribeye - mouth jizz... must get! 5 stars

(4) Lobster Mash Potato - one of my favorite dishes. Drenched in BUTTER... yum! 5 stars

(5) Asparagus - well cooked! 5 stars!

(6) Bone Marrow - 5 stars!

(7) Alaskan King Crab Black Truffle Gnocchi - 5 stars

(8) Birthday Chocolate Cake - I got this for free... so sweet of them... but it wasn't my birthday... I think they gave it to the wrong person.

(9) Coffee - a little weak... I wanted a strong one... so I can get ready for the clubbb... yeahhhhh... woots!

OVERALL** Yup! That was all for 2 people... haha! I eat a lot! Massive bill... but worth every of my penny!

Little late on this review, but didn't want to miss out on saying how wonderful this beautiful new restaurant is. Service was impeccable. Seafood tower was delicious and our steaks were perfectly prepared. Not a sea bass eater, but was told it was one of the tastiest. A don't miss Vegas experience.

Dined here for my boyfriend's birthday on 7/9 and I have to say, this was the best experience ever! I was able to make a last minute reservation for the night of, as we were vacationing in Vegas for the weekend. We were escorted to our table right upon our arrival. The wait staff was awesome! For drinks, I ordered the Lemon Drop Martini which is served over dried ice; he ordered a Strawberry Pina Colada (which isnt on the menu but they made something to match his desire) For dinner, My baby ordered the 22oz rib eye, I ordered the swordfish with a side of lobster mashed potatoes. We cleaned our plates, and couldn't take anymore. However, we did! The birthday dessert was better than anything we have ever tasted... We would definitely dine her again! A beyond amazing experience...

We wanted to try this restaurant after a friend highly recommended to us. My first impression is service was top notch. Our waiter was friendly, and informative on the dishes. Throughout the night, the waiter constantly address our needs without having to ask. We ultimately decide on the sea bass, lobster mash potatoes, rib eyes bone in,  scallops, brussel sprouts with bacon and butter cake. 

Lobster mash 5/5 - must have if you are fan of mash potatoes. The taste and texture of the dish is perfection. 

Sea bass 3.5/5 - The sea bass was pan seared crispy on the outside, but it was also lacking little seasoning. The dish was a bit disappointing to me due to a lot reviews saying so much great things about it. 

Scallops 5/5 - The scallops was my favorite dish of the night. Very much like how the sea bass was cook, and 

Brussel sprouts with bacon 3.5/5 - they cooked the brussel just the way I like it. It was crispy in the outside and soft in the side. There was a few piece that was burn and left a bitter taste, but the one that isn't taste very well. 

Bone in ryebye 4/5- the streak was delicious , but it wasn't anything speical.


The overall quality and service was amazing. At the end of the night I was highly satisfied!

My friend wanted to have a steak and we decided to try Mastro. This was one of the best steaks I've ever had. Their fried calamari had a perfect touch of spices and was amazing. You do not even need a dip for it.
Great food and great ambiance. Love this mastro's location. Have tried the ones in Malibu and LA and this location definitely is consistent with the brand.

Celebrated my birthday with 4 ladies this evening. It has been my experience at other restaurants that waiters do their best to ignore serving women because they expect a lousy gratuity. Not here; the service was excellent by Robert and our food delicious. Our steaks arrived perfectly cooked, hot and juicy.  The butter cake is not to be missed! In the last couple of months I have eaten at Maestro's Beverly Hills, Palm Springs and now Las Vegas. You can't go wrong!

I had been to the cougar den a/k/a the bar at this location before, but never dined in the restaurant, so the bf and decided to check it out, as City Hall is one my favorite restaurants.  Our reservation was at 7:45pm on a Friday, we were finally seated around 8:30.  They were clearly running behind schedule.  However, it was a nice touch that they offered all the waiting guests a glass of champs.  Classy move!  

We were seated next to a big table and they were SUPER loud, so if you're in the mood for a quiet and romantic evening, be sure to request a table away from the bar area and not right next to larger tables.  The bf and I get excited when we see lobster bisque and clam chowder on menus, so I started with the clam chowder and he had the lobster bisque.  Surprisingly, considering this is a seafood restaurant and the high price point, they were both just okay.  Not bad, but definitely not the best we've had.  For our entrées, I had the scallops and the bf had the swordfish Oscar style.  Both were really good!  The scallops were large and plump.  Although the sauce they were in was good, I almost felt like it was a little too heavy for the scallops.  Maybe I'm just a purist -- I like my scallops sautéed in butter and garlic.  But the dish was still good.  We also had the sautéed spinach and lobster mashed potatoes as sides.  The lobster mashed potatoes is a favorite of ours from City Hall, and even at $35, they're worth it!  Large chunks of lobster and puddles of butter -- it doesn't get much better than that.  We would have normally finished off with the butter rum cake, another of our favorites from City Hall, but we were so stuffed that we couldn't eat anything else.

Our server, who was awesome all evening, brought our check and informed us they had comp'd my glass of wine and then taken off an extra $20 because we had to wait so long.  So that was $40 off our bill -- awesome!  Another classy move!  And to top it off, I received a voicemail from the hostess the following morning following up on our experience!  I originally would have put this review in the 3.5 star category, but the service is so outstanding that it is definitely worthy of 4 stars!

Although it is called Mastro's OCEAN Club, I actually think that one may be better off getting Steak here.  I had the Sea Bass and felt as though it was pretty dry and maybe over cooked.  The appetizers / sides were all good, but the highlight for me was the dessert.  I had the vanilla cake, and it was outrageously good.  It was like a chocolate lava cake, but vanilla.  I never had anything like that before, and it was great.  If the main dish was better, Mastro's would be a 4 star meal.

The prices were what one would expect.  By no means is it a cheap meal, but it was "A-OK" (for the price).  This has to be rated based on cost / enjoyment.

Great food and the service was excellent! They ran out of the steak my husband wanted and the manager came to our table and gave him a bigger steak no extra charge. Very nice man. Our server was also super friendly. Thank you for the great experience!

I'm not typically one to write reviews but I was so blown away by my dining experience here, I felt compelled to share. I will start by saying the service was truly over the top. We were seated immediately upon arrival and we never waited for anything. Our server, Elizabeth, greeted us promptly, explained the menu, and brought our drinks and a warm bread basket. In addition, there were many other "wait staff" assisting all of the tables. The minute our glasses were empty, someone was right there ready to fill it. In all of my years of fine dining, I've never experienced service quite like this...not to mention, it was prime time on a Friday evening so it's not like they weren't busy.

Now, aside from the top-notch service, the food was out of this world! The jumbo sautéed sea scallops were cooked to perfection, with a delicious garlic sauce. The filet mignon was so tender, it just melted in your mouth. I've been craving it ever since we left! We thought we were full but when that warm butter cake came out....O-M-G. Best dessert I've ever eaten in my life! All I can say is, it's a good thing we ate here on our last night because I would have wanted to go back a few times! I researched the other locations and found one in NYC. I'll be going there in March and I'm looking forward to another fantastic meal!

I highly recommend this restaurant. I would give it 10 stars if I could...and a special thank you to our server, Elizabeth, for making this such a memorable dining experience

At the hostess stand they have a sign that reads 3% surcharge will be added to every guest charge due to the raise of minimum wage.  This place charges $87 for a lobster tail and $13 for a side of fries.  They should be grateful for their employees and their hard work and they can afford to pay them more then minimum wage without asking for it from the customers.  I don't respect any place that pays their salt and vinegar French fries more than their employees, I don't care how good the food is.

MY ALL TIME FAVORITE RESTAURANT ON THE STRIP!  I bring my parents every year for their birthday & I go on my birthday as well!  The food is PHENOMENAL  & the service is even better!  The dungeness Crab Cocktail is AMAZING!  Oh & their Chilean Sea Bass is literally the BEST I've EVER had....if you get it pan seared, it literally just MELTS in your mouth!  Oh & their warm butter cake....simply to DIE for!

It was back to Mastro's in The Nest to dine well before seeing Cher, and once again complimentary Pretzel Bread was of the highest quality, and Vanilla Battered Shrimp with tangy Cocktail Sauce and mild Mustard Sauce offered a fine, unusual start to a memorable meal.  Silky Boston Clam Chowder with celery, clams, and potato chunks was tasty if a little peppery.  And a Warm Spinach Salad with a lot of egg, bacon, Red Onions, & Bleu Cheese Crumbles was quite large and very good.

My 6 oz. Prime Grade Filet Mignon was perfectly medium rare as ordered; the Bearnaise Sauce that went with it was just as outstanding as before; and warm pre-cracked king Crab Legs dipped in Drawn Butter were a perfect counterpoint to the beef.  My 1 lb. Baker with butter, chives & bacon was too big for me to handle, but I enjoyed what I ate.  And Warm Butter Cake with the texture of Carrot Cake a la mode beautifully topped off a meal that met high expectations.

Service was exemplary, with water and Iced Tea glasses regularly filled and refreshed, and crumbs whisked off our table, as a matter of course.  But I was a bit startled to encounter a bathroom attendant in the restroom upstairs who pours soap on your hand, and awaits a tip in a tip jar, which brought back echoes of classic Vegas of yesteryear.

Wow.  Our server Robert, wow.  AMAZING experience.  We got there late at 6:15pm and had a show starting at 7:30pm.  That essentially leaves an hour.  Despite the busy night, despite me being all over the place in hurry to get in and out, he did an exceptional job!  

Best steak ever!!  Prepared perfectly, on the warmest (okay, hottest) plate for an additional temp if needed.  The Lobster Mashers are totally worth the $39!  But the Butter Cake, I could live off that!  

Great experience!  You must ask to be sat in the "treehouse", but don't beg like me... Hahah.

I've only been to one steakhouse before this and I wasn't too impressed, but I decided to give this place a shot since our friends were really excited for some fine dining in Vegas. 

Our group of eight was seated at a round table underneath the massive open-air structure. 

The lobster mashed potatoes were so buttery and delicious. This was a table favorite and it was devoured in minutes. I honestly think the garlic mashed potatoes would have probably tasted just as good and would have been much cheaper. 

The 22oz bone-in ribeye was enormous. My friends and I were joking how maybe half the steak would just be bone, but it turns out we were sorely wrong .The bone was maybe 4-5 ounces and the rest of it was delicious, flavorful meat. I opted for medium rare, my friend opted for rare, and I think most of the table preferred the medium rare since it had more flavor although the rare meat was more tender. It really depends on your steak preferences.

The dessert was butter cake. The first couple bites I thought were way to sweet, but that's why it came with a side of heavy whip cream. Top the dessert with the whip cream and it really tones down the sweetness.

The things that stood out the most was the ambiance and quality of food.

This restaurant in a tree house was an all around great experience. The service from start to finish was top notch, our food was so good, table side prep and presentation was perfect. A true fine dining experience. Most important thing was the home made whipped cream! If it's winter time have a hot chocolate with this whip cream on it if it's summer put it on anything and everything. We ate it by itself!!!!

LOUD! We were first seated in the dining room right next to the piano/singer in the bar. I had to ask twice to be moved to somewhere more quiet because I could not be heard over the singer. Fortunately we were seated shortly away from the bar, but the noise level was still very high. I would not return no matter how good the food just because of the noise level.

The food. We split a Caesar salad, which was OK but too salty and over dressed. We had to ask for some bread. My wife loved her scallops. My swordfish was very thick and looked delicious. It, however, was a little over cooked, and fairly bland. It did not have that grilled flavor I love on fish. The waiter recommended the lobster mashed potatoes ($38), so we got that and the green beans with slivered almonds. If you do not absolutely love lobster, take the $10 baked potato instead. I do not like my veggies over cooked, but the beans were way under done. After dinner decaf coffee was just OK and served in a large cup, but we not offer a refill until we were ready to leave. Key Lime Pie was a large slice, but I've had much better.
Simply bad service from the waitress Christina. Ignored and didnt offer a second drink to us thus loosing value to the owners. Second time meeting her and not a fan. Local resident at Crystals.

I went for dinner in 2/15 for anniversary.  Wow this has been the best dinner I have ever had.  Expensive yes.  It's a lot even for Vegas.   It's worth it though for special occasions.  My wife (the boss) still talks about are dinner.
All things aside this place is expensive but worth every penny.. Only thing that matters is save room for the butter cake.. Don't screw it up! Always save room for the butter cake...

warm butter cake!

it is warm
and full of butter
and oh so sweet.

what more can i say?

thank you to the hostess for seating us without a reservation.  if you are just coming for the dessert let the hostess know so that they don't turn you away

Came here for me wedding anniversary 6/14/2018 for the first time and the food was amazing as well as the service, best steak , lobster bisque and lobster mashed potatoes i ever had !!!! I'll definitely be back !!! 10 stars (didn't get a picture of the food) but the cake melted in my mouth omg

Yes I know I am the only person on here to give them 3 stars but please hear me out for my reasoning behind all this. 

On Saturday, I had made reservations for a party of two at 730PM. When he arrived at 720PM, it was not really busy nor was it a ghost town in there. The hostess stand said it would be a moment as they got our table ready and for us to take a seat at the bar, enjoy a cocktail or two and they will get us. 

During our 30 minute wait (yes maybe they were short staffed, not ready yet etc.... which I am ok with) they sat multiple tables of walk-in's and a few reservations of small 2-4 tops. (I know this because a few sat at the bar whom we spoke to and others I over heard when I stood by the hostess stand to wait to check on my table. Off to a bad start..... 

Anyway, we had a nice table overlooking the garden down stairs in the back of the restaurant. All the back-waiters were very prompt and professional with regards to keeping the water glasses full, serving the bread, clearing the table from the right and serving from the left etc... (After working in this industry for years, I get picky about this crap at high end restaurants) The server was pretty on the ball and friendly but a little to relaxed with us. (Yes we are young and eating at a high end restaurant, I am ok with that)

On to the food, below is a list of what we ordered and what I thought about it: 

Calamari App: Lightly breaded with light seasoning. Dipping sauce complimented it very well. 

Fillet Mignon: Very tender and medium rare is more of rare. But it is better to under cook the steak then burn the hell out of it. VERY TENDER, cut with your fork status. 

Sea Bass: Parmesan crusted.... a little on the very fishy side for my taste which overcame the rest of the flavors

Cream of Spinach: Very creamy and just was not my style. Girlfriend liked it though.

Sea salt/vinegar fries: These shoestring cut fries were epic! Yes.... of everything I ate, I was most impressed by the large basket of $10 fries. 

Warm Butter Cake: Once again.... this was the main reason we went here for my birthday and because the other half loves this dessert more than she loves me. :)

Multiple layer chocolate birthday cake: Now to be honest, this was what saved Mastro's from getting the dreadful 2-star rating from me. In my reservation, I had noted "birthday" but no one had seemed to see it. Hell, we even ordered desert and were half way finished with it before they brought out the cake. Personally, did someone at the hostess stand go oops! We need to send a birthday cake over to Table XX immediately even though they already are half way through their dessert? But to be honest, they did and it truly made my otherwise mediocre dining experience in to a pleasant one. 

Overall Mastros.... maybe I set my expectations to high and I understand, you have only been open for a few months now so maybe all the bugs are still getting worked out. In the words of my girlfriend, it was not as good as the Crystal Cove, CA location yet on par with the one in Costa Mesa, CA. 

Sounds like I have to try all this again at the Crystal Cove location and compare! Granted.... thanks for the last minute birthday cake. It was nice to see those little comments on Open Table actually mean something.

I'll just get right to it:

I love their steak. They serve some of the best steak I've ever had. Not exactly my favorite, but it's up there! The sides are just as good. We had creamed corn and garlic mashed potatoes. For appetizer we had oysters.
Service was great! No reservation needed and no waiting. 

Oh, and get the warm butter cake!

Over the top dining experience the food was amazing I ordered the Chilean sea bass with sauteed spinach and garlic mashed potatoes also was surprised with a wonderful dessert with a candle on it for my birthday truly an amazing evening. As I say quality is remembered long after price forgotten.

Super disappointed tonight to not eat here.  Had reservations at 8:15 and they were backed up - told us it would be 15-20 minutes.  Checked back a couple of times and the hostess was a bit aloof.  I assume it was because there were numerous people waiting for their reservations.  Checked back at 8:45 to be told that best case was another 20 minutes....not sure the point in reservations if you don't get to keep them.  Sure the food is good but we left to find something else.

Mastros ocean club Las Vegas really hit it out of the park. Dinning is an experience compiled of food, service and ambiance for me. So when one is missing or lacking it affects the whole experience. Mastros has it all down to a near perfection. Our server was incredible, attentive and funny. The restaurant was beautifully organized and last but not least the food, I have to say, is the best I've had at any mastros. The seafood tower, tomahawk, gnocchi definitely stood out for me and, OF COURSE, the buttercake. What a wonderful experience will for sure return to this location on our next trip to Vegas.

My husband and I love going to Mastros at home so we decided to check out the Las Vegas location. Sadly we were very disappointed. My steak was burnt on the outside but medium rare on the inside. (I ordered medium so I didn't return it) My husband order medium well and it was bleeding all over his plate! The waiter took his three pieces of steak back where it was cooked dry. The brussel sprouts had no flavor and were just dry. I gave two stars because the waiter kept my water glass full. For a $200 meal I expect my food to be cooked properly. I've included a picture of my burnt steak.

We went here a few weeks ago for my mother-in-law's birthday and everything was delicious! I had the scallops and the sauce was amazing! Everyone enjoyed their food and the service was amazing! Great restaurant for special occasions.

It looks like it's all been said before, so I'll keep this short (as much as I can manage) and sweet.  

Impressive digs: the sculptural treehouse dining room is a gem.  The bar is impressive (a two story shelf of bottles).  

The service is absolutely top notch: when we arrived for our 8:30 pm reservations, the hosts apologized but there was going to be a twenty minute delay.  We weren't bothered at all by the wait, but we were still given glasses of complimentary champagne--and we were treated to the restaurant's signature Warm Butter Cake for dessert.  I have absolutely no complaints about the delay in getting seated.  Mastro's handled a difficult situation appropriately, and in my opinion, went above and beyond for myself and the other guests that were also seated late.

My boyfriend and I went all out for dinner and ordered the seared ahi appetizer as well as the Hamachi with Fried Onions.  Please, oh please make sure you get this.  I've never seen anything like it before.  The perfectly fried onions melt on your tongue like butter, and the hamachi was perfect.  What an amazing combination.

We ordered the Bone-In 12 Oz Filet and the 22 Oz Rack of Lamb with a side of Gorgonzola Mac & Cheese and Roasted Brussels Sprouts. 

The proteins were cooked perfectly and were absolutely delicious, but the stand out dish on the table was the flippin' amazing Mac & Cheese.  We talked about it at the restaurant, as we were leaving the restaurant, while we were next door at the Aria casino, on our flight home, and ever since we've been back home.  They are out of this world.  We were so sad that we weren't able to take home the leftovers.

Dessert: what hasn't been said about the Warm Butter Cake already?  Just get it already.

This place is spendy--and totally worth every penny.

Way long overdue review of this fine establishment. Fine dining at its best. Hubby and I had our honeymoon last year from here. We enjoyed every moment of our visit.

The food and service is amaze balls. If you are a steak lover like I'am. Then this place is for you. It's super ultra expensive. I had my New York Strip steak for $57.00 alone. Yes alone meaning you have to order sides for extra cost. But mind you! You are getting the very best in high quality meat. So expect to pay that much. 

The sides comes out in family style in small platters. So you can take out what amount you want. 

The wait staff pays attention to detail about you're visit. The waiters aren't overbearing. Always ask to be seated in the birds nest for an amazing experience. The architecture of the birds nest is truly magical. 

Five stars all around. 

Go get you're steak now.

I've been a huge fan of the Ocean Club since it opened, and I always make an effort to dine here when I'm on the Strip. 

Top notch in every way: service, decor, ambiance, wine list, and happily- the FOOD! 

Highly recommended
This is an example of 5 starts restaurant. Great service, classy environment and hosts, amazing drinks and great food. Yes, it is pricy but it is the best.

This is top notch dining. Located in Crystals at Aria on the 2nd level. Five of us came to celebrate a birthday last night and we requested the "tree house". This is a wooden structure which almost floats in the air, very unique for sure. 

We were seated in the center and were lucky enough to get Paul as our waiter. Paul is everything in a waiter you could ever ask for. Knowledgeable, very attentive, funny and yet professional giving us excellent service during our meal. 

He was helpful when selecting wines as well as explaining the menu. I ordered the dungeness crab cocktail and the 22 oz bone-in ribeye. I love seafood and was planning on the seabass but couldnt resist the ribeye. Our table split sides of gorgonzola mac & cheese, creamed spincach and Gnocci with alaskan king crab. 

The crab cocktail was excellent. Served in a dish with 2 sauces and dry ice it comes out smoking. It was about 10 large pieces of crab ($28). The ribeye was also very good ($58), although a tad to fatty for me. It had good marbling like a ribeye should but parts were a bit too fatty. 3 of us ordered our steaks medium rare and they all came out rare. Beware they do tend to undercook  a bit, but we all finished them as the meat was so good. 

The gorgonzola mac and creamed spinach ($14) were both really good. We were a little disappointed with the gnocci however ($33). I found very little king crab in the dish but the flavor was there. For dessert we ordered 3 of Mastro's famous butter cakes which come with vanilla ice cream. 

Paul was nice enough to personalize one of the plates with a "happy birthday" written in chocolate. The butter cakes were awesome (and quite large). They can easily be split  between two or three people. 

Mastro's provided us an excellent meal with outstanding service. The steaks could have been cooked a little longer but with that being about the only flaw the 5 stars are well deserved.

The food here is sooooooooo GOOD! All I have to say is go here! I had the sea bass and my boyfriend has the halibut and the were both amazing. We also had the tower with crab, lobster oysters and shrimp and everything was great! Highly recommended!

I'm not a seafood lover so something has to be amazing for me to even eat it.  The sea bass at Ocean Club is the most phenomenal thing EVER!  It's shocking to hear that come out of my mouth so you know there must be something special about this sea bass.  The steaks are pretty fantastic too.  And the bread sticks are down-right addictive!  It has great ambiance as well and the piano music is a treat.  I highly recommend it.

How does this place get that many stars. The service is sub-par, the bathrooms are two flights up, and the bartenders don't know a boxed wine from a good wine. I'm sure the food is good but it's been 45 minutes and I still haven't received mine. The steaks just came out but the order was wrong so off they went. I guess the good thing is that the wine numbed my pain due to my empty stomach.

Expect Excellence in food and service. 

Bone in Rib-eye
Gorgonzola Mac and Cheese. 
YUM.

Oh, don't forget your wallet. You're gonna need it. ;-)

Standing on a rooftop, I shout "I absolutely love Mastro's Ocean Club!"  It's my absolute favorite place to dine when visiting Scottsdale.  I've been 4 times, for business and for pleasure (even though this makes it one of the same, 100% pleasure).

The bar is beautiful, reminds me of an Absolute ad of color and things stacked atop of another magnificently, hence that's why I used ABSOLUTE so much.  I can go on and on about Mastro's, the seafood is terrific, and they even have wonderful steaks.  I have heard about the ship to shore to restaurant process, and it's nothing short of phenomenal. 

But what I really want to focus your attention on two things, the Lobster Mashed Potatoes, and incredible, awe inspiring, Seafood Tower.  Focus, FOCUS!

First, the Lobster Mashed Potatoes: creamy, lobstery, and the most perfect mashed potatoes you can imagine (I think they are buttery, too).  They will leave in a state of bliss.  They go perfect with anything you order, seafood and meat dish.  I absolutely adore this.

Second, and without a doubt, the most outstanding thing on the menu, the Seafood Tower.  I've had it small (3-4 items), and I've it large (7-8 items), but I get it each and every time I go to MOC.  They clear the table, fast before your eyes.  Then, they bring out the monstrosity, a tower, 2/3/4 tiers depending on how much is ordered for how many, and the thing is smoking.  Literally.  Served on dry ice (and regular), it's a feast for king.  You have your choice from snow crab claws, crab legs, blue crab, oysters on the half shell, lobster cocktails, jumbo shrimp, lobster tails, among others.  Each and every selection is the freshest thing you can have.  I love it.  I would make sweet love to it!  It's pricey, but worthy of making credit card payments.

It's a chain, I know, but the food and service has always been outstanding.

You can never go wrong with Mastro's. It is the perfect place for a special occasion. We went to this location to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. The bread basket is filled with goodness. The ahi tuna tar tar was excellent. We both ordered the steak and it was delicious! Mashed potatoes and steamed asparagus were Good too. After dinner, they even included a slice of chocolate cake on the house for my boyfriend. Amazing! I highly recommend this place.

12oz. Filet was very consistent with the great reviews this venue is receiving. Bartenders are very knowledgeable and welcoming. Regardless of if it's location in a mall or a hotel, this restaurant has a big future ahead of it.

Our first time at this Mastros.  We've been to others so expectations were high and they lived up to it!

Sat in the Treehouse which is very cool.  Others complained about feeling like you are in the middle of the mall, but it didn't bother us.  Our server Leonel was attentive and very personable.  Outstanding service and he had a sense of humor!

We started with the shrimp cocktail which was fantastic. Sometimes the really jumbo shrimp are chewy but these were tender and tasty.  

Hubby's filet was cooked perfectly and the Mac n cheese is to die for.  I was craving some crab so I had 2 king crab claws of the appetizer menu.  Wow!

Of course you can't go to Mastros without having Butter Cake.  OMG!  It's like no other.

Great meal for a great date night!

Fine Dinning at it's best! Wow! If there was an option to give this place 6 Stars I would! 

Ordered the stemmed mussels to share and I ordered the new york strip steak, medium-well. Mashed potatoes, roasted jalapeños and roasted Brussel sprouts were and excellent choice. 

The steak was probably one of the best steaks (if not the beat) i've ever tasted. Cooked to perfection, tender and juicy and very flavorful. 

jalapeños gave just the right amount of heat. 

The staff and management went above and beyond in order to accommodate our party. 

Overall probably the beat fine dining experience I've ever had although I can't say that I'm a regular at fine dinning places, much the contrary. 

The decor of the restaurant , the ambiance, the food, the staff, the management were all absolutely amazing. 

HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend next time your'e in Vegas.

Love Mastros!
Pricey but worth it!
The Shrimp cocktail is amazing
Just Great!  Mastro's Ocean Club is a must STEAK HOUSE (we weren't there for the Ocean fare), inside this shopping venue.

This place is great! We came here for a company event (~30 people) as we were staying around the corner at the Westin for a few days. We had a cocktail hour in the bar area and then a 3 course dinner in a private section. From start to finish the dinner was flawless and well executed. Definitely one of the best "work event" dinners I've had. 

The atmosphere was very modern, sleek and totally unexpected for a steak and seafood place. I really enjoyed it but once we were seated I saw little of it since we were partitioned away from the rest of the restaurant by huge curtains. 

The cocktail hour started with sushi, sashmi tuna nachos, huge cocktail shrimp, and a couple others. I loved the nachos the best but everything was pretty good and great finger foods (not too messy/difficult to eat). I also had one of the gin martinis off the menu which was very good.. but strong. 

My only complaint is that the appetizers didn't seem to be cohesive with the dinner courses. They were a lot heavier than the apps but equally delicious. I had caesar salad to start which was good as far as caesar salad goes. Filet for main course with family-style sides of mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, and string beans. I liked that they perfectly cooked the steaks for each guest the way they liked and the servers had no trouble keeping track of everyone's steaks. The family style sides were also great so that we were able to all try a little of everything. Finally, I had the signature butter cake which is unlike anything I've ever had. It tasted like a sugar cookie turned into a soft cake and it had a nice caramelized crust on the outside. 

Overall, it was a great experience and I'm glad we finished our trip in Arizona here.

I have to admit, I truly don't think a better steak exists anywhere in the world.  Total perfection.  Also a great (albeit overpriced) wine list and great seafood.  Sadly, however, I find myself totally incapable of dishing out the requisite amount of ass-kissing required to dine and/or receive quality service here.  There's nothing I hate more than eating in a restaurant that acts like you're patronage is somehow inconvenient to them, especially considering the fact that I think my wife and I are pretty low effort, high return customers.  
Ocean Club is worth it on occasion for the awesome food, as much as I hate to admit it.

Nice ambiance but the rib eye was overly seasoned. The brussel sprouts where not oven roasted but burnt. The lobster bisque was excellent but the mac n cheese was dry and not saucy. The only good thing was the two bottles of wine we drank.

Very good.  Cocktail waitresses seem to be a little overly taken with themselves.  Trust me, I've been to  more and better places than you...dial back the 'tude.

Food very good.  Wife has allergies and they've been able to tend to them.  On some nights they have bathroom attendants.  I don't need that.  In concept the idea seems classy.  In practice it's creepy.

This was our second experience at Mastro's and it was better than the first. I am a fan and would highly recommend. Samantha was our server and she hit all the high points. Her attention to detail and insightful explanations make this restaurant a GoTo place in Las Vegas. Thank you

Like a nightmare written by Edgar Allan Poe.  The food was rich in flavor, decadent in appearance.  Yet the service was atrocious.  For absolutely no reason, the staff had a bad attitude.  Maybe their manager treated them badly so they took it out on us all.  My cheerful nature was no match for the bleakness they threw at our table, like a shadow cast across the pristine.  When we received the bill, something we never ordered was on it.  No kidding!  We paid the beggars and left.  Luckily there are a hundred better places less than a 5 minute walk from this unpleasant experience.

We had such fun hanging out here last Friday!!!! Love Mastro's Oceanclub and Steakhouse both in Newport Beach and in Scottsdale.  Oysters time with my boyfriend and a bottle of Justin Cab...yummy yummy and great company with our dear friend celebrating 4th of July belated!!!!!

I was eating there on Sunday June 7 with my family. The atmosphere of the restaurant was really relaxing. Very classy. The waiters were very careful when serving. I ordered the 12 Oz filet. It was AMAZING, the best steak I have every had. I also had the lobster mash potatoes, that was also a very delicious choice. I couldn't finish it all, but shared it. I was very satisfied when I left. They also provided us with a vanilla yellow cake with cream cheese, topped with vanilla ice cream,  strawberries and oranges with homemade whip cream. I loved it! I am definitely going back again!

Went for my friends 50th birthday last week. We all loved it great service delicious food and a complimentary dessert. French portion is huge!!! Definitely on the list for our next visit. Suggest reservation.

Score!

This place is a short 5 minute Uber ride from the Venetian. It is actually located in a metropolis that contains a lot of high end stores. Its located on the second floor overlooking the shopping area. Don't let the location fool you this place is absolutely on the money. The food was absolutely delicious. The service was absolutely amazing. Our waitress was one of the best I've had in a while.The customer base is upscale which is what I expected based on the price. I took my wife here for her birthday so it had to be great. We had Belvedere Martini's, Oysters, Chilean Sea bass, and one of the best deserts I've ever had. They had blue cheese stuffed olives for our martini's which is a sign of a true upscale restaurant. We had such a good time we walked back to our hotel suite. Great food, Great service, comfortable atmosphere. I'm not picky I just know what good is.

Flash.......

First time at Mastro's and loved it!

One appetizer, One bottle of Wine, Two Steaks, Two Sides, Dessert, and Tip =  $300. 

We got the most expensive appetizer and one side was the most expensive, so you can make your adjustments. But look to spend $250 for two people. 

Loved our waiter and they treated us very well.

Had the pleasure of eating at Mastros in Scottsdale for the very first time. I'm not easily impressed with restaurants having owned one myself but I must say the meal was phenomenal. The service exceptional and my bone in filet was absolutely seasoned and cooked to perfection. If you are looking for a restaurant for a special occasion I highly, highly recommend Mastros! The butter cake was to die for. Expensive wine and liquor menu to accompany the meal. Knowledgeable employees that were as pleasant as you could ask for. I'm definitely looking forward the visiting here again. So much so that I'm looking for a reason! Thank you Mastro's and we hope to see you soon. You have restored my faith in restaurants. Hats off to the chef! A little pricey but if you know that going in you going to have a great meal.

the steak i had was terrific.  but the best part was seeing mike tyson there.  i sent him a chocolate cake with the help of my waitress who was super friendly and accommodating.   there was a live piano player playing great tunes the whole time.

In a single word, Awesomeness....  For a restaurant that is part of a chain of restaurants, there's really nothing that can compare to Mastros.  There's nothing chain about the experience or the ambiance of Ocean Club.  

My last visit here was on a night in the middle of the week.  That didn't stop what seemed to be the rest of Scottsdale from coming here for a great evening of food and libations.  When you walk into Ocean Club, there is an ambiance that simply states sophistication and upscale.  

I was fortunate to be on the arm of a dashing and handsome gent as we were joined by another couple.  We were seated promptly for our reservation at a fantastic table that had a great view across the dining room.  The service was impeccable.  We ordered drinks and a bottle of wine suggested by our server.  We ordered a couple of appetizers and we were set for while as we looked over the menu and carried on conversation with our friends.  

My friend and I are pretty easy to please at restaurants like this.  Dare I say, we're pretty predictable.... for me almost always I order sea bass if it is on the menu and my friend 100% orders bone-in filet.  We were in luck, they had both on the menu as a great and amazing establishment like this should.  Their sea bass was as buttery and delicious as it was the first time I had it and all the other times thereafter.

So, the sides are where we usually get somewhat creative.  I suggest the lobster mashed potatoes, so very yummy and succulent and filling.  Not something I would order, but I definitely enjoy when someone else has ordered it at the table!  The garlic mashed potatoes are also tasty.  My friend loves the creamed corn.  My personal favorite is the sauteed spinach.  

For dessert, my friend loves Mastro's butter cake and we never go there without having it.  Again, very tasty and delicious.

This is a place to bring your mom for her birthday or parent's wedding anniversary, a woman that you are with that you care for or just care to get with.  This place is fantastic.  It is truly as good as it gets.  I'm also a HUGE fan of Mastro's Steakhouse.  I'm totally biased, this is the best restaurant chain on the planet.  Period.

We made our annual Christmas visit to the Ocean Club in Scottsdale last night and had yet another fabulous experience. This time we were well taken care of by Nick and his colleagues. My wife had the halibut and I had the big eye tuna. Cherry crisp for desert. I just wish the Ocean Club will open a location in the Washington DC area, which is where I live.,

There are so many good things to say about this place. The food is awesome!!! You really can't go wrong with anything you order. Try their Kobe beef.....sinfully delicious and your eyes will roll to the back of your head!! Melt in your mouth yum yum yummy!!! Warm butter cake is off the hook and so are their chocolate souffles. Wait staff is great...they will always be there when you need them!! As will the bathroom attendants!!! LOL

1.  You need to ask for Cole to be your server! He made our night. 
2. Don't pay attention to the reviews discussing the prices. It's a great restaurant with outstanding food and worth the price 
3. The portions are huge! We came home with a "bag" of doggie boxes! 

Highly recommend.

If you're a seafood lover, you'll absolutely love this place! Mastro's is an elegant dining experience in the centre of the Shops at Crystals.

At our visit, we had the Oyster Rockefeller, Twin Lobster Tails and Pacific Swordfish. The food was absolutely delicious! We were the most impressed with the oysters and lobsters! 

Overall, we had such a positive experience and we would highly recommend Mastro's to all.

I can honestly say I have never been treated so poorly in my entire existence like a lowly guy called Rudy treated my friends and I last night when we went there to celebrate my friend's 40th.  It was a surprise birthday for a friend who is a Neuro-Oncologist that had worked all day long. We had been assured that the restaurant lounge opens till 1pm from a call to them while planning, We got there at 10:30pm and without any sensitivity, Rudy proceeded to be so outrageously rude to our party! It was breathtakingly rude that i was aghast! The birthday girl was so embarrassed and what was meant to be a joyful occasion turned sour instantaneously! I would love to know,  just for sanity sake why Rudy felt justified to treat us that way? Is he racist because were a bunch of women of color? Or sexist because we were women? I'm still baffled hours after the incident.
Between the 6 of us, 4 are medical  doctors and other two are IT specialists. We were not rowdy, were polite throughout the encounter but Rudy chose to act like a crazy jerk and I want answers as to WHY!!

Dined at Mastro's ocean club this evening looking forward to a good piece of fish. I ordered the featured fish Halibut this evening. You have 4 ways to have your fish prepared, baked, pan fried, blackened or "Oreganato" which was described to me as lightly breaded fish with melted butter. That did not sound good to me! Thinking that I was safe having the fish prepared blackened, well I was wrong. The blackened fish had no seasoning and my fish was dry and over cooked. They actually served some form of tarter sauce on the side. Which was not what I usually would have had with a nice piece of fish. Our server was not very helpful and we really felt that the place was way overpriced and our food was typical chain restaurant caliber. No creativity! If you like good quality food with a knowledgeable server who knows what good food is, don't go here!
